Even at that awful moment [Anthea]133-anthea had time to think that it was very like the face of [Mr Jacob Absalom]151-jacob absalom , who had sold [them]278-the children the charm in [the shop near [Charing Cross]19-charing cross]2715-the shop near charing cross . “[692-you] Here is [their]699-their Amulet , ” cried a harsh , strange voice ; “[134-jane] it is this that makes [them]699-their strong to fight and brave to die . And what else have [we]700-we here — [gods]701-gods or [demons]702-demons ? ” [He]0-i glared fiercely at [the children]278-the children , and the whites of [his]0-i eyes were very white indeed . [He]0-i had a wet , red copper knife in [his]0-i teeth . There was not a moment to lose . “[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane , [Jane]134-jane , QUICK ! ” cried [every one]2347-every one passionately . [Jane]134-jane with trembling hands held up the charm towards [the East]32-the east , and [Cyril]131-cyril spoke the word of power . The Amulet grew to a great arch . Out beyond [it]2718-it was the glaring Egyptian sky , the broken wall , the cruel , dark , big‐nosed face with the red , wet knife in its gleaming teeth . Within the arch was the dull , faint , greeny‐brown of [London]2-london grass and trees . “[134-jane] Hold tight , [Jane]134-jane ! ” [Cyril]131-cyril cried , and [he]131-cyril dashed through the arch , dragging [Anthea]133-anthea and [the Psammead]136-the psammead after [him]131-cyril . [Robert]132-robert followed , clutching [Jane]134-jane . And in the ears of [each]2447-each , as [they]2447-each passed through [the arch of the charm]2720-the arch of the charm , the sound and fury of battle died out suddenly and utterly , and [they]2447-each heard only the low , dull , discontented hum of vast [London]2-london , and the peeking and patting of the sparrows on the gravel and the voices of [the ragged baby children]2721-the ragged baby children playing Ring‐o’‐Roses on the yellow trampled grass . And the charm was a little charm again in [Jane]134-jane ’s hand , and there was the basket with [their]2447-each dinner and the bath‐buns lying just where [they]2447-each had left it . “[134-jane] [My]0-i hat ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , drawing a long breath ; “[134-jane] that was something like an adventure . ” “[134-jane] It was rather like one , certainly , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . [They]2447-each all lay still , breathing in the safe , quiet air of [Regent ’s Park]23-regent ’s park . “[134-jane] [We]703-we ’d better go [home]357-home at once , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea presently . “[703-we] [Old Nurse]305-old nurse will be most frightfully anxious . The sun looks about the same as it did when [we]703-we started yesterday . [We]703-we ’ve been away twenty‐four hours . ” “[703-we] The buns are quite soft still , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , feeling one ; “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose the dew kept them fresh . ” [They]2447-each were not hungry , curiously enough . [They]2447-each picked up the dinner‐basket and the Psammead‐basket , and went straight [home]357-home . [Old Nurse]142-old nurse met [them]2447-each with amazement . “[0-i] Well , if ever [I]0-i did ! ” [she]142-old nurse said . “[0-i] What ’s gone wrong ? [You]706-you ’ve soon tired of [your]706-you picnic . ” [The children]278-the children took this to be bitter irony , which means saying the exact opposite of what [you]706-you mean in order to make [yourself]706-you disagreeable ; as when [you]706-you happen to have a dirty face , and [someone]331-someone says , “[706-you] How nice and clean [you]706-you look ! ” “[703-we] [We]703-we ’re very sorry , ” began [Anthea]133-anthea , but [old Nurse]142-old nurse said — “[703-we] Oh , bless [me]0-i , [child]707-child , [I]0-i do n’t care ! Please [yourselves]707-child and [you]707-child ’ll please [me]0-i . Come in and get [your]707-child dinners comf’table . [I]0-i ’ve got a potato on a‐boiling . ” When [she]142-old nurse had gone to attend to the potatoes [the children]278-the children looked at [each other]312-each other . Could it be that [old Nurse]142-old nurse had so changed that [she]142-old nurse no longer cared that [they]278-the children should have been away from [home]357-home for twenty‐four hours — all night in fact — without any explanation whatever ? But [the Psammead]136-the psammead put its head out of [its]136-the psammead basket and said — “[0-i] What ’s the matter ? Do n’t [you]707-child understand ? [You]707-child come back through the charm‐arch at the same time as [you]707-child go through it . This is n’t tomorrow ! ” “[707-child] Is it still yesterday ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane . “[707-child] No , it ’s today . The same as it ’s always been . It would n’t do to go mixing up the present and the Past , and cutting bits out of one to fit into the other . ” “[707-child] Then all that adventure took no time at all ? ” “[707-child] [You]707-child can call it that if [you]707-child like , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “[707-child] It took none of the modern time , anyhow . ” That evening [Anthea]133-anthea carried up a steak for [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s dinner . [She]133-anthea persuaded [Beatrice]157-beatrice , the maid‐of‐all‐work , who had given [her]133-anthea the bangle with the blue stone , to let [her]133-anthea do it . And [she]133-anthea stayed and talked to [him]2353-the learned gentleman , by special invitation , while [he]2353-the learned gentleman ate the dinner . [She]133-anthea told [him]2353-the learned gentleman the whole adventure , beginning with — “[707-child] This afternoon [we]708-we found [ourselves]708-we on [the bank of [the River Nile]39-the river nile]709-the bank of the river nile , ” and ending up with , “[708-we] And then [we]708-we remembered how to get back , and there [we]708-we were in [Regent ’s Park]23-regent ’s park , and it had n’t taken any time at all . ” [She]133-anthea did not tell anything about the charm or [the Psammead]136-the psammead , because that was forbidden , but the story was quite wonderful enough even as it was to entrance [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “[710-you] [You]710-you are [a most unusual little girl]711-a most unusual little girl , ” [he]2353-the learned gentleman said . “[711-a most unusual little girl] Who tells [you]710-you all these things ? ” “[344-no one] [No one]344-no one , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , “[711-a most unusual little girl] they just happen . ” “[711-a most unusual little girl] Make‐believe , ” [he]0-i said slowly , as [one who recalls and pronounces a long‐forgotten word]2730-one who recalls and pronounces a long‐forgotten word . [He]0-i sat long after [she]133-anthea had left [him]0-i . At last [he]0-i roused [himself]0-i with a start . “[0-i] [I]0-i really must take a holiday , ” [he]0-i said ; “[0-i] [my]0-i nerves must be all out of order . [I]0-i actually have a perfectly distinct impression that [the little girl from [the rooms below]714-the rooms below]713-the little girl from the rooms below came in and gave [me]0-i a coherent and graphic picture of life as [I]0-i conceive it to have been in pre‐dynastic [Egypt]21-egypt . Strange what tricks the mind will play ! [I]0-i shall have to be more careful . ” [He]0-i finished [his]0-i bread conscientiously , and actually went for a mile walk before [he]0-i went back to [his]0-i work . [JANE]134-jane was singing to [her]134-jane doll , rocking it to and fro in [the house which [she]134-jane had made for [herself]134-jane and [it]713-the little girl from the rooms below]2731-the house which she had made for herself and it . The roof of [the house]390-the house was the dining‐table , and the walls were tablecloths and antimacassars hanging all round , and kept in [their]2733-their places by books laid on their top ends at the table edge . [The others]325-the others were tasting the fearful joys of domestic toboganning . [You]2735-you know how it is done — with the largest and best tea‐tray and the surface of the stair carpet . It is best to do it on the days when the stair rods are being cleaned , and the carpet is only held by the nails at the top . Of course , it is one of the five or six thoroughly tip‐top games that [grown‐up people]2736-grown‐up people are so unjust to — and [old Nurse]142-old nurse , though a brick in many respects , was quite enough of a standard grown‐up to put [her]142-old nurse foot down on the toboganning long before any of [the performers]2737-the performers had had half enough of it . The tea‐ tray was taken away , and [the baffled party]2738-the baffled party entered [the sitting‐room]2739-the sitting‐room , in exactly the mood not to be pleased if [they]2738-the baffled party could help it . So [Cyril]131-cyril said , “[0-i] What a beastly mess ! ” And [Robert]132-robert added , “[0-i] Do shut up , [Jane]134-jane ! ” Even [Anthea]133-anthea , who was almost always kind , advised [Jane]134-jane to try another song . “[134-jane] [I]0-i ’m sick to death of that , ” said [she]133-anthea . It was a wet day , so none of the plans for seeing all the sights of [London]2-london that can be seen for nothing , could be carried out . [Everyone]319-everyone had been thinking all the morning about the wonderful adventures of the day before , when [Jane]134-jane had held up the charm and it had turned into an arch , through which [they]2741-they had walked straight out of the present time and [the Regent ’s Park]2742-the regent ’s park into [the land of Egypt]2743-the land of egypt eight thousand years ago . The memory of yesterday ’s happenings was still extremely fresh and frightening , so that [everyone]319-everyone hoped that [no one]344-no one would suggest another excursion into the past , for it seemed to all that yesterday ’s adventures were quite enough to last for at least a week . Yet [each]2447-each felt a little anxious that [the others]325-the others should not think it was afraid , and presently [Cyril]131-cyril , who really was not [a coward]2748-a coward , began to see that it would not be at all nice if [he]131-cyril should have to think [himself]131-cyril one . So [he]131-cyril said — “[0-i] [I]0-i say — about that charm — [Jane]134-jane — come out . [We]715-we ought to talk about it , anyhow . ” “[715-we] Oh , if that ’s all , ” said [Robert]132-robert . [Jane]134-jane obediently wriggled to the front of [[her]134-jane house]2248-her house and sat there . [She]134-jane felt for the charm , to make sure that it was still round [her]134-jane neck . “[715-we] It is n’t all , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , saying much more than [he]131-cyril meant because [he]131-cyril thought [Robert]132-robert ’s tone had been rude — as indeed it had . “[715-we] [We]715-we ought to go and look for that Amulet . What ’s the good of having a first‐class charm and keeping it idle , just eating its head off in [the stable]716-the stable . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m game for anything , of course , ” said [Robert]132-robert ; but [he]132-robert added , with a fine air of chivalry , “[0-i] only [I]0-i do n’t think [the girls]311-the girls are keen today somehow . ” “[311-the girls] Oh , yes ; [I]0-i am , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea hurriedly . “[0-i] If [you]718-you think [I]0-i ’m afraid , [I]0-i ’m not . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am though , ” said [Jane]134-jane heavily ; “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t like it , and [I]0-i wo n’t go [there]321-there again — not for anything [I]0-i wo n’t . ” “[0-i] [We]715-we should n’t go [there]321-there again , silly , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “[0-i] it would be [some other place]721-some other place . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i daresay ; [a place with lions and tigers in [it]722-a place with lions and tigers in it as likely as not as likely as not]722-a place with lions and tigers in it as likely as not . ” Seeing [Jane]134-jane so frightened , made [the others]325-the others feel quite brave . [They]325-the others said [they]325-the others were certain [they]325-the others ought to go . “[0-i] It ’s so ungrateful to [the Psammead]400-the psammead not to , ” [Anthea]133-anthea added , a little primly . [Jane]134-jane stood up . [She]134-jane was desperate . “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n’t ! ” [she]134-jane cried ; “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n’t , [I]0-i wo n’t , [I]0-i wo n’t ! If [you]724-you make [me]0-i [I]0-i ’ll scream and [I]0-i ’ll scream , and [I]0-i ’ll tell [old Nurse]142-old nurse , and [I]0-i ’ll get [her]142-old nurse to burn the charm in the kitchen fire . So now , then ! ” [You]724-you can imagine how furious [everyone]319-everyone was with [Jane]134-jane for feeling what each of [them]319-everyone had felt all the morning . In each breast the same thought arose , “[344-no one] [No one]344-no one can say it ’s [our]726-our fault . ” And [they]319-everyone at once began to show [Jane]134-jane how angry [they]319-everyone all felt that all the fault was [hers]134-jane . This made [them]319-everyone feel quite brave . “[344-no one] Tell‐tale tit , its tongue shall be split , And [all the dogs in [our town]728-our town]727-all the dogs in our town shall have a little bit , ” sang [Robert]132-robert . “[727-all the dogs in our town] It ’s always the way if [you]729-you have [girls]730-girls in anything . ” [Cyril]131-cyril spoke in a cold displeasure that was worse than [Robert]132-robert ’s cruel quotation , and even [Anthea]133-anthea said , “[727-all the dogs in our town] Well , [I]0-i ’m not afraid if [I]0-i am [a girl]2478-a girl , ” which of course , was the most cutting thing of all . [Jane]134-jane picked up [her]134-jane doll and faced [the others]325-the others with what is sometimes called the courage of despair . “[2478-a girl] [I]0-i do n’t care , ” [she]134-jane said ; “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n’t , so there ! It ’s just silly going to places when [you]729-you do n’t want to , and when [you]729-you do n’t know what [they]732-they ’re going to be like ! [You]729-you can laugh at [me]0-i as much as [you]729-you like . [You]729-you ’re beasts — and [I]0-i hate [you]729-you all ! ” With these awful words [she]134-jane went out and banged the door . Then [the others]325-the others would not look at [each other]312-each other , and [they]325-the others did not feel so brave as [they]325-the others had done . [Cyril]131-cyril took up a book , but it was not interesting to read . [Robert]132-robert kicked a chair‐leg absently . [His]132-robert feet were always eloquent in moments of emotion . [Anthea]133-anthea stood pleating the end of the table‐cloth into folds — [she]133-anthea seemed earnestly anxious to get all the pleats the same size . The sound of [Jane]134-jane ’s sobs had died away . Suddenly [Anthea]133-anthea said , “[0-i] Oh ! let it be ‘ pax’—poor little Pussy — [you]729-you know [she]733-she ’s [the youngest]734-the youngest . ” “[733-she] [She]733-she called [us]729-you beasts , ” said [Robert]132-robert , kicking the chair suddenly . “[733-she] Well , said [Cyril]131-cyril , who was subject to passing fits of justice , “ [we]729-you began , [you]729-you know . At least [you]729-you did . ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril ’s justice was always uncompromising . “ [I]132-robert ’m not going to say [I]132-robert ’m sorry if [you]729-you mean that , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , and the chair‐leg cracked to the kick [he]132-robert gave as [he]132-robert said it . “ Oh , do let ’s , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ [we]729-you ’re three to one , and [Mother]138-mother does so hate it if [we]729-you row . Come on . [I]133-anthea ’ll say [I]133-anthea ’m sorry first , though [I]133-anthea did n’t say anything , hardly . ”[133-anthea] “ All right , let ’s get it over , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , opening the door . “Hi — [you]729-you — [Pussy]155-pussy ! ”[131-cyril] Far away up the stairs a voice could be heard singing brokenly , but still defiantly — It was trying , for this was plainly meant to annoy . But [Anthea]133-anthea would not give [herself]133-anthea time to think this . [She]133-anthea led the way up the stairs , taking three at a time , and bounded to the level of [Jane]134-jane , who sat on the top step of all , thumping [her]134-jane doll to the tune of the song [she]134-jane was trying to sing . “ [I]134-jane say , [Pussy]155-pussy , let it be pax ! [We]729-you ’re sorry if [you]155-pussy are — ”[134-jane] It was enough . The kiss of peace was given by all . [Jane]134-jane being [the youngest]734-the youngest was entitled to this ceremonial . [Anthea]133-anthea added a special apology of [her]133-anthea own . “ [I]133-anthea ’m sorry if [I]133-anthea was [a pig]2755-a pig , [Pussy]155-pussy dear , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said—“especially because in [my]133-anthea really and truly inside mind [I]133-anthea ’ve been feeling a little as if [I]133-anthea ’d rather not go into the Past again either . But then , do think . If [we]729-you do n’t go [we]729-you sha n’t get the Amulet , and oh , [Pussy]155-pussy , think if [we]729-you could only get [Father]137-father and [Mother]138-mother and [The Lamb]295-the lamb safe back ! [We]729-you must go , but [we]729-you ’ll wait a day or two if [you]155-pussy like and then perhaps [you]155-pussy ’ll feel braver . ”[133-anthea] “ Raw meat makes [you]155-pussy brave , however cowardly [you]155-pussy are , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , to show that there was now no ill‐feeling , “ and cranberries — that ’s what [Tartars]158-tartars eat , and [they]158-tartars ’re so brave it ’s simply awful . [I]133-anthea suppose cranberries are only for Christmas time , but [I]133-anthea ’ll ask [old Nurse]305-old nurse to let [you]155-pussy have [your]155-pussy chop very raw if [you]155-pussy like . ”[133-anthea] “ [I]134-jane think [I]134-jane could be brave without that , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane hastily ; [she]134-jane hated underdone meat . “ [I]134-jane ’ll try . ”[134-jane] At this moment the door of [[the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s room]737-the learned gentleman ’s room opened , and [he]2353-the learned gentleman looked out . “ Excuse [me]2353-the learned gentleman , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [he]2353-the learned gentleman said , in that gentle , polite weary voice of [his]2353-the learned gentleman , “ but was [I]2353-the learned gentleman mistaken in thinking that [I]2353-the learned gentleman caught a familiar word just now ? Were [you]134-jane not singing some old ballad of [Babylon]40-babylon ? ”[2353-the learned gentleman] “ No , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ at least [Jane]134-jane was singing ‘ How many miles , ’ but [I]132-robert should n’t have thought [you]134-jane could have heard the words for — ”[132-robert] [He]2353-the learned gentleman would have said , “ for the sniffing , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] but [Anthea]133-anthea pinched [him]2353-the learned gentleman just in time . “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman did not hear all the words , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman wonder would [you]134-jane recite them to [me]2353-the learned gentleman ? ”[2353-the learned gentleman] So [they]739-they all said together — “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman wish [one]346-one could , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman said with a sigh . “ Ca n’t [you]2353-the learned gentleman ? ”[134-jane] asked [Jane]134-jane . “ [Babylon]40-babylon has fallen , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [he]2353-the learned gentleman answered with a sigh . “ [You]134-jane know [it]40-babylon was once [a great and beautiful city]2759-a great and beautiful city , and the centre of learning and Art , and now [it]40-babylon is only ruins , and so covered up with earth that [people]280-people are not even agreed as to where [it]40-babylon once stood . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [He]2353-the learned gentleman was leaning on the banisters , and [his]2353-the learned gentleman eyes had a far‐away look in them , as though [he]2353-the learned gentleman could see through the staircase‐window the splendour and glory of ancient [Babylon]40-babylon . “ [I]131-cyril say , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril remarked abruptly . “ [You]134-jane know that charm [we]131-cyril showed [you]134-jane , and [you]134-jane told [us]131-cyril how to say the name that ’s on it ? ”[131-cyril] “ Yes ! ”[2353-the learned gentleman] “ Well , do [you]134-jane think that charm was ever in [Babylon]40-babylon ? ”[131-cyril] “ It ’s quite possible , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman replied . “ such charms have been found in very early Egyptian tombs , yet their origin has not been accurately determined as Egyptian . [They]2761-they may have been brought from [Asia]41-asia . Or , supposing the charm to have been fashioned in [Egypt]21-egypt , it might very well have been carried to [Babylon]40-babylon by [some friendly embassy]2762-some friendly embassy , or brought back by [the Babylonish army]2763-the babylonish army from some Egyptian campaign as part of the spoils of war . The inscription may be much later than the charm . Oh yes ! it is a pleasant fancy , that that splendid specimen of yours was once used amid [Babylonish]42-babylonish surroundings . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [The others]325-the others looked at [each other]312-each other , but it was [Jane]134-jane who spoke . “ Were [the Babylon people savages]2764-the babylon people savages , were [they]2764-the babylon people savages always fighting and throwing things about ? ”[134-jane] For [she]134-jane had read the thoughts of [the others]325-the others by the unerring light of [her]134-jane own fears . “ [The Babylonians]2765-the babylonians were certainly more gentle than [the Assyrians]2766-the assyrians , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “ And [they]2764-the babylon people savages were [not savages]2767-not savages by any means . A very high level of culture , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [he]2353-the learned gentleman looked doubtfully at [[his]2353-the learned gentleman audience]746-his audience and went on , “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman mean that [they]2764-the babylon people savages made beautiful statues and jewellery , and built [splendid palaces]2768-splendid palaces . And [they]2764-the babylon people savages were very learned‐ [they]2764-the babylon people savages had glorious libraries and high towers for the purpose of astrological and astronomical observation . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] “ Er ? ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman mean for — star‐gazing and fortune‐telling , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , “ and there were temples and [beautiful hanging gardens]2769-beautiful hanging gardens — ”[2353-the learned gentleman] “ [I]134-jane ’ll go to [Babylon]40-babylon if [you]2353-the learned gentleman like , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane abruptly , and [the others]325-the others hastened to say “ Done ! ”[325-the others] before [she]134-jane should have time to change [her]134-jane mind . “ Ah , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , smiling rather sadly , “ [one]346-one can go so far in dreams , when [one]346-one is young . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [He]2353-the learned gentleman sighed again , and then adding with a laboured briskness , “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman hope [you]2353-the learned gentleman ’ll have a — a — jolly game , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [he]2353-the learned gentleman went into [[his]2353-the learned gentleman room]514-his room and shut the door . “ [He]2353-the learned gentleman said ‘ jolly ’ as if it was a foreign language , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ Come on , let ’s get the Psammead and go now . [I]131-cyril think [Babylon]40-babylon seems [a most frightfully jolly place to go to]2772-a most frightfully jolly place to go to . ”[131-cyril] So [they]325-the others woke [the Psammead]136-the psammead and put it in its bass‐bag with the waterproof sheet , in case of inclement weather in [Babylon]40-babylon . It was very cross , but [it]751-it said it would as soon go to [Babylon]40-babylon as anywhere else . “ [The sand]279-the sand is good thereabouts , ”[751-it] it added . Then [Jane]134-jane held up the charm , and [Cyril]131-cyril said — “ [We]325-the others want to go to [Babylon]40-babylon to look for the part of [you]134-jane that was lost . Will [you]134-jane please let [us]325-the others go there through [you]134-jane ? ”[131-cyril] “ Please put [us]325-the others down just outside , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane hastily ; “ and then if [we]325-the others do n’t like it [we]325-the others need n’t go inside . ”[134-jane] “ Do n’t be all day , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . So [Anthea]133-anthea hastily uttered the word of power , without which the charm could do nothing . “ Ur — hekau — setcheh ! ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said softly , and as [she]133-anthea spoke the charm grew into an arch so tall that the top of it was close against the bedroom ceiling . Outside the arch was [the bedroom]752-the bedroom painted chest‐of‐drawers and the Kidderminster carpet , and the washhand‐stand with the riveted willow‐pattern jug , and the faded curtains , and the dull light of indoors on a wet day . Through the arch showed the gleam of soft green leaves and white blossoms . [They]753-they stepped forward quite happily . Even [Jane]134-jane felt that this did not look like lions , and [her]134-jane hand hardly trembled at all as [she]134-jane held the charm for [the others]325-the others to go through , and last , slipped through [herself]134-jane , and hung the charm , now grown small again , round [her]134-jane neck . [The children]278-the children found [themselves]278-the children under a white‐blossomed , green‐leafed fruit‐tree , in what seemed to be an orchard of such trees , all white‐flowered and green‐foliaged . Among the long green grass under [their]278-the children feet grew crocuses and lilies , and strange blue flowers . In the branches overhead thrushes and blackbirds were singing , and the coo of a pigeon came softly to [them]278-the children in the green quietness of [the orchard]756-the orchard . “ Oh , how perfectly lovely ! ”[133-anthea] cried [Anthea]133-anthea . “ Why , it ’s like [home]357-home exactly — [I]133-anthea mean [England]8-england — only everything ’s bluer , and whiter , and greener , and the flowers are bigger . ”[133-anthea] [The boys]313-the boys owned that [it]758-it certainly was fairly decent , and even [Jane]134-jane admitted that it was all very pretty . “ [I]133-anthea ’m certain there ’s nothing to be frightened of [here]2247-here , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [I]134-jane do n’t know , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ [I]134-jane suppose the fruit‐trees go on just the same even when [people]280-people are killing [each other]312-each other . [I]134-jane did n’t half like what [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman said about [the hanging gardens]2779-the hanging gardens . [I]134-jane suppose [they]2779-the hanging gardens have [gardens]2780-gardens on purpose to hang [people]280-people in . [I]134-jane do hope this is n’t one . ”[134-jane] “ Of course it is n’t , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ [The hanging gardens]2779-the hanging gardens are just gardens hung up — [I]131-cyril think on chains between [houses]2783-houses , do n’t [you]2784-you know , like trays . Come on ; let ’s get somewhere . ”[131-cyril] [They]759-they began to walk through the cool grass . As far as [they]759-they could see was nothing but trees , and trees , and more trees . At the end of [[their]759-they orchard]760-their orchard was another one , only separated from [theirs]759-they by [a little stream of clear water]761-a little stream of clear water . [They]759-they jumped this , and went on . [Cyril]131-cyril , who was fond of gardening — which meant that [he]131-cyril liked to watch [the gardener at work]762-the gardener at work — was able to command the respect of [the others]325-the others by telling [them]325-the others the names of a good many trees . There were nut‐trees and almond‐trees , and apricots , and fig‐trees with [their]764-their big five‐fingered leaves . And every now and then [the children]278-the children had to cross [another brook]766-another brook . “ It ’s like between the squares in ‘ Through the Looking‐glass , ’ ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . At last [they]759-they came to [an orchard]332-an orchard which was quite different from [the other orchards]768-the other orchards . [It]332-an orchard had [a low building in one corner]769-a low building in one corner . “ These are vines , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril superiorly , “ and [I]131-cyril know this is [a vineyard]2785-a vineyard . [I]131-cyril should n’t wonder if there was a wine‐press inside that place over there . ”[131-cyril] At last [they]759-they got out of [the orchards]770-the orchards and on to [a sort of road]771-a sort of road , very rough , and not at all like [the roads [you]773-you are used to]772-the roads you are used to . [It]771-a sort of road had cypress‐trees and acacia‐trees along [it]771-a sort of road , and a sort of hedge of tamarisks , like those [you]773-you see on [the road between [Nice]43-nice and [Cannes]44-cannes]774-the road between nice and cannes , or near [Littlehampton]45-littlehampton , if [you]773-you ’ve only been as far as that . And now in front of [them]759-they [they]759-they could see a great mass of [buildings]775-buildings . There were [scattered houses of wood and stone here and there among green orchards]776-scattered houses of wood and stone here and there among green orchards , and beyond these a great wall that shone red in the early morning sun . The wall was enormously high — more than half the height of [St. Paul’s]46-st. paul’s — and in the wall were set enormous gates that shone like gold as the rising sun beat on them . Each gate had [a solid square tower on each side of [it]777-a solid square tower on each side of it that stood out from the wall and rose above it that stood out from the wall and rose above [it]777-a solid square tower on each side of it that stood out from the wall and rose above it]777-a solid square tower on each side of it that stood out from the wall and rose above it . Beyond the wall were [more towers]778-more towers and [houses , gleaming with gold and bright colours]779-houses , gleaming with gold and bright colours . Away to the left ran the steel‐blue swirl of [a great river]780-a great river . And [the children]278-the children could see , through a gap in the trees , that [the river]2467-the river flowed out from [the town]783-the town under a great arch in the wall . “ Those feathery things along by [the water]2469-the water are palms , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril instructively . “ Oh , yes ; [you]278-the children know everything , ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert replied . “ What ’s all that grey‐green stuff [you]278-the children see away over there , where it ’s all flat and sandy ? ”[132-robert] “ All right , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril loftily , “ [I]131-cyril do n’t want to tell [you]278-the children anything . [I]131-cyril only thought [you]278-the children ’d like to know a palm‐tree when [you]278-the children saw it again . ”[131-cyril] “ Look ! ”[133-anthea] cried [Anthea]133-anthea ; “ [they]278-the children ’re opening the gates . ”[133-anthea] And indeed the great gates swung back with a brazen clang , and instantly [a little crowd of a dozen or more people]784-a little crowd of a dozen or more people came out and along [the road]785-the road towards [them]278-the children . [The children]278-the children , with one accord , crouched behind the tamarisk hedge . “ [I]134-jane do n’t like the sound of those gates , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ Fancy being inside when they shut . [You]278-the children ’d never get out . ”[134-jane] “ [You]278-the children ’ve got an arch of [your]278-the children own to go out by , ”[400-the psammead] [the Psammead]400-the psammead put its head out of the basket to remind [her]134-jane . “ Do n’t behave so like [a girl]2478-a girl . If [I]400-the psammead were [you]278-the children [I]400-the psammead should just march right into [the town]783-the town and ask to see [the king]2789-the king . ”[400-the psammead] There was something at once simple and grand about this idea , and it pleased [everyone]319-everyone . So when [the work‐people]789-the work‐people had passed ( [they]789-the work‐people were [work‐people]790-work‐people , [the children]278-the children felt sure , because [they]789-the work‐people were dressed so plainly — just one long blue shirt thing — of blue or yellow ) [the four children]309-the four children marched boldly up to the brazen gate between [the towers]793-the towers . The arch above the gate was quite [a tunnel]794-a tunnel , the walls were so thick . “ Courage , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ Step out . It ’s no use trying to sneak past . Be bold ! ”[131-cyril] [Robert]132-robert answered this appeal by unexpectedly bursting into “ [The British Grenadiers]159-the british grenadiers , ”[795-its] and to [its]795-its quick‐step [they]309-the four children approached [the gates of [Babylon]40-babylon]796-the gates of babylon . This brought [them]309-the four children to the threshold of the gate , and [two men in bright armour]797-two men in bright armour suddenly barred [their]797-two men in bright armour way with crossed spears . “ Who goes [there]321-there ? ”[797-two men in bright armour] [they]797-two men in bright armour said . ( [I]0-i think [I]0-i must have explained to [you]798-you before how it was that [the children]278-the children were always able to understand the language of any place [they]278-the children might happen to be in , and to be [themselves]278-the children understood . If not , [I]0-i have no time to explain it now . ) “ [We]309-the four children come from very far , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril mechanically . “ From [the Empire]2791-the empire where the sun never sets , and [we]309-the four children want to see [[your]798-you King]2792-your king . ”[131-cyril] “ If it ’s quite convenient , ”[133-anthea] amended [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [The King]2789-the king ( may [he]2789-the king live for ever ! ) , ”[800-the gatekeeper] said [the gatekeeper]800-the gatekeeper , “ is gone to fetch [home]357-home [[his]2789-the king fourteenth wife]2795-his fourteenth wife . Where on [earth]2796-earth have [you]801-they come from not to know that ? ”[800-the gatekeeper] “ [The Queen]160-the queen then , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea hurriedly , and not taking any notice of the question as to where [they]801-they had come from . “ [The Queen]382-the queen , ”[800-the gatekeeper] said [the gatekeeper]800-the gatekeeper , “ ( may [she]382-the queen live for ever ! ) gives [audience]2798-audience today three hours after sun‐rising . ”[800-the gatekeeper] “ But what are [we]801-they to do till the end of the three hours ? ”[131-cyril] asked [Cyril]131-cyril . [The gatekeeper]800-the gatekeeper seemed neither to know nor to care . [He]800-the gatekeeper appeared less interested in [them]801-they than [they]801-they could have thought possible . But [the man who had crossed spears with [him]800-the gatekeeper to bar [the children]278-the children ’s way]804-the man who had crossed spears with him to bar the children ’s way was more human . “ Let [them]278-the children go in and look about [them]278-the children , ”[800-the gatekeeper] [he]800-the gatekeeper said . “ [I]800-the gatekeeper ’ll wager [my]800-the gatekeeper best sword [they]278-the children ’ve never seen anything to come near [[our]801-they little — village]2799-our little — village . ”[800-the gatekeeper] [He]800-the gatekeeper said it in the tone [people]280-people use for when [they]280-people call [the Atlantic Ocean]807-the atlantic ocean [the “ herring pond]2800-the “ herring pond . ”[800-the gatekeeper] [The gatekeeper]800-the gatekeeper hesitated . “ [They]278-the children ’re [only children]2801-only children , after all , ”[809-the other , who had children of his own] said [the other , who had children of [his]809-the other , who had children of his own own]809-the other , who had children of his own . “ Let [me]809-the other , who had children of his own off for a few minutes , [Captain]364-captain , and [I]809-the other , who had children of his own ’ll take [them]278-the children to [[my]809-the other , who had children of his own place]2803-my place and see if [[my]809-the other , who had children of his own good woman]2804-my good woman ca n’t fit [them]278-the children up in something a little less outlandish than [[their]278-the children present rig]2805-their present rig . Then [they]278-the children can have a look round without being mobbed . May [I]809-the other , who had children of his own go ? ”[809-the other , who had children of his own] “ Oh yes , if [you]2282-the man like , ”[810-the captain] said [the Captain]810-the captain , “ but do n’t be all day . ”[810-the captain] [The man]2282-the man led [them]812-them through the dark arch into [the town]783-the town . And [it]814-it was very different from [London]2-london . For one thing , everything in [London]2-london seems to be patched up out of odds and ends , but [these houses]2519-these houses seemed to have been built by [people who liked the same sort of things]816-people who liked the same sort of things . Not that [they]2519-these houses were all alike , for though all were squarish , [they]2519-these houses were of different sizes , and decorated in all sorts of different ways , some with paintings in bright colours , some with black and silver designs . There were [terraces]817-terraces , and [gardens]2780-gardens , and balconies , and open spaces with trees . [[Their]812-them guide]2647-their guide took [them]812-them to [a little house in [a back street]821-a back street , where [a kind‐faced woman]822-a kind‐faced woman sat spinning at the door of [a very dark room]823-a very dark room]820-a little house in a back street , where a kind‐faced woman sat spinning at the door of a very dark room . “ [Here]2247-here , ”[2647-their guide] [he]2647-their guide said , “ just lend [these children]2807-these children a mantle each , so that [they]2807-these children can go about and see [the place]539-the place till [[the Queen]382-the queen ’s audience]2810-the queen ’s audience begins . [You]822-a kind‐faced woman leave that wool for a bit , and show [them]2807-these children round if [you]822-a kind‐faced woman like . [I]2647-their guide must be off now . ”[2647-their guide] [The woman]613-the woman did as [she]613-the woman was told , and [the four children , wrapped in fringed mantles]825-the four children , wrapped in fringed mantles , went with [her]613-the woman all about [the town]783-the town , and oh ! how [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had time to tell [you]827-you all that [they]825-the four children , wrapped in fringed mantles saw . It was all so wonderfully different from anything [you]827-you have ever seen . For one thing , all [the houses]828-the houses were dazzlingly bright , and many of [them]828-the houses covered with pictures . [Some]829-some had great creatures carved in stone at each side of the door . Then [the people]2548-the people — there were no black frock‐coats and tall hats ; no dingy coats and skirts of good , useful , ugly stuffs warranted to wear . [Everyone]319-everyone ’s clothes were bright and beautiful with blue and scarlet and green and gold . [The market]832-the market was brighter than [you]827-you would think anything could be . There were [stalls]833-stalls for everything [you]827-you could possibly want — and for a great many things that if [you]827-you wanted here and now , want would be [[your]827-you master]834-your master . There were pineapples and peaches in heaps — and [stalls of crockery]835-stalls of crockery and glass things , beautiful shapes and glorious colours , there were [stalls]833-stalls for necklaces , and clasps , and bracelets , and brooches , for woven stuffs , and furs , and embroidered linen . [The children]278-the children had never seen half so many beautiful things together , even at [Liberty ’s]47-liberty ’s . It seemed no time at all before [the woman]613-the woman said — “ It ’s nearly time now . [We]278-the children ought to be getting on towards [the palace]2811-the palace . It ’s as well to be early . ”[613-the woman] So [they]278-the children went to [the palace]2811-the palace , and when [they]278-the children got [there]321-there [it]2811-the palace was more splendid than anything [they]278-the children had seen yet . For [it]2811-the palace was glowing with colours , and with gold and silver and black and white — like some magnificent embroidery . Flight after flight of broad marble steps led up to [it]2811-the palace , and at the edges of the stairs stood great images , twenty times as big as [a man]451-a man — images of [men with wings like chain armour , and hawks]842-men with wings like chain armour , and hawks ’ heads , and [winged men with the heads of dogs]843-winged men with the heads of dogs . And there were the statues of [great kings]844-great kings . Between the flights of steps were [terraces where fountains played]845-terraces where fountains played , and [the Queen ’s Guard in white and scarlet , and armour that shone like gold]846-the queen ’s guard in white and scarlet , and armour that shone like gold , stood by twos lining the way up [the stairs]847-the stairs ; and a great body of [them]848-them was massed by the vast door of [the palace itself]849-the palace itself , where [it]849-the palace itself stood glittering like an impossibly radiant peacock in the noon‐day sun . [All sorts of [people]280-people]850-all sorts of people were passing up the steps to seek audience of [the Queen]382-the queen . [Ladies in richly‐embroidered dresses with fringy flounces]853-ladies in richly‐embroidered dresses with fringy flounces , [poor folks in plain and simple clothes]854-poor folks in plain and simple clothes , [dandies with beards oiled and curled]855-dandies with beards oiled and curled . And [Cyril]131-cyril , [Robert]132-robert , [Anthea]133-anthea and [Jane]134-jane , went with [the crowd]2541-the crowd . At the gate of [the palace]2811-the palace [the Psammead]136-the psammead put one eye cautiously out of the basket and whispered — “ [I]136-the psammead ca n’t be bothered with [queens]2812-queens . [I]136-the psammead ’ll go [home]357-home with [this lady]2814-this lady . [I]136-the psammead ’m sure [she]2814-this lady ’ll get [me]136-the psammead some sand if [you]134-jane ask [her]2814-this lady to . ”[136-the psammead] “ Oh ! do n’t leave [us]2815-us , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . [The woman]613-the woman was giving some last instructions in Court etiquette to [Anthea]133-anthea , and did not hear [Jane]134-jane . “ Do n’t be a little muff , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead quite fiercely . “ It ’s not a bit of good [your]134-jane having a charm . [You]134-jane never use it . If [you]134-jane want [me]136-the psammead [you]134-jane ’ve only got to say the name of power and ask the charm to bring [me]136-the psammead to [you]134-jane . ”[136-the psammead] “ [I]134-jane ’d rather go with [you]136-the psammead , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . And it was the most surprising thing [she]134-jane had ever said in [her]134-jane life . [Every one]2347-every one opened [its]2347-every one mouth without thinking of manners , and [Anthea]133-anthea , who was peeping into [the Psammead]136-the psammead ’s basket , saw that its mouth opened wider than [anybody]575-anybody ’s . “ [You]136-the psammead need n’t gawp like that , ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane went on . “ [I]134-jane ’m not going to be bothered with [queens]2812-queens any more than it is . And [I]134-jane know , wherever it is , it ’ll take jolly good care that it ’s safe . ”[134-jane] “ [She]2812-queens ’s right there , ”[2347-every one] said [every one]2347-every one , for [they]2347-every one had observed that [the Psammead]136-the psammead had a way of knowing which side [its]136-the psammead bread was buttered . [She]134-jane turned to [the woman]613-the woman and said , “ [You]613-the woman ’ll take [me]134-jane [home]357-home with [you]613-the woman , wo n’t [you]613-the woman ? And let [me]134-jane play with [[your]613-the woman little girls]2818-your little girls till [the others]325-the others have done with [the Queen]382-the queen . ”[134-jane] “ Surely [I]613-the woman will , [little heart]2821-little heart ! ”[613-the woman] said [the woman]613-the woman . And then [Anthea]133-anthea hurriedly stroked [the Psammead]136-the psammead and embraced [Jane]134-jane , who took [the woman]613-the woman ’s hand , and trotted contentedly away with the Psammead ’s bag under the other arm . [The others]325-the others stood looking after [her]613-the woman till [she]613-the woman , [the woman]613-the woman , and the basket were lost in [the many‐coloured crowd]867-the many‐coloured crowd . Then [Anthea]133-anthea turned once more to [the palace]2811-the palace ’s magnificent doorway and said — “ Let ’s ask [the porter]2822-the porter to take care of [our]869-they Babylonian overcoats . ”[133-anthea] So [they]869-they took off the garments that [the woman]613-the woman had lent [them]869-they and stood amid [the jostling petitioners of [the Queen]382-the queen]871-the jostling petitioners of the queen in [their]869-they own English frocks and coats and hats and boots . “ [We]869-they want to see [the Queen]382-the queen , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “ [we]869-they come from [the far Empire where the sun never sets]2824-the far empire where the sun never sets ! ”[131-cyril] A murmur of surprise and a thrill of excitement ran through [the crowd]2541-the crowd . [The door‐porter]874-the door‐porter spoke to [a black man]875-a black man , [he]874-the door‐porter spoke to [someone else]876-someone else . There was a whispering , waiting pause . Then [a big man , with a cleanly‐ shaven face]877-a big man , with a cleanly‐ shaven face , beckoned [them]869-they from the top of [a flight of red marble steps]878-a flight of red marble steps . [They]869-they went up ; the boots of [Robert]132-robert clattering more than usual because [he]132-robert was so nervous . A door swung open , a curtain was drawn back . A double line of bowing forms in gorgeous raiment formed a lane that led to the steps of the throne , and as [the children]278-the children advanced hurriedly there came from the throne a voice very sweet and kind . “ [Three children from [the land where the sun never sets]2826-the land where the sun never sets]2825-three children from the land where the sun never sets ! Let [them]278-the children draw hither without fear . ”[613-the woman] In another minute [they]278-the children were kneeling at the throne ’s foot , saying , “ Oh , [Queen]2827-queen , live for ever ! ”[278-the children] exactly as [the woman]613-the woman had taught [them]278-the children . And [a splendid dream‐lady]881-a splendid dream‐lady , all gold and silver and jewels and snowy drift of veils , was raising [Anthea]133-anthea , and saying — “ Do n’t be frightened , [I]133-anthea really am so glad [you]133-anthea came ! [The land where the sun]2828-the land where the sun never sets ! [I]133-anthea am delighted to see [you]133-anthea ! [I]133-anthea was getting quite too dreadfully bored for anything ! ”[133-anthea] And behind [Anthea]133-anthea the kneeling [Cyril]131-cyril whispered in the ears of the respectful [Robert]132-robert — “ [Bobs]161-bobs , do n’t say anything to [Panther]162-panther . It ’s no use upsetting [her]162-panther , but [we]278-the children did n’t ask for [Jane]134-jane ’s address , and [the Psammead]400-the psammead ’s with [her]162-panther . ”[131-cyril] “ Well , ”[132-robert] whispered [Robert]132-robert , “ the charm can bring [them]400-the psammead to [us]278-the children at any moment . It said so . ”[132-robert] “ Oh , yes , ”[131-cyril] whispered [Cyril]131-cyril , in miserable derision , “ [We]278-the children ’re all right , of course . So [we]278-the children are ! Oh , yes ! If [we]278-the children ’d only got the charm . ”[131-cyril] Then [Robert]132-robert saw , and [he]132-robert murmured , “ Crikey ! ”[132-robert] at the foot of [the throne of [Babylon]40-babylon]882-the throne of babylon ; while [Cyril]131-cyril hoarsely whispered the plain English fact — “ [Jane]134-jane ’s got the charm round [her]134-jane neck , [you]131-cyril silly cuckoo . ”[131-cyril] “ Crikey ! ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert repeated in heart‐broken undertones . [THE Queen]382-the queen threw three of the red and gold embroidered cushions off the throne on to the marble steps that led up to [it]882-the throne of babylon . “ Just make [yourselves]131-cyril comfortable there , ”[382-the queen] [she]382-the queen said . “ [I]382-the queen ’m simply dying to talk to [you]131-cyril , and to hear all about [[your]131-cyril wonderful country]2830-your wonderful country and how [you]131-cyril got [here]2247-here , and everything , but [I]382-the queen have to do justice every morning . Such a bore , is n’t it ? Do [you]131-cyril do justice in [[your]131-cyril own country]2832-your own country ? ”[382-the queen] “ No , said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “[382-the queen] at least of course [we]884-we try to , but not in this public sort of way , only in private . ” “[382-the queen] Ah , yes , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , “[382-the queen] [I]0-i should much prefer a private audience [myself]0-i — much easier to manage . But public opinion has to be considered . Doing justice is very hard work , even when [you]885-you ’re brought up to it . ” “[884-we] [We]884-we do n’t do justice , but [we]884-we have to do scales , [Jane]134-jane and [me]0-i , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , “[134-jane] twenty minutes a day . It ’s simply horrid . ” “[134-jane] What are scales ? ” asked [the Queen]382-the queen , “[134-jane] and what is [Jane]134-jane ? ” “[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane is [[my]0-i little sister]886-my little sister . [One of [the guards‐at‐the‐gate ’s wife]888-the guards‐at‐the‐gate ’s wife]887-one of the guards‐at‐the‐gate ’s wife is taking care of [her]134-jane . And scales are music . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never heard of the instrument , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i sing ? ” “[0-i] Oh , yes . [We]884-we can sing in parts , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[884-we] That is magic , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[884-we] How many parts are [you]0-i each cut into before [you]0-i do it ? ” “[884-we] [We]884-we are n’t cut at all , ” said [Robert]132-robert hastily . “[884-we] [We]884-we could n’t sing if [we]884-we were . [We]884-we ’ll show [you]0-i afterwards . ” “[884-we] So [you]0-i shall , and now sit quiet like [dear children]889-dear children and hear [me]0-i do justice . The way [I]0-i do it has always been admired . [I]0-i ought n’t to say that ought [I]0-i ? Sounds so conceited . But [I]0-i do n’t mind with [you]0-i , [dears]890-dears . Somehow [I]0-i feel as though [I]0-i ’d known [you]0-i quite a long time already . ” [The Queen]382-the queen settled [herself]382-the queen on [her]382-the queen throne and made a signal to [[her]382-the queen attendants]2838-her attendants . [The children]278-the children , whispering together among the cushions on the steps of the throne , decided that [she]382-the queen was very beautiful and very kind , but perhaps just the least bit flighty . [The first person who came to ask for justice]2840-the first person who came to ask for justice was [a woman whose brother had taken the money [the father]2842-the father had left for [her]2841-a woman whose brother had taken the money the father had left for her]2841-a woman whose brother had taken the money the father had left for her . [The brother]2843-the brother said it was [the uncle]2844-the uncle who had the money . There was a good deal of talk and [the children]278-the children were growing rather bored , when [the Queen]382-the queen suddenly clapped [her]382-the queen hands , and said — “[0-i] Put both [the men]615-the men in [prison]892-prison till [one of [them]615-the men]2356-one of them owns up that [the other]894-the other is innocent . ” “[0-i] But suppose [they]615-the men both did it ? ” [Cyril]131-cyril could not help interrupting . “[615-the men] Then [prison]892-prison ’s the best place for [them]615-the men , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[615-the men] But suppose neither did it . ” “[615-the men] That ’s impossible , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen ; “[615-the men] a thing ’s not done unless [some one]376-some one does it . And [you]897-you must n’t interrupt . ” Then came [a woman]2849-a woman , in tears , with a torn veil and real ashes on [her]2849-a woman head — at least [Anthea]133-anthea thought so , but it may have been only road‐dust . [She]2849-a woman complained that [[her]2849-a woman husband]2850-her husband was in [prison]892-prison . “[897-you] What for ? ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[615-the men] [They]615-the men said it was for speaking evil of [[your]897-you Majesty]898-your majesty , ” said [the woman]613-the woman , “[615-the men] but it was n’t . [Some one]376-some one had a spite against [him]898-your majesty . That was what it was . ” “[898-your majesty] How do [you]897-you know [he]898-your majesty had n’t spoken evil of [me]0-i ? ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[898-your majesty] [No one]344-no one could , ” said [the woman]613-the woman simply , “[898-your majesty] when [they]615-the men ’d once seen [your]897-you beautiful face . ” “[615-the men] Let [the man]2282-the man out , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , smiling . “[2282-the man] Next case . ” The next case was that of [a boy who had stolen a fox]2857-a boy who had stolen a fox . “[2282-the man] Like [the Spartan boy]902-the spartan boy , ” whispered [Robert]132-robert . But [the Queen]382-the queen ruled that [nobody]2255-nobody could have any possible reason for owning a fox , and still less for stealing one . And [she]382-the queen did not believe that there were any foxes in [Babylon]40-babylon ; [she]382-the queen , at any rate , had never seen one . So [the boy]2860-the boy was released . [The people]2548-the people came to [the Queen]382-the queen about all sorts of family quarrels and neighbourly misunderstandings — from a fight between [brothers]2863-brothers over the division of an inheritance , to the dishonest and unfriendly conduct of [a woman who had borrowed a cooking‐pot at the last New Year]2864-a woman who had borrowed a cooking‐pot at the last new year ’s festival , and not returned it yet . And [the Queen]382-the queen decided everything , very , very decidedly indeed . At last [she]382-the queen clapped [her]382-the queen hands quite suddenly and with extreme loudness , and said — “[2282-the man] [The audience]903-the audience is over for today . ” [Every one]2347-every one said , “[903-the audience] May [the Queen]382-the queen live for ever ! ” and went out . And [the children]278-the children were left alone in [the justice‐hall]2868-the justice‐hall with [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon and [[her]2869-the queen of babylon ladies]2870-her ladies . “[903-the audience] There ! ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , with a long sigh of relief . “[903-the audience] That ’s over ! [I]0-i could n’t have done another stitch of justice if [you]905-you ’d offered [me]0-i the crown of [Egypt]21-egypt ! Now come into [the garden]906-the garden , and [we]907-we ’ll have a nice , long , cosy talk . ” [She]382-the queen led [them]278-the children through [long , narrow corridors whose walls [they]278-the children somehow felt , were very , very thick , into a sort of [garden courtyard]2873-garden courtyard]2872-long , narrow corridors whose walls they somehow felt , were very , very thick , into a sort of garden courtyard . There were thick shrubs closely planted , and roses were trained over trellises , and made a pleasant shade — needed , indeed , for already the sun was as hot as it is in [England]8-england in August at [the seaside]2874-the seaside . [Slaves]2875-slaves spread cushions on a low , marble terrace , and [a big man with a smooth face]2876-a big man with a smooth face served cool drink in cups of gold studded with beryls . [He]2876-a big man with a smooth face drank a little from [the Queen]382-the queen ’s cup before handing it to [her]382-the queen . “[907-we] That ’s rather a nasty trick , ” whispered [Robert]132-robert , who had been carefully taught never to drink out of one of the nice , shiny , metal cups that are chained to the [London]2-london drinking fountains without first rinsing it out thoroughly . [The Queen]382-the queen overheard [him]132-robert . “[907-we] Not at all , ” said [she]382-the queen . “[907-we] [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk is [a very clean man]908-a very clean man . And [one]346-one has to have some one as taster , [you]910-you know , because of poison . ” The word made [the children]278-the children feel rather creepy ; but [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk had tasted all the cups , so [they]278-the children felt pretty safe . The drink was delicious — very cold , and tasting like lemonade and partly like penny ices . “[907-we] Leave [us]911-us , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . And [all the Court ladies , in [their]2881-all the court ladies , in their beautiful , many‐folded , many‐coloured , fringed dresses beautiful , many‐folded , many‐coloured , fringed dresses]2881-all the court ladies , in their beautiful , many‐folded , many‐coloured , fringed dresses , filed out slowly , and [the children]278-the children were left alone with [the Queen]382-the queen . “[907-we] Now , ” [she]382-the queen said , “[907-we] tell [me]0-i all about [yourselves]911-us . ” [They]911-us looked at [each other]312-each other . “[912-you] [You]912-you , [Bobs]161-bobs , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[912-you] No — [Anthea]133-anthea , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[133-anthea] No — [you]910-you — [Cyril]131-cyril , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[131-cyril] Do n’t [you]910-you remember how pleased [the Queen of [India]48-india]913-the queen of india was when [you]910-you told [her]913-the queen of india all about [us]914-they ? ” [Cyril]131-cyril muttered that it was all very well , and so it was . For when [he]131-cyril had told the tale of [the Phœnix]259-the phœnix and the Carpet to [the Ranee]165-the ranee , it had been only the truth — and all the truth that [he]131-cyril had to tell . But now it was not easy to tell a convincing story without mentioning [the Amulet]166-the amulet — which , of course , it would n’t have done to mention — and without owning that [they]914-they were really living in [London]2-london , about two thousand five hundred years later than the time [they]914-they were talking in . [Cyril]131-cyril took refuge in the tale of [the Psammead]136-the psammead and its wonderful power of making wishes come true . [The children]278-the children had never been able to tell [anyone]283-anyone before , and [Cyril]131-cyril was surprised to find that the spell which kept [them]278-the children silent in [London]2-london did not work [here]2247-here . “[131-cyril] something to do with [our]914-they being in the Past , [I]0-i suppose , ” [he]131-cyril said to [himself]131-cyril . “[0-i] This is most interesting , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[914-they] [We]914-they must have this Psammead for the banquet tonight . [Its]915-its performance will be one of the most popular turns in the whole programme . Where is it ? ” [Anthea]133-anthea explained that [they]914-they did not know ; also why it was that [they]914-they did not know . “[0-i] Oh , that ’s quite simple , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , and [every one]2347-every one breathed a deep sigh of relief as [she]382-the queen said it . “[163-ritti‐marduk] [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk shall run down to the gates and find out which guard [[your]916-your sister]917-your sister went [home]357-home with . ” “[167-might he”—anthea] [Might he”—Anthea]167-might he”—anthea ’s voice was tremulous—“might[163-ritti‐marduk] [he]163-ritti‐marduk — would it interfere with [his]163-ritti‐marduk meal‐times , or anything like that , if [he]163-ritti‐marduk went now ? ” “[163-ritti‐marduk] Of course [he]163-ritti‐marduk shall go now . [He]163-ritti‐marduk may think [himself]163-ritti‐marduk lucky if [he]163-ritti‐marduk gets [his]163-ritti‐marduk meals at any time , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen heartily , and clapped [her]382-the queen hands . “[163-ritti‐marduk] May [I]0-i send a letter ? ” asked [Cyril]131-cyril , pulling out a red‐backed penny account‐book , and feeling in [his]131-cyril pockets for a stump of pencil that [he]131-cyril knew was in one of them . “[0-i] By all means . [I]0-i ’ll call [[my]0-i scribe]919-my scribe . ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i can scribe right enough , thanks , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , finding the pencil and licking its point . [He]131-cyril even had to bite the wood a little , for it was very blunt . “[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i clever , [clever boy]920-clever boy ! ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[920-clever boy] Do let [me]0-i watch [you]0-i do it ! ” [Cyril]131-cyril wrote on a leaf of the book — it was of rough , woolly paper , with hairs that stuck out and would have got in [his]131-cyril pen if [he]131-cyril had been using one , and ruled for accounts . “[0-i] Hide it most carefully before [you]0-i come here , ” [he]131-cyril wrote , “[0-i] and do n’t mention it — and destroy this letter . Everything is going A1 . [The Queen]160-the queen is a fair treat . There ’s nothing to be afraid of . ” “[160-the queen] What curious characters , and what a strange flat surface ! ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[160-the queen] What have [you]0-i inscribed ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve ’ scribed , ” replied [Cyril]131-cyril cautiously , “[0-i] that [you]0-i are fair , and a — and like a — like a festival ; and that [she]921-she need not be afraid , and that [she]921-she is to come at once . ” [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk , who had come in and had stood waiting while [Cyril]131-cyril wrote , [his]163-ritti‐marduk Babylonish eyes nearly starting out of [his]163-ritti‐marduk Babylonish head , now took the letter , with some reluctance . “[921-she] Oh , [Queen]160-the queen , live for ever ! Is it a charm ? ” [he]163-ritti‐marduk timidly asked . “[922-most great lady] A strong charm , [most great lady]922-most great lady ? ” “[922-most great lady] Yes , ” said [Robert]132-robert , unexpectedly , “[922-most great lady] it is a charm , but it wo n’t hurt [anyone]283-anyone until [you]0-i ’ve given it to [Jane]134-jane . And then [she]134-jane ’ll destroy it , so that it ca n’t hurt [anyone]283-anyone . It ’s most awful strong!—as strong as — Peppermint ! ” [he]163-ritti‐marduk ended abruptly . “[0-i] [I]0-i know not [the god]925-the god , ” said [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk , bending timorously . “[0-i] [She]921-she ’ll tear it up directly [she]921-she gets it , ” said [Robert]132-robert , “[921-she] That ’ll end the charm . [You]0-i need n’t be afraid if [you]0-i go now . ” [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk went , seeming only partly satisfied ; and then [the Queen]382-the queen began to admire the penny account‐book and the bit of pencil in so marked and significant a way that [Cyril]131-cyril felt [he]131-cyril could not do less than press them upon [her]382-the queen as a gift . [She]382-the queen ruffled the leaves delightedly . “[0-i] What a wonderful substance ! ” [she]382-the queen said . “[0-i] And with this style [you]0-i make charms ? Make a charm for [me]0-i ! Do [you]0-i know , ” [her]382-the queen voice sank to a whisper , “[0-i] the names of [the great ones of [[your]0-i own far country]927-your own far country]926-the great ones of your own far country ? ” “[0-i] Rather ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , and hastily wrote the names of [Alfred the Great , Shakespeare]168-alfred the great , shakespeare , [Nelson]169-nelson , [Gordon]170-gordon , [Lord Beaconsfield]171-lord beaconsfield , [Mr. Rudyard Kipling]172-mr. rudyard kipling , and [Mr. Sherlock Holmes]173-mr. sherlock holmes , while [the Queen]382-the queen watched [him]131-cyril with “[0-i] unbaited breath , ” as [Anthea]133-anthea said afterwards . [She]382-the queen took the book and hid it reverently among the bright folds of [her]382-the queen gown . “[0-i] [You]0-i shall teach [me]0-i later to say the great names , ” [she]382-the queen said . “[0-i] And the names of [[their]926-the great ones of your own far country Ministers]928-their ministers — perhaps [the great Nisroch]174-nisroch is one of [them]926-the great ones of your own far country ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think so , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[0-i] [Mr. Campbell Bannerman]175-mr. campbell bannerman ’s Prime Minister and [Mr. Burns]176-mr. burns ’ a Minister , and so is [the Archbishop of [Canterbury]49-canterbury]929-the archbishop of canterbury , [I]0-i think , but [I]0-i ’m not sure — and [Dr. Parker]177-dr. parker was one , [I]0-i know , and — ” “[177-dr. parker] No more , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , putting [her]382-the queen hands to [her]382-the queen ears . “[177-dr. parker] [My]0-i head ’s going round with all those great names . [You]0-i shall teach [them]926-the great ones of your own far country to [me]0-i later — because of course [you]0-i ’ll make [us]930-us a nice long visit now [you]0-i have come , wo n’t [you]0-i ? Now tell [me]0-i — but no , [I]0-i am quite tired out with [your]0-i being so clever . Besides , [I]0-i ’m sure [you]0-i ’d like [me]0-i to tell [you]0-i something , would n’t [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to know how it is that [the King]2789-the king has gone — ” “[2789-the king] Excuse [me]0-i , but [you]0-i should say ‘ [the King]2789-the king may‐he‐live‐for‐ever , ’ ” said [the Queen]382-the queen gently . “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon , ” [Anthea]133-anthea hastened to say—“the[0-i] King may‐he‐live‐for‐ever has gone to fetch [home]357-home [[his]2789-the king fourteenth wife]2795-his fourteenth wife ? [I]0-i do n’t think even [Bluebeard]178-bluebeard had as many as that . And , besides , [he]178-bluebeard has n’t killed [you]0-i at any rate . ” [The Queen]382-the queen looked bewildered . “[935-she] [She]935-she means , ” explained [Robert]132-robert , “[935-she] that [English kings]936-english kings only have [one wife]937-one wife — at least , [Henry the Eighth]179-henry the eighth had seven or eight , but not all at once . ” “[179-henry the eighth] In [[our]938-our country]939-our country , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen scornfully , “[940-a king] [a king]940-a king would not reign a day who had only [one wife]937-one wife . [No one]344-no one would respect [him]940-a king , and quite right too . ” “[344-no one] Then are [all the other thirteen]943-all the other thirteen alive ? ” asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “[344-no one] Of course [they]943-all the other thirteen are — poor mean‐spirited things ! [I]0-i do n’t associate with [them]943-all the other thirteen , of course , [I]0-i am [the Queen]382-the queen . [They]943-all the other thirteen ’re only [the wives]945-the wives . ” “[943-all the other thirteen] [I]0-i see , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , gasping . “[943-all the other thirteen] But oh , [[my]0-i dears]946-my dears , ” [the Queen]382-the queen went on , “[945-the wives] such a to‐do as there ’s been about [this last wife]947-this last wife ! [You]946-my dears never did ! It really was too funny . [We]948-we wanted [an Egyptian princess]949-an egyptian princess . [The King]2789-the king may‐he‐live‐for‐ever has got [a wife]951-a wife from [most of the important nations]952-most of the important nations , and [he]2789-the king had set [his]2789-the king heart on an Egyptian one to complete [his]2789-the king collection . Well , of course , to begin with , [we]948-we sent a handsome present of gold . [The Egyptian king]953-the egyptian king sent back some horses — quite a few ; [he]953-the egyptian king ’s fearfully stingy!—and [he]953-the egyptian king said [he]953-the egyptian king liked the gold very much , but what [they]954-they were really short of was lapis lazuli , so of course [we]948-we sent [him]953-the egyptian king some . But by that time [he]953-the egyptian king ’d begun to use the gold to cover the beams of the roof of [the Temple of the Sun‐God]955-the temple of the sun‐god , and [he]953-the egyptian king had n’t nearly enough to finish the job , so [we]948-we sent some more . And so it went on , oh , for years . [You]956-you see each journey takes at least six months . And at last [we]948-we asked the hand of [[his]953-the egyptian king daughter]957-his daughter in marriage . ” “[948-we] Yes , and then ? ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , who wanted to get to [the princess]2901-the princess part of the story . “[948-we] Well , then , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , “[948-we] when [he]953-the egyptian king ’d got everything out of [us]948-we that [he]953-the egyptian king could , and only given the meanest presents in return , [he]953-the egyptian king sent to say [he]953-the egyptian king would esteem the honour of an alliance very highly , only unfortunately [he]953-the egyptian king had n’t [any daughter]958-any daughter , but [he]953-the egyptian king hoped [one]346-one would be born soon , and if so , [she]346-one should certainly be reserved for [the King of [Babylon]40-babylon]960-the king of babylon ! ” “[953-the egyptian king] What a trick ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[953-the egyptian king] Yes , was n’t it ? So then [we]948-we said [[his]953-the egyptian king sister]961-his sister would do , and then there were more gifts and more journeys ; and now at last the tiresome , black‐haired thing is coming , and [the King]2789-the king may‐he‐live‐for‐ever has gone seven days ’ journey to meet [her]961-his sister at [Carchemish]50-carchemish . And [he]953-the egyptian king ’s gone in [[his]953-the egyptian king best chariot]963-his best chariot , the one inlaid with lapis lazuli and gold , with the gold‐plated wheels and onyx‐studded hubs — much too great an honour in [my]0-i opinion . [She]961-his sister ’ll be [here]2247-here tonight ; there ’ll be a grand banquet to celebrate [her]961-his sister arrival . [She]961-his sister wo n’t be present , of course . [She]961-his sister ’ll be having [her]961-his sister baths and [her]961-his sister anointings , and all that sort of thing . [We]948-we always clean [[our]948-we foreign brides]965-our foreign brides very carefully . It takes two or three weeks . Now it ’s dinner‐time , and [you]966-you shall eat with [me]0-i , for [I]0-i can see that [you]966-you are of high rank . ” [She]961-his sister led [them]966-you into [a dark , cool hall]2903-a dark , cool hall , with many cushions on the floor . On these [they]966-you sat , and low tables were brought — beautiful tables of smooth , blue stone mounted in gold . On these , golden trays were placed ; but there were no knives , or forks , or spoons . [The children]278-the children expected [the Queen]382-the queen to call for [them]966-you ; but no . [She]961-his sister just ate with [her]961-his sister fingers , and as the first dish was a great tray of boiled corn , and meat and raisins all mixed up together , and melted fat poured all over the tray , it was found difficult to follow [her]961-his sister example with anything like what [we]948-we are used to think of as good table manners . There were stewed quinces afterwards , and dates in syrup , and thick yellowy cream . It was the kind of dinner [you]966-you hardly ever get in [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street . After dinner [everybody]2317-everybody went to sleep , even [the children]278-the children . [The Queen]382-the queen awoke with a start . “[0-i] Good gracious ! ” [she]382-the queen cried , “[0-i] what a time [we]967-we ’ve slept ! [I]0-i must rush off and dress for the banquet . [I]0-i sha n’t have much more than time . ” “[0-i] Has n’t [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk got back with [[our]967-we sister]968-our sister and [the Psammead]136-the psammead yet ? ” [Anthea]133-anthea asked . “[0-i] [I]0-i quite forgot to ask . [I]0-i ’m sorry , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] And of course [they]969-they would n’t announce [her]968-our sister unless [I]0-i told [them]969-they to , except during justice hours . [I]0-i expect [she]968-our sister ’s waiting outside . [I]0-i ’ll see . ” [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk came in a moment later . “[0-i] [I]0-i regret , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] that [I]0-i have been unable to find [[your]970-your sister]917-your sister . The beast [she]968-our sister bears with [her]968-our sister in a basket has bitten [the child of the guard]972-the child of the guard , and [[your]970-your sister]917-your sister and the beast set out to come to [you]970-your . [The police]680-the police say [they]680-the police have a clue . No doubt [we]975-we shall have news of [her]968-our sister in a few weeks . ” [He]0-i bowed and withdrew . The horror of this threefold loss — [Jane]134-jane , [the Psammead]136-the psammead , and [the Amulet]2910-the amulet — gave [the children]278-the children something to talk about while [the Queen]382-the queen was dressing . [I]968-our sister shall not report [their]278-the children conversation ; it was very gloomy . [Every one]2347-every one repeated [himself]2347-every one several times , and the discussion ended in each of [them]278-the children blaming [the other two]2914-the other two for having let [Jane]134-jane go . [You]2915-you know the sort of talk it was , do n’t [you]2915-you ? At last [Cyril]131-cyril said — “[968-our sister] After all , [she]968-our sister ’s with [the Psammead]136-the psammead , so [she]968-our sister ’s all right . [The Psammead]136-the psammead is jolly careful of itself too . And it is n’t as if [we]976-we were in any danger . Let ’s try to buck up and enjoy the banquet . ” [They]278-the children did enjoy the banquet . [They]278-the children had a beautiful bath , which was delicious , were heavily oiled all over , including [their]278-the children hair , and that was most unpleasant . Then [they]278-the children dressed again and were presented to [the King]2789-the king , who was most affable . The banquet was long ; there were all sorts of nice things to eat , and [everybody]2317-everybody seemed to eat and drink a good deal . [Every one]2347-every one lay on cushions and couches , [ladies]2919-ladies on one side and [gentlemen]2654-gentlemen on the other ; and after the eating was done [each lady]2921-each lady went and sat by [some gentleman , who seemed to be [[her]2921-each lady sweetheart]2923-her sweetheart or [[her]2921-each lady husband]2850-her husband , for [they]278-the children were very affectionate to [each other]312-each other]2922-some gentleman , who seemed to be her sweetheart or her husband , for they were very affectionate to each other . The Court dresses had gold threads woven in them , very bright and beautiful . The middle of [the room]2349-the room was left clear , and [different people]2927-different people came and did amusing things . There were [conjurers]2928-conjurers and [jugglers]2929-jugglers and snake‐charmers , which last [Anthea]133-anthea did not like at all . When it got dark torches were lighted . Cedar splinters dipped in oil blazed in copper dishes set high on poles . Then there was [a dancer , who hardly danced at all , only just struck attitudes]2930-a dancer , who hardly danced at all , only just struck attitudes . [She]2930-a dancer , who hardly danced at all , only just struck attitudes had hardly any clothes , and was not at all pretty . [The children]278-the children were rather bored by [her]2930-a dancer , who hardly danced at all , only just struck attitudes , but [every one else]2932-every one else was delighted , including [the King]2789-the king . “[978-girl] By the beard of [Nimrod]180-nimrod ! ” [he]2789-the king cried , “[978-girl] ask what [you]977-you like [girl]978-girl , and [you]977-you shall have it ! ” “[977-you] [I]0-i want nothing , ” said [the dancer]2934-the dancer ; “[977-you] the honour of having pleased [the King]2789-the king may‐he‐live‐for‐ever is reward enough for [me]0-i . ” And [the King]2789-the king was so pleased with this modest and sensible reply that [he]2789-the king gave [her]2934-the dancer the gold collar off [his]2789-the king own neck . “[0-i] [I]0-i say ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , awed by the magnificence of the gift . “[0-i] It ’s all right , ” whispered [the Queen]382-the queen , “[2789-the king] it ’s not [his]2789-the king best collar by any means . [We]980-we always keep a stock of cheap jewellery for these occasions . And now — [you]0-i promised to sing [us]980-we something . Would [you]0-i like [[my]0-i minstrels]981-my minstrels to accompany [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] No , thank [you]0-i , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea quickly . [The minstrels]2937-the minstrels had been playing off and on all the time , and [their]2937-the minstrels music reminded [Anthea]133-anthea of [the band [she]133-anthea and [the others]325-the others had once had on the fifth of November]2938-the band she and the others had once had on the fifth of november — with penny horns , a tin whistle , a tea‐tray , the tongs , [a policeman]353-a policeman ’s rattle , and a toy drum . [They]2937-the minstrels had enjoyed [this band]2941-this band very much at the time . But it was quite different when [some one else]2942-some one else was making the same kind of music . [Anthea]133-anthea understood now that [Father]137-father had not been really heartless and unreasonable when [he]137-father had told [them]982-they to stop that infuriating din . “[0-i] What shall [we]982-they sing ? ” [Cyril]131-cyril was asking . “[0-i] Sweet and low ? ” suggested [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] Too soft — [I]0-i vote for ‘ Who will o’er [the downs]983-the downs . ’ Now then — one , two , three . ” [Jane]134-jane , [the alto]2943-the alto , was missing , and [Robert]132-robert , unlike [the mother of [the lady in the song]2945-the lady in the song]2944-the mother of the lady in the song , never could “[0-i] keep the key , ” but the song , even so , was sufficiently unlike anything any of [them]982-they had ever heard to rouse [the Babylonian Court]2946-the babylonian court to the wildest enthusiasm . “[0-i] More , more , ” cried [the King]2789-the king ; “[0-i] by [my]0-i beard , this savage music is a new thing . Sing again ! ” So [they]982-they sang : Shouts of applause greeted the ending of the verse , and [the King]2789-the king would not be satisfied till [they]982-they had sung all [their]982-they part‐songs ( [they]982-they only knew three ) twice over , and ended up with “[984-men of harlech] [Men of Harlech]984-men of harlech ” in unison .
