Then [the King]2789-the king stood up in [his]2789-the king royal robes with [his]2789-the king high , narrow crown on [his]2789-the king head and shouted — “[984-men of harlech] By the beak of [Nisroch]174-nisroch , ask what [you]985-you will , strangers from [the land where the sun never sets]2826-the land where the sun never sets ! ” “[987-we] [We]987-we ought to say it ’s enough honour , like [the dancer]2934-the dancer did , ” whispered [Anthea]133-anthea “[2934-the dancer] No , let ’s ask for It , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[2934-the dancer] No , no , [I]0-i ’m sure the other ’s manners , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . But [Robert]132-robert , who was excited by the music , and the flaring torches , and the applause and the opportunity , spoke up before [the others]325-the others could stop [him]132-robert . “[0-i] Give [us]987-we the half of the Amulet that has on it the name [UR‐HEKAU SETCHEH]181-ur‐hekau setcheh , ” [he]132-robert said , adding as an afterthought , “[181-ur‐hekau setcheh] O King , live for ever . ” As [he]132-robert spoke the great name those in [the pillared hall]2951-the pillared hall fell on [their]325-the others faces , and lay still . All but [the Queen who crouched amid [her]2952-the queen who crouched amid her cushions with her head in her hands cushions with [her]2952-the queen who crouched amid her cushions with her head in her hands head in [her]2952-the queen who crouched amid her cushions with her head in her hands hands]2952-the queen who crouched amid her cushions with her head in her hands , and [the King]2789-the king , who stood upright , perfectly still , like the statue of [a king in stone]2954-a king in stone . It was only for a moment though . Then [his]2789-the king great voice thundered out — “[0-i] Guard , seize [them]989-them ! ” Instantly , from nowhere as it seemed , sprang [eight soldiers in bright armour inlaid with gold , and tunics of red and white]2955-eight soldiers in bright armour inlaid with gold , and tunics of red and white . Very splendid [they]2955-eight soldiers in bright armour inlaid with gold , and tunics of red and white were , and very alarming . “[990-impious and sacrilegious wretches] [Impious and sacrilegious wretches]990-impious and sacrilegious wretches ! ” shouted [the King]2789-the king . “[0-i] to [the dungeons]991-the dungeons with [them]989-them ! [We]987-we will find a way , tomorrow , to make [them]989-them speak . For without doubt [they]989-them can tell [us]987-we where to find [the lost half of It]992-the lost half of it . ” A wall of scarlet and white and steel and gold closed up round [the children]278-the children and hurried [them]278-the children away among the many pillars of [the great hall]2958-the great hall . As [they]278-the children went [they]278-the children heard the voices of [the courtiers]2959-the courtiers loud in horror . “[989-them] [You]993-you ’ve done it this time , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril with extreme bitterness . “[993-you] Oh , it will come right . [It]994-it must . It always does , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea desperately . [They]278-the children could not see where [they]278-the children were going , because [the guard]2960-the guard surrounded [them]278-the children so closely , but the ground under [their]278-the children feet , smooth marble at first , grew rougher like stone , then it was loose earth and sand , and [they]278-the children felt the night air . Then there was more stone , and steps down . “[994-it] It ’s [my]0-i belief [we]987-we really are going to [the deepest dungeon below [the castle moat]996-the castle moat]995-the deepest dungeon below the castle moat this time , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . And [they]278-the children were . At least it was not below [a moat]2961-a moat , but below [the river Euphrates]51-the river euphrates , which was just as bad if not worse . In [a most unpleasant place]2962-a most unpleasant place [it]2962-a most unpleasant place was . Dark , very , very damp , and with an odd , musty smell rather like the shells of oysters . There was a torch — that is to say , a copper basket on a high stick with oiled wood burning in it . By its light [the children]278-the children saw that the walls were green , and that trickles of water ran down them and dripped from the roof . There were things on the floor that looked like newts , and in the dark corners creepy , shiny things moved sluggishly , uneasily , horribly . [Robert]132-robert ’s heart sank right into those really reliable boots of [his]132-robert . [Anthea]133-anthea and [Cyril]131-cyril each had a private struggle with that inside disagreeableness which is part of all of [us]987-we , and which is sometimes called the Old Adam — and both were [victors]2964-victors . [Neither of [them]278-the children]2965-neither of them said to [Robert]132-robert ( and both tried hard not even to think it ) , “[997-your] this is [your]997-your doing . ” [Anthea]133-anthea had the additional temptation to add , “[997-your] [I]0-i told [you]997-your so . ” And [she]133-anthea resisted it successfully . “[0-i] Sacrilege , and impious cheek , ” said [the captain of [the guard]2960-the guard]2966-the captain of the guard to [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler . “[0-i] to be kept during [the King]2789-the king ’s pleasure . [I]0-i expect [he]2789-the king means to get some pleasure out of [them]999-them tomorrow ! [He]2789-the king ’ll tickle [them]999-them up ! ” “[2789-the king] [Poor little kids]1000-poor little kids , ” said [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler . “[1000-poor little kids] Oh , yes , ” said [the captain]810-the captain . “[1000-poor little kids] [I]0-i ’ve got [kids]1001-kids of [my]0-i own too . But it does n’t do to let domestic sentiment interfere with one ’s public duties . Good night . ” [The soldiers]2971-the soldiers tramped heavily off in [their]2971-the soldiers white and red and steel and gold . [The gaoler]2968-the gaoler , with a bunch of big keys in [his]2968-the gaoler hand , stood looking pityingly at [the children]278-the children . [He]2968-the gaoler shook [his]2968-the gaoler head twice and went out . “[182-courage] [Courage]182-courage ! ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[182-courage] [I]0-i know it will be all right . It ’s only a dream really , [you]1002-you know . It must be ! [I]0-i do n’t believe about time being only a something or other of thought . It is a dream , and [we]1003-we ’re bound to wake up all right and safe . ” “[1004-old man] Humph , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril bitterly . And [Robert]132-robert suddenly said — “[1004-old man] It ’s all [my]0-i doing . If it really is all up do please not keep a down on [me]0-i about it , and tell [Father]137-father — Oh , [I]0-i forgot . ” What [he]132-robert had forgotten was that [[his]132-robert father]2539-his father was three thousand miles and five thousand or more years away from [him]132-robert . “[0-i] All right , [Bobs]161-bobs , [old man]1004-old man , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; and [Anthea]133-anthea got hold of [Robert]132-robert ’s hand and squeezed it . Then [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler came back with a platter of hard , flat cakes made of coarse grain , very different from the cream‐and‐juicy‐date feasts of [the palace]2811-the palace ; also a pitcher of water . “[1004-old man] There , ” [he]2968-the gaoler said . “[1004-old man] Oh , thank [you]1004-old man so very much . [You]1004-old man are kind , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea feverishly . “[1004-old man] Go to sleep , ” said [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler , pointing to a heap of straw in a corner ; “[1004-old man] tomorrow comes soon enough . ” “[1005-they] Oh , [dear Mr. Gaoler]183-dear mr. gaoler , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , “[1005-they] whatever will [they]1005-they do to [us]1006-we tomorrow ? ” “[1005-they] [They]1005-they ’ll try to make [you]1007-you tell things , ” said [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler grimly , “[1005-they] and [my]0-i advice is if [you]1007-you ’ve nothing to tell , make up something . Then perhaps [they]1005-they ’ll sell [you]1007-you to [the Northern nations]1008-the northern nations . [Regular savages]1009-regular savages [they]1005-they are . Good night . ” “[1005-they] Good night , ” said three trembling voices , which [[their]1005-they owners]2979-their owners strove in vain to render firm . Then [he]2968-the gaoler went out , and [the three]2340-the three were left alone in [the damp , dim vault]2981-the damp , dim vault . “[1005-they] [I]0-i know the light wo n’t last long , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , looking at the flickering brazier . “[0-i] Is it any good , do [you]0-i think , calling on the name when [we]1006-we have n’t got the charm ? ” suggested [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] [I]0-i should n’t think so . But [we]1006-we might try . ” So [they]1006-we tried . But the blank silence of [the damp dungeon]2982-the damp dungeon remained unchanged . “[1006-we] What was the name [the Queen]382-the queen said ? ” asked [Cyril]131-cyril suddenly . “[382-the queen] [Nisbeth]184-nisbeth — [Nesbit]185-nesbit — something ? [You]0-i know , [the slave of the great names]1011-the slave of the great names ? ” “[1011-the slave of the great names] Wait a sec , ” said [Robert]132-robert , “[1011-the slave of the great names] though [I]0-i do n’t know why [you]0-i want it . [Nusroch]186-nusroch — [Nisrock]52-nisrock — [Nisroch]174-nisroch — That ’s it . ” Then [Anthea]133-anthea pulled [herself]133-anthea together . All [her]133-anthea muscles tightened , and the muscles of [her]133-anthea mind and soul , if [you]2983-you can call [them]2984-them that , tightened too . “[174-nisroch] UR‐HEKAU SETCHEH , ” [she]133-anthea cried in a fervent voice . “[174-nisroch] Oh , [Nisroch]174-nisroch , [servant of [the Great Ones]511-the great ones]1012-servant of the great ones , come and help [us]1014-them ! ” There was a waiting silence . Then a cold , blue light awoke in the corner where the straw was — and in the light [they]1014-them saw coming towards [them]1014-them a strange and terrible figure . [I]174-nisroch wo n’t try to describe it , because [Mr. Millar]187-mr. millar will draw it for [you]2983-you , exactly as it was , and exactly as [the old Babylonians]2985-the old babylonians carved it on [their]2985-the old babylonians stones , so that [you]2983-you can see it in [[our]1014-them own British Museum]2986-our own british museum at this day . [I]174-nisroch will just say that it had eagle ’s wings and an eagle ’s head and the body of [a man]451-a man . It came towards [them]1014-them , strong and unspeakably horrible . “[174-nisroch] Oh , go away , ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea ; but [Cyril]131-cyril cried , “[174-nisroch] No ; stay ! ” [The creature]2312-the creature hesitated , then bowed low before [them]1014-them on the damp floor of [the dungeon]2989-the dungeon . “[188-the great ones] Speak , ” it said , in a harsh , grating voice like large rusty keys being turned in locks . “[188-the great ones] [the servant of [the Great Ones]188-the great ones]1015-the servant of the great ones is [[your]1016-your servant]1017-your servant . What is [your]1016-your need that [you]1016-your call on the name of [Nisroch]174-nisroch ? ” “[1016-your] [We]1018-we want to go [home]357-home , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[1018-we] No , no , ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea ; “[1018-we] [we]1018-we want to be where [Jane]134-jane is . ” [Nisroch]174-nisroch raised [his]1020-the servant of the great name great arm and pointed at the wall of [the dungeon]2989-the dungeon . And , as [he]1020-the servant of the great name pointed , the wall disappeared , and instead of the damp , green , rocky surface , there shone and glowed [a room]345-a room with rich hangings of red silk embroidered with golden water‐lilies , with cushioned couches and great mirrors of polished steel ; and in it was [the Queen]382-the queen , and before [her]382-the queen , on a red pillow , sat [the Psammead]136-the psammead , its fur hunched up in an irritated , discontented way . On a blue‐covered couch lay [Jane]134-jane fast asleep . “[134-jane] Walk forward without fear , ” said [Nisroch]174-nisroch . “[134-jane] Is there aught else that [the Servant of the great Name]1020-the servant of the great name can do for [those who speak that name]1021-those who speak that name ? ” “[1020-the servant of the great name] No — oh , no , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1020-the servant of the great name] It ’s all right now . Thanks ever so . ” “[1022-you] [You]1022-you are [a dear]441-a dear , ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea , not in the least knowing what [she]133-anthea was saying . “[1022-you] Oh , thank [you]1022-you thank [you]1022-you . But do go now ! ” [She]133-anthea caught the hand of the creature , and it was cold and hard in [hers]133-anthea , like a hand of stone . “[1022-you] Go forward , ” said [Nisroch]174-nisroch . And [they]2993-they went . “[1022-you] Oh , [my]0-i good gracious , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen as [they]2993-they stood before [her]382-the queen . “[1022-you] How did [you]1022-you get [here]2247-here ? [I]0-i knew [you]1022-you were magic . [I]0-i meant to let [you]1022-you out the first thing in the morning , if [I]0-i could slip away — but thanks be to [Dagon]189-dagon , [you]1022-you ’ve managed it for [yourselves]1022-you . [You]1022-you must get away . [I]0-i ’ll wake [[my]0-i chief lady]1025-my chief lady and [she]1025-my chief lady shall call [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk , and [he]163-ritti‐marduk ’ll let [you]1022-you out the back way , and — ” “[163-ritti‐marduk] Do n’t rouse [anybody]575-anybody for goodness ’ sake , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , “[134-jane] except [Jane]134-jane , and [I]0-i ’ll rouse [her]134-jane . ” [She]133-anthea shook [Jane]134-jane with energy , and [Jane]134-jane slowly awoke . “[134-jane] [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk brought [them]1027-them in hours ago , really , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , “[134-jane] but [I]0-i wanted to have [the Psammead]136-the psammead all to [myself]0-i for a bit . [You]1022-you ’ll excuse [the little natural deception?—it ’s part of the Babylonish character]1028-the little natural deception?—it ’s part of the babylonish character , do n’t [you]1022-you know ? But [I]0-i do n’t want anything to happen to [you]1022-you . Do let [me]0-i rouse [some one]376-some one . ” “[0-i] No , no , no , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea with desperate earnestness . [She]133-anthea thought [she]133-anthea knew enough of what [the Babylonians]2765-the babylonians were like when [they]2765-the babylonians were roused . “[0-i] [We]1030-we can go by [our]1030-we own magic . And [you]1022-you will tell [the King]2789-the king it was n’t [the gaoler]2968-the gaoler ’s fault . It was [Nisroch]174-nisroch . ” “[174-nisroch] [Nisroch]174-nisroch ! ” echoed [the Queen]382-the queen . “[174-nisroch] [You]174-nisroch are indeed [magicians]1033-magicians . ” [Jane]134-jane sat up , blinking stupidly . “[174-nisroch] Hold It up , and say the word , ” cried [Cyril]131-cyril , catching up the Psammead , which mechanically bit [him]131-cyril , but only very slightly . “[174-nisroch] Which is [the East]572-the east ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane . “[0-i] Behind [me]0-i , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] Why ? ” “[181-ur‐hekau setcheh] [Ur‐Hekau Setcheh]181-ur‐hekau setcheh , ” said [Jane]134-jane sleepily , and held up the charm . And there [they]1035-we all were in [the dining‐room at [300 Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street]2999-the dining‐room at 300 fitzroy street . “[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane , ” cried [Cyril]131-cyril with great presence of mind , “[174-nisroch] go and get the plate of sand down for [the Psammead]136-the psammead . ” [Jane]134-jane went . “[174-nisroch] Look here ! ” [he]131-cyril said quickly , as the sound of [her]134-jane boots grew less loud on the stairs , “[174-nisroch] do n’t let [’s]1035-we tell [her]134-jane about [the dungeon]2989-the dungeon and all that . It ’ll only frighten [her]134-jane so that [she]134-jane ’ll never want to go anywhere else . ” “[174-nisroch] Righto ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; but [Anthea]133-anthea felt that [she]133-anthea could not have said a word to save [her]133-anthea life . “[174-nisroch] Why did [you]1037-you want to come back in such a hurry ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane , returning with the plate of sand . “[1037-you] It was awfully jolly in [Babylon]40-babylon , [I]0-i think ! [I]0-i liked it no end . ” “[0-i] Oh , yes , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril carelessly . “[0-i] It was jolly enough , of course , but [I]0-i thought [we]1035-we ’d been [there]321-there long enough . [Mother]138-mother always says [you]1039-you ought n’t to wear out [your]1039-you welcome ! ” “[138-mother] NOW tell [us]1035-we what happened to [you]0-i , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril to [Jane]134-jane , when [he]131-cyril and [the others]325-the others had told [her]134-jane all about [the Queen]382-the queen ’s talk and the banquet , and the variety entertainment , carefully stopping short before the beginning of the dungeon part of the story . “[138-mother] It was n’t much good going , ” said [Jane]134-jane , “[0-i] if [you]0-i did n’t even try to get the Amulet . ” “[1035-we] [We]1035-we found out it was no go , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “[1035-we] it ’s not to be got in [Babylon]40-babylon . Now tell [us]1035-we about [your]0-i part . ” “[0-i] Oh , ” said [Jane]134-jane , “[0-i] [the Queen ’s man with the smooth face]1041-the queen ’s man with the smooth face — what was [his]1041-the queen ’s man with the smooth face name ? ” “[1041-the queen ’s man with the smooth face] [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[163-ritti‐marduk] Yes , ” said [Jane]134-jane , “[163-ritti‐marduk] [Ritti‐Marduk]163-ritti‐marduk , [he]1041-the queen ’s man with the smooth face came for [me]0-i just after [the Psammead]136-the psammead had bitten the [guard‐of‐the‐gate ’s wife ’s little boy]1042-guard‐of‐the‐gate ’s wife ’s little boy , and [he]1041-the queen ’s man with the smooth face took [me]0-i to [the Palace]2811-the palace . And [we]1035-we had supper with [the new little Queen from [Egypt]21-egypt]1044-the new little queen from egypt . [She]1044-the new little queen from egypt is a dear — not much older than [you]0-i . [I]0-i like [her]1044-the new little queen from egypt too . And [she]1044-the new little queen from egypt talked to [the Psammead]136-the psammead and [I]0-i went to sleep . And then [you]0-i woke [me]0-i up . That ’s all . ” [The Psammead]136-the psammead , roused from its sound sleep , told the same story . “[0-i] But , ” it added , “[0-i] what possessed [you]0-i to tell [that Queen]1046-that queen that [I]0-i could give wishes ? [I]0-i sometimes think [you]0-i were born without even the most rudimentary imitation of brains . ” [The children]278-the children did not know the meaning of rudimentary , but it sounded a rude , insulting word . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see that [we]1035-we did any harm , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril sulkily . “[0-i] Oh , no , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead with withering irony , “[1046-that queen] not at all ! Of course not ! Quite the contrary ! Exactly so ! Only [she]1046-that queen happened to wish that [she]1046-that queen might soon find [herself]1046-that queen in [[your]0-i country]1047-your country . And soon may mean any moment . ” “[1046-that queen] Then it ’s [your]0-i fault , ” said [Robert]132-robert , “[0-i] because [you]0-i might just as well have made ‘ soon ’ mean some moment next year or next century . ” “[0-i] That ’s where [you]0-i , as so often happens , make the mistake , ” rejoined [the Sand‐fairy]190-the sand‐fairy . “[1046-that queen] [I]0-i could n’t mean anything but what [she]1046-that queen meant by ‘ soon . ’ It was n’t [my]0-i wish . And what [she]1046-that queen meant was the next time [the King]2789-the king happens to go out lion hunting . So [she]1046-that queen ’ll have a whole day , and perhaps two , to do as [she]1046-that queen wishes with . [She]1046-that queen does n’t know about time only being a mode of thought . ” “[1046-that queen] Well , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , with a sigh of resignation , “[1046-that queen] [we]1049-we must do what [we]1049-we can to give [her]1046-that queen a good time . [She]1046-that queen was jolly decent to [us]1049-we . [I]0-i say , suppose [we]1049-we were to go to [St James ’s Park]10-st james ’s park after dinner and feed those ducks that [we]1049-we never did feed . After all that [Babylon]40-babylon and all those years ago , [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i should like to see something real , and now . [You]1050-you ’ll come , [Psammead]136-the psammead ? ” “[1050-you] Where ’s [my]0-i priceless woven basket of sacred rushes ? ” asked [the Psammead]136-the psammead morosely . “[1050-you] [I]0-i ca n’t go out with nothing on . And [I]0-i wo n’t , what ’s more . ” And then [everybody]2317-everybody remembered with pain that the bass bag had , in the hurry of departure from [Babylon]40-babylon , not been remembered . “[0-i] But it ’s not so extra precious , ” said [Robert]132-robert hastily . “[1050-you] [You]1050-you can get them given to [you]1050-you for nothing if [you]1050-you buy fish in [Farringdon Market]15-farringdon market . ” “[1050-you] Oh , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead very crossly indeed , “[1050-you] so [you]1050-you presume on [my]0-i sublime indifference to the things of this disgusting modern world , to fob [me]0-i off with a travelling equipage that costs [you]1050-you nothing . Very well , [I]0-i shall go to sand . Please do n’t wake [me]0-i . ” And it went then and there to sand , which , as [you]1050-you know , meant to bed . [The boys]313-the boys went to [St James ’s Park]10-st james ’s park to feed the ducks , but [they]313-the boys went alone . [Anthea]133-anthea and [Jane]134-jane sat sewing all the afternoon . [They]313-the boys cut off half a yard from each of [their]313-the boys best green Liberty sashes . A towel cut in two formed a lining ; and [they]313-the boys sat and sewed and sewed and sewed . What [they]313-the boys were making was a bag for [the Psammead]136-the psammead . [Each]2447-each worked at a half of the bag . [Jane]134-jane ’s half had four‐leaved shamrocks embroidered on it . They were the only things [she]134-jane could do ( because [she]134-jane had been taught how at [school]3006-school , and , fortunately , some of the silk [she]134-jane had been taught with was left over ) . And even so , [Anthea]133-anthea had to draw the pattern for [her]134-jane . [Anthea]133-anthea ’s side of the bag had letters on it — worked hastily but affectionately in chain stitch . They were something like this : [She]133-anthea would have put “[1050-you] [travelling carriage]1051-travelling carriage , ” but [she]133-anthea made the letters too big , so there was no room . The bag was made into a bag with [old Nurse]305-old nurse ’s sewing machine , and the strings of it were [Anthea]133-anthea ’s and [Jane]134-jane ’s best red hair ribbons . At tea‐time , when [the boys]313-the boys had come [home]357-home with a most unfavourable report of [the St James ’s Park]10-st james ’s park ducks , [Anthea]133-anthea ventured to awaken [the Psammead]136-the psammead , and to show [it]136-the psammead [its]136-the psammead new travelling bag . “[1050-you] Humph , ” [it]136-the psammead said , sniffing a little contemptuously , yet at the same time affectionately , “[1050-you] it ’s not so dusty . ” [The Psammead]136-the psammead seemed to pick up very easily the kind of things that [people]280-people said nowadays . For a creature that had in [its]136-the psammead time associated with Megatheriums and Pterodactyls , its quickness was really wonderful . “[1050-you] It ’s more worthy of [me]0-i , ” it said , “[1050-you] than the kind of bag that ’s given away with a pound of plaice . When do [you]1052-you propose to take [me]0-i out in it ? ” “[1052-you] [I]0-i should like a rest from taking [you]1052-you or [us]1053-us anywhere , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . But [Jane]134-jane said — “[0-i] [I]0-i want to go to [Egypt]21-egypt . [I]0-i did like [that Egyptian Princess that came to marry [the King in [Babylon]40-babylon]1055-the king in babylon]1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon . [She]1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon told [me]0-i about the larks [they]1056-they have in [Egypt]21-egypt . And the cats . Do let ’s go [there]321-there . And [I]0-i told [her]1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon what the bird things on the Amulet were like . And [she]1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon said it was Egyptian writing . ” [The others]325-the others exchanged looks of silent rejoicing at the thought of [their]325-the others cleverness in having concealed from [Jane]134-jane the terrors [they]325-the others had suffered in [the dungeon below [the Euphrates]51-the river euphrates]3012-the dungeon below the euphrates . “[1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon] [Egypt]21-egypt ’s so nice too , ” [Jane]134-jane went on , “[1054-that egyptian princess that came to marry the king in babylon] because of [[Doctor Brewer]191-doctor brewer ’s Scripture History]1058-doctor brewer ’s scripture history . [I]0-i would like to go there when [Joseph]192-joseph was dreaming those curious dreams , or when [Moses]193-moses was doing wonderful things with snakes and sticks . ” “[193-moses] [I]0-i do n’t care about snakes , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea shuddering . “[0-i] Well , [we]1059-we need n’t be in at that part , but [Babylon]40-babylon was lovely ! [We]1059-we had cream and sweet , sticky stuff . And [I]0-i expect [Egypt]21-egypt ’s the same . ” There was a good deal of discussion , but it all ended in [everybody]2317-everybody ’s agreeing to [Jane]134-jane ’s idea . And next morning directly after breakfast ( which was kippers , and very nice ) [the Psammead]400-the psammead was invited to get into [[his]400-the psammead travelling carriage]3015-his travelling carriage . The moment after it had done so , with stiff , furry reluctance , like that of a cat when [you]3016-you want to nurse it , and its ideas are not the same as [yours]3016-you , [old Nurse]142-old nurse came in . “[0-i] Well , [chickies]1060-chickies , ” [she]142-old nurse said , “[1060-chickies] are [you]1060-chickies feeling very dull ? ” “[1060-chickies] Oh , no , [Nurse]142-old nurse dear , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea ; “[142-old nurse] [we]1059-we ’re having a lovely time . [We]1059-we ’re just going off to see some old , ancient relics . ” “[1059-we] Ah , ” said [old Nurse]142-old nurse , “[1059-we] [the Royal Academy]1061-the royal academy , [I]0-i suppose ? Do n’t go wasting [your]1060-chickies money too reckless , that ’s all . ” [She]142-old nurse cleared away the kipper bones and the tea‐things , and when [she]142-old nurse had swept up the crumbs and removed the cloth , the Amulet was held up and the order given — just as [Duchesses]3017-duchesses ( and [other people]3018-other people ) give it to [[their]3017-duchesses coachmen]3019-their coachmen . “[1060-chickies] To [Egypt]21-egypt , please ! ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , when [Cyril]131-cyril had uttered the wonderful Name of Power . “[1060-chickies] When [Moses]193-moses was there , ” added [Jane]134-jane . And there , in [the dingy Fitzroy Street dining‐room]3020-the dingy fitzroy street dining‐room , the Amulet grew big , and it was an arch , and through it [they]1062-we saw a blue , blue sky and [a running river]3021-a running river . “[193-moses] No , stop ! ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , and pulled down [Jane]134-jane ’s hand with the Amulet in it . “[193-moses] What silly cuckoos [we]1062-we all are , ” [he]131-cyril said . “[193-moses] Of course [we]1062-we ca n’t go . [We]1062-we dare n’t leave [home]357-home for a single minute now , for fear that minute should be the minute . ” “[1062-we] What minute be what minute ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane impatiently , trying to get [her]134-jane hand away from [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1062-we] The minute when [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon comes , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . And then [every one]2347-every one saw it . For some days life flowed in a very slow , dusty , uneventful stream . [The children]278-the children could never go out all at once , because [they]278-the children never knew when [the King of [Babylon]40-babylon]960-the king of babylon would go out lion hunting and leave [[his]960-the king of babylon Queen]3025-his queen free to pay [them]278-the children that surprise visit to which [she]3025-his queen was , without doubt , eagerly looking forward . So [they]278-the children took it in turns , two and two , to go out and to stay in . The stay‐at‐homes would have been much duller than [they]278-the children were but for the new interest taken in [them]278-the children by [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . [He]2353-the learned gentleman called [Anthea]133-anthea in one day to show [her]133-anthea a beautiful necklace of purple and gold beads . “[2869-the queen of babylon] [I]0-i saw one like that , ” [she]133-anthea said , “[0-i] in — ” “[0-i] In [the British Museum]306-the british museum , perhaps ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i like to call [the place where [I]0-i saw it [Babylon]40-babylon]1066-the place where i saw it babylon , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea cautiously . “[0-i] A pretty fancy , ” said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , “[0-i] and quite correct too , because , as a matter of fact , these beads did come from [Babylon]40-babylon . ” [The other three]2339-the other three were all out that day . [The boys]313-the boys had been going to [the Zoo]417-the zoo , and [Jane]134-jane had said so plaintively , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sure [I]0-i am fonder of rhinoceroses than either of [you]1067-you are , ” that [Anthea]133-anthea had told [her]134-jane to run along then . And [she]134-jane had run , catching [the boys]313-the boys before that part of [the road]785-the road where [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street suddenly becomes [Fitzroy Square]57-fitzroy square . “[0-i] [I]0-i think [Babylon]40-babylon is most frightfully interesting , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] [I]0-i do have such interesting dreams about it — at least , not dreams exactly , but quite as wonderful . ” “[0-i] Do sit down and tell [me]0-i , ” said [he]0-i . So [she]133-anthea sat down and told . And [he]0-i asked [her]133-anthea a lot of questions , and [she]133-anthea answered them as well as [she]133-anthea could . “[0-i] Wonderful — wonderful ! ” [he]0-i said at last . “[346-one] [One]346-one ’s heard of thought‐transference , but [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i had any power of that sort . Yet it must be that , and very bad for [you]0-i , [I]0-i should think . Does n’t [your]0-i head ache very much ? ” [He]0-i suddenly put a cold , thin hand on [her]133-anthea forehead . “[0-i] No thank [you]0-i , not at all , ” said [she]133-anthea . “[0-i] [I]0-i assure [you]0-i it is not done intentionally , ” [he]0-i went on . “[0-i] Of course [I]0-i know a good deal about [Babylon]40-babylon , and [I]0-i unconsciously communicate it to [you]0-i ; [you]0-i ’ve heard of thought‐reading , but some of the things [you]0-i say , [I]0-i do n’t understand ; they never enter [my]0-i head , and yet they ’re so astoundingly probable . ” “[0-i] It ’s all right , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea reassuringly . “[0-i] [I]0-i understand . And do n’t worry . It ’s all quite simple really . ” It was not quite so simple when [Anthea]133-anthea , having heard [the others]325-the others come in , went down , and before [she]133-anthea had had time to ask how [they]325-the others had liked [the Zoo]417-the zoo , heard a noise outside , compared to which the wild beasts ’ noises were gentle as singing birds . “[194-november] Good gracious ! ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea , “[194-november] what ’s that ? ” The loud hum of many voices came through the open window . Words could be distinguished . “[1069-a guy] ’ Ere ’s [a guy]1069-a guy ! ” “[1069-a guy] This ai n’t [November]194-november . That ai n’t [no guy]1070-no guy . It ’s [a ballet lady]1071-a ballet lady , that ’s what it is . ” “[1071-a ballet lady] Not it — it ’s a bloomin ’ looney , [I]0-i tell [you]0-i . ” Then came a clear voice that [they]325-the others knew . “[0-i] [Retire]195-retire , [slaves]2875-slaves ! ” it said . “[1071-a ballet lady] What ’s [she]1071-a ballet lady a saying of ? ” cried [a dozen voices]3035-a dozen voices . “[1071-a ballet lady] [Some blamed foreign lingo]1073-some blamed foreign lingo , ” [one voice]3036-one voice replied . [The children]278-the children rushed to the door . [A crowd]426-a crowd was on [the road and pavement]3039-the road and pavement . In the middle of [the crowd]2541-the crowd , plainly to be seen from the top of the steps , were the beautiful face and bright veil of [the Babylonian Queen]3041-the babylonian queen . “[196-jimminy] [Jimminy]196-jimminy ! ” cried [Robert]132-robert , and ran down the steps , “[1071-a ballet lady] here [she]1071-a ballet lady is ! ” “[1071-a ballet lady] Here ! ” [he]132-robert cried , “[1074-the lady] look out — let [the lady]1074-the lady pass . [She]1071-a ballet lady ’s [a friend of [ours]1076-ours]1075-a friend of ours , coming to see [us]1076-ours . ” “[1071-a ballet lady] [Nice friend for [a respeckable house]1078-a respeckable house]1077-nice friend for a respeckable house , ” snorted [a fat woman with marrows on a hand‐cart]3042-a fat woman with marrows on a hand‐cart . All the same [the crowd]2541-the crowd made way a little . [The Queen]382-the queen met [Robert]132-robert on [the pavement]2257-the pavement , and [Cyril]131-cyril joined [them]1076-ours , the Psammead bag still on [his]131-cyril arm . “[1071-a ballet lady] Here , ” [he]132-robert whispered ; “[1071-a ballet lady] here ’s [the Psammead]136-the psammead ; [you]1079-you can get wishes . ” “[136-the psammead] [I]0-i wish [you]1079-you ’d come in a different dress , if [you]1079-you had to come , ” said [Robert]132-robert ; “[0-i] but it ’s no use [my]0-i wishing anything . ” “[0-i] No , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was dressed — no , [I]0-i don’t — [I]0-i wish [they]1080-they were dressed properly , then [they]1080-they would n’t be so silly . ” The Psammead blew itself out till the bag was a very tight fit for it ; and suddenly [every man]2635-every man , [woman]2636-woman , and [child in that crowd]3049-child in that crowd felt that it had not enough clothes on . For , of course , [the Queen]160-the queen ’s idea of proper dress was the dress that had been proper for [the working‐classes]3050-the working‐classes three thousand years ago in [Babylon]40-babylon — and there was not much of it . “[1080-they] Lawky [me]0-i ! ” said [the marrow‐selling woman]3051-the marrow‐selling woman , “[1080-they] whatever could a‐took [me]0-i to come out this figure ? ” and [she]3051-the marrow‐selling woman wheeled [her]3051-the marrow‐selling woman cart away very quickly indeed . “[1080-they] [Some one]376-some one ’s made [a pretty guy]1082-a pretty guy of [you]1083-you — talk of [guys]1084-guys , ” said [a man who sold bootlaces . “[376-some one] Well , do n’t [you]1083-you talk , ” said [the man next to [him]1083-you]3053-the man next to him]3052-a man who sold bootlaces . “ well , do n’t you talk , ” said the man next to him . “[1083-you] Look at [your]1083-you own silly legs ; and where ’s [your]1083-you boots ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never come out like this , [I]0-i ’ll take [my]0-i sacred , ” said [the bootlace‐seller]3054-the bootlace‐seller . “[0-i] [I]0-i was n’t quite [myself]0-i last night , [I]0-i ’ll own , but not to dress up like a circus . ” [The crowd]2541-the crowd was all talking at once , and getting rather angry . But [no one]344-no one seemed to think of blaming [the Queen]382-the queen . [Anthea]133-anthea bounded down the steps and pulled [her]133-anthea up ; [the others]325-the others followed , and the door was shut . “[0-i] Blowed if [I]0-i can make it out ! ” [they]325-the others heard . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m off [home]357-home , [I]0-i am . ” And [the crowd , coming slowly to the same mind]3059-the crowd , coming slowly to the same mind , dispersed , followed by [another crowd of persons who were not dressed in what [the Queen]382-the queen thought was the proper way]3060-another crowd of persons who were not dressed in what the queen thought was the proper way . “[0-i] [We]1086-we shall have [the police]680-the police [here]2247-here directly , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea in the tones of despair . “[1086-we] Oh , why did [you]0-i come dressed like that ? ” [The Queen]382-the queen leaned against the arm of the horse‐hair sofa . “[0-i] How else can [a queen]1089-a queen dress [I]0-i should like to know ? ” [she]382-the queen questioned . “[1086-we] [[Our]1086-we Queen]1090-our queen wears things like [other people]3018-other people , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1086-we] Well , [I]0-i do n’t . And [I]0-i must say , ” [she]382-the queen remarked in an injured tone , “[0-i] that [you]0-i do n’t seem very glad to see [me]0-i now [I]0-i have come . But perhaps it ’s the surprise that makes [you]0-i behave like this . Yet [you]0-i ought to be used to surprises . The way [you]0-i vanished ! [I]0-i shall never forget it . The best magic [I]0-i ’ve ever seen . How did [you]0-i do it ? ” “[0-i] Oh , never mind about that now , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[0-i] [You]0-i see [you]0-i ’ve gone and upset [all those people]1092-all those people , and [I]0-i expect [they]1092-all those people ’ll fetch [the police]680-the police . How frightfully interesting . ” “[0-i] No , no , not in [this room]347-this room ; in history . ” “[0-i] Oh , in that , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen disparagingly . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i ’d done it with [your]0-i own hands . ” [The girls]311-the girls shuddered . “[0-i] What [a hideous city]1101-a hideous city [yours]0-i is , ” [the Queen]382-the queen went on pleasantly , “[0-i] and what horrid , [ignorant people]1102-ignorant people . Do [you]0-i know [they]1102-ignorant people actually ca n’t understand a single word [I]0-i say . ” “[0-i] Can [you]0-i understand [them]1102-ignorant people ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane . “[0-i] Of course not ; [they]1102-ignorant people speak some vulgar , Northern dialect . [I]0-i can understand [you]0-i quite well . ” [I]0-i really am not going to explain again how it was that [the children]278-the children could understand other languages than [their]278-the children own so thoroughly , and talk [them]1102-ignorant people , too , so that it felt and sounded ( to [them]278-the children ) just as though [they]278-the children were talking English . “[0-i] Well , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril bluntly , “[0-i] now [you]0-i ’ve seen just how horrid it is , do n’t [you]0-i think [you]0-i might as well go [home]357-home again ? ” “[0-i] Why , [I]0-i ’ve seen simply nothing yet , ” said [the Queen]382-the queen , arranging [her]382-the queen starry veil . “[0-i] [I]0-i wished to be at [your]0-i door , and [I]0-i was . If only [we]1107-we could disguise [you]0-i a little . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea suddenly . “[0-i] [Mother]138-mother ’s old theatre cloak , and there are a lot of [her]138-mother old hats in the big box . ” The blue silk , lace‐trimmed cloak did indeed hide some of [the Queen]382-the queen ’s startling splendours , but the hat fitted very badly . It had pink roses in it ; and there was something about the coat or the hat or [the Queen]382-the queen , that made [her]138-mother look somehow not very respectable . “[138-mother] Oh , never mind , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , when [Cyril]131-cyril whispered this . “[138-mother] the thing is to get [her]138-mother out before [Nurse]142-old nurse has finished [her]142-old nurse forty winks . [I]0-i should think [she]138-mother ’s about got to the thirty‐ninth wink by now . ” “[138-mother] Come on then , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[138-mother] [You]0-i know how dangerous it is . [The party]2630-the party had no umbrellas , and the only parcel was the bag containing the Psammead , which [the Queen]382-the queen had insisted should be brought . “[680-the police] [I]0-i ’m not going to be left , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead softly , “[0-i] so do n’t [you]0-i think it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll wait outside with [you]0-i , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea hastily , and went to sit on the seat near the drinking fountain . “[0-i] Do n’t sit so near that nasty fountain , ” said [the creature]2312-the creature crossly ; “[0-i] [I]0-i might get splashed . ” [Anthea]133-anthea obediently moved to another seat and waited . Indeed [she]133-anthea waited , and waited , and waited , and waited , and waited . [The Psammead]136-the psammead dropped into an uneasy slumber . [Anthea]133-anthea had long ceased to watch the swing‐door that always let out [the wrong person]3079-the wrong person , and [she]133-anthea was [herself]133-anthea almost asleep , and still [the others]325-the others did not come back . It was quite a start when [Anthea]133-anthea suddenly realized that [they]325-the others had come back , and that [they]325-the others were not alone . [Every one]2347-every one seemed very angry . “[0-i] Now go , ” said [the nicest of [the angry gentlemen]3085-the angry gentlemen]3084-the nicest of the angry gentlemen . “[0-i] Take [the poor , demented thing]1113-the poor , demented thing [home]357-home and tell [[your]1115-you parents]1116-your parents [she]1113-the poor , demented thing ought to be properly looked after . ” “[0-i] If [you]1115-you ca n’t get [her]1113-the poor , demented thing to go [we]1117-we must send for [the police]680-the police , ” said [the nastiest gentleman]3086-the nastiest gentleman . “[680-the police] But [we]1117-we do n’t wish to use harsh measures , ” added [the nice one , who was really very nice indeed]3087-the nice one , who was really very nice indeed , and seemed to be over [all the others]3088-all the others . “[1117-we] May [I]0-i speak to [[my]0-i sister]1119-my sister a moment first ? ” asked [Robert]132-robert . [You]1115-you just go [home]357-home at once , and tell [[your]1115-you parents]1116-your parents exactly what has happened . ” [Anthea]133-anthea took [the Queen]382-the queen ’s hand and gently pulled [her]382-the queen away . [The other children]3097-the other children followed , and [the black crowd of angry gentlemen]3098-the black crowd of angry gentlemen stood on the steps watching [them]3097-the other children . It was when [the little party of disgraced children]3099-the little party of disgraced children , with [the Queen who had disgraced [them]3099-the little party of disgraced children]3100-the queen who had disgraced them , had reached the middle of [the courtyard]3101-the courtyard that [her]382-the queen eyes fell on the bag where the Psammead was . [She]382-the queen stopped short . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish , ” [she]382-the queen said , very loud and clear , “[0-i] that all those Babylonian things would come out to [me]0-i here — slowly , so that those dogs and [slaves]2875-slaves can see the working of [the great Queen]1137-the great queen ’s magic . ” “[1138-a tiresome woman] Oh , [you]0-i are [a tiresome woman]1138-a tiresome woman , ” said the Psammead in its bag , but it puffed itself out . Next moment there was a crash . The glass swing doors and all [their]3099-the little party of disgraced children framework were smashed suddenly and completely . [The crowd of angry gentlemen]3102-the crowd of angry gentlemen sprang aside when [they]3102-the crowd of angry gentlemen saw what had done this . But [the nastiest of [them]3102-the crowd of angry gentlemen]3103-the nastiest of them was not quick enough , and [he]3103-the nastiest of them was roughly pushed out of the way by an enormous stone bull that was floating steadily through the door . [It]3104-it came and stood beside [the Queen]382-the queen in the middle of [the courtyard]3101-the courtyard . It was followed by more stone images , by great slabs of carved stone , bricks , helmets , tools , weapons , fetters , wine‐jars , bowls , bottles , vases , jugs , saucers , seals , and the round long things , something like rolling pins with marks on them like the print of little bird‐feet , necklaces , collars , rings , armlets , earrings — heaps and heaps and heaps of things , far more than [anyone]283-anyone had time to count , or even to see distinctly . [All the angry gentlemen]3108-all the angry gentlemen had abruptly sat down on [the Museum steps]3109-the museum steps except the nice one . [He]3103-the nastiest of them stood with [his]3103-the nastiest of them hands in [his]3103-the nastiest of them pockets just as though [he]3103-the nastiest of them was quite used to seeing great stone bulls and all sorts of small Babylonish objects float out into [the Museum yard]3110-the museum yard . But [he]3103-the nastiest of them sent [a man]451-a man to close the big iron gates . [A journalist]3112-a journalist , who was just leaving [the museum]1108-the museum , spoke to [Robert]132-robert as [he]132-robert passed . “[0-i] Theosophy , [I]0-i suppose ? ” [he]0-i said . “[1139-she] Is [she]1139-she [Mrs. Besant]198-mrs. besant ? ” “[1139-she] Yes , ” said [Robert]132-robert recklessly . [The journalist]3114-the journalist passed through the gates just before they were shut . [He]3114-the journalist rushed off to [Fleet Street]58-fleet street , and [his]3114-the journalist paper got out a new edition within half an hour . “[1139-she] [MRS BESANT AND THEOSOPHY]198-mrs. besant . “ IMPERTINENT MIRACLE AT [THE BRITISH MUSEUM]306-the british museum . ”[1139-she] [People]280-people saw it in fat , black letters on the boards carried by [the sellers of newspapers]1141-the sellers of newspapers . [Some few people who had nothing better to do]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do went down to [the Museum]1108-the museum on the tops of omnibuses . But by the time [they]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do got there there was nothing to be seen . For [the Baby‐ lonian Queen]1144-the baby‐ lonian queen had suddenly seen the closed gates , had felt the threat of [them]1145-them , and had said — “ [I]1144-the baby‐ lonian queen wish [we]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do were in [[your]132-robert house]596-your house . ”[1144-the baby‐ lonian queen] And , of course , instantly [they]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do were . [The Psammead]136-the psammead was furious . “ Look here , ”[136-the psammead] it said , “ [they]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do ’ll come after [you]132-robert , and [they]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do ’ll find [me]136-the psammead . There ’ll be [a National Cage built for [me]136-the psammead at [Westminster]59-westminster]3117-a national cage built for me at westminster , and [I]136-the psammead shall have to work at politics . Why would n’t [you]132-robert leave the things in [[their]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do places]3118-their places ? ”[136-the psammead] “ What a temper [you]132-robert have , have n’t [you]132-robert ? ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen serenely . “ [I]382-the queen wish all the things were back in [their]1142-some few people who had nothing better to do places . Will that do for [you]132-robert ? ”[382-the queen] [The Psammead]136-the psammead swelled and shrank and spoke very angrily . “ [I]136-the psammead ca n’t refuse to give [your]132-robert wishes , ”[136-the psammead] it said , “ but [I]136-the psammead can [Bite]199-bite . And [I]136-the psammead will if this goes on . Now then . ”[136-the psammead] “ Ah , do n’t , ”[133-anthea] whispered [Anthea]133-anthea close to [its]136-the psammead bristling ear ; “ it ’s dreadful for [us]3119-we too . Do n’t [you]136-the psammead desert [us]3119-we . Perhaps [she]3120-she ’ll wish [herself]3120-she at [home]357-home again soon . ”[133-anthea] “ Not [she]3120-she , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead a little less crossly . “ Take [me]382-the queen to see [[your]132-robert City]3122-your city , ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen . [The children]278-the children looked at [each other]312-each other . “ If [we]3119-we had some money [we]3119-we could take [her]3120-she about in [a cab]3123-a cab . [People]280-people would n’t notice [her]3120-she so much then . But [we]3119-we have n’t . ”[278-the children] “ Sell this , ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen , taking a ring from [her]382-the queen finger . “ [They]280-people ’d only think [we]3119-we ’d stolen it , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril bitterly , “ and put [us]3119-we in [prison]892-prison . ”[131-cyril] “ [All roads]3126-all roads lead to [prison]892-prison with [you]1152-i , it seems , ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen . “ [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , and ran up to [him]1152-i with the ring in [her]133-anthea hand . “ Look here , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said , “ will [you]1152-i buy this for a pound ? ”[133-anthea] “ Oh ! ”[1152-i] [he]1152-i said in tones of joy and amazement , and took the ring into [his]1152-i hand . “ It ’s [my]133-anthea very own , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea ; “ it was given to [me]133-anthea to sell . ”[133-anthea] “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman ’ll lend [you]133-anthea a pound , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , “ with pleasure ; and [I]2353-the learned gentleman ’ll take care of the ring for [you]133-anthea . [I]1152-i never thought [my]1152-i Babylonish studies would bear fruit like this . Horrible ! There are more things in [heaven and earth]3133-heaven and earth — ”[1152-i] “ Yes , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ heaps more . And the pound is the thing [I]1152-i want more than anything on [earth]2796-earth . ”[1152-i] [He]1152-i ran [his]1152-i fingers through [his]1152-i thin hair . “ This thought‐transference ! ”[1152-i] [he]1152-i said . “ It ’s undoubtedly a Babylonian ring — or it seems so to [me]1152-i . [I]1152-i will see [a doctor]3135-a doctor the moment [I]1152-i have corrected the last proofs of [my]1152-i book . ”[1152-i] “ Yes , do ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ and thank [you]1152-i so very much . ”[133-anthea] [She]133-anthea took [the sovereign]1154-the sovereign and ran down to [the others]325-the others . And now from the window of [a four‐wheeled cab]1156-a four‐wheeled cab [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon beheld the wonders of [London]2-london . [Buckingham Palace]60-buckingham palace [she]133-anthea thought uninteresting ; [Westminster Abbey]61-westminster abbey and [the Houses of Parliament]1158-the houses of parliament were little better . But [she]133-anthea liked [the Tower]1159-the tower , and [the River]62-the river , and [the ships]1160-the ships filled [her]133-anthea with wonder and delight . “ But how badly [you]1152-i keep [[your]1152-i slaves]3136-your slaves . How wretched and poor and neglected [they]3136-your slaves seem , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said , as [the cab]310-the cab rattled along [the Mile End Road]1162-the mile end road . “ [They]3136-your slaves are [n’t slaves]3137-n’t slaves ; [they]3136-your slaves ’re [working‐people]3138-working‐people , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ Of course [they]3136-your slaves ’re [working‐people]3138-working‐people . That ’s what [slaves]2875-slaves are . Do n’t [you]1152-i tell [me]134-jane . Do [you]1152-i suppose [I]134-jane do n’t know [a slave]3141-a slave ’s face when [I]134-jane see it ? Tell [me]134-jane in three words . ”[134-jane] [No one]344-no one answered . The wage‐system of [modern England]1164-modern england is a little difficult to explain in three words even if [you]1165-you understand it — which [the children]278-the children did n’t . “ [You]1152-i ’ll have a revolt of [[your]1152-i slaves]3136-your slaves if [you]1152-i ’re not careful , ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen . “ Oh , no , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “ [you]1152-i see [they]3136-your slaves have votes — that makes [them]3136-your slaves safe not to revolt . It makes all the difference . [Father]137-father told [me]131-cyril so . ”[131-cyril] “ What is this vote ? ”[382-the queen] asked [the Queen]382-the queen . “ Is it a charm ? What do [they]3136-your slaves do with it ? ”[382-the queen] “ [I]131-cyril do n’t know , ”[131-cyril] said [the harassed Cyril]131-cyril ; “ it ’s just a vote , that ’s all ! [They]3136-your slaves do n’t do anything particular with it . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]382-the queen see , ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen ; “ a sort of plaything . Well , [I]382-the queen wish that [all these slaves]3144-all these slaves may have in [their]3144-all these slaves hands this moment [their]3144-all these slaves full of [their]3144-all these slaves favourite meat and drink . ”[382-the queen] Instantly [all the people in [the Mile End Road]1162-the mile end road]1170-all the people in the mile end road , and in [all [the other streets]1173-the other streets where [poor people]1174-poor people live]1172-all the other streets where poor people live , found [their]1170-all the people in the mile end road hands full of things to eat and drink . From [the cab]310-the cab window could be seen [persons carrying every kind of food]1176-persons carrying every kind of food , and bottles and cans as well . Roast meat , fowls , red lobsters , great yellowy crabs , fried fish , boiled pork , beef‐steak puddings , baked onions , mutton pies ; [most of [the young people]1178-the young people]1177-most of the young people had oranges and sweets and cake . It made an enormous change in the look of [the Mile End Road]63-the mile end road — brightened it up , so to speak , and brightened up , more than [you]1179-you can possibly imagine , the faces of [the people]2548-the people . “ Makes a difference , does n’t it ? ”[382-the queen] said [the Queen]382-the queen . “ That ’s the best wish [you]1179-you ’ve had yet , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane with cordial approval . Just by [the Bank]1182-the bank [the cabman]1183-the cabman stopped . “ [I]1183-the cabman ai n’t agoin ’ to drive [you]1179-you no further , ”[1183-the cabman] [he]1183-the cabman said . “ Out [you]1179-you gets . ”[1183-the cabman] [They]1184-they got out rather unwillingly . “ [I]1183-the cabman wants [my]1183-the cabman tea , ”[1183-the cabman] [he]1183-the cabman said ; and [they]1184-they saw that on the box of [the cab]310-the cab was a mound of cabbage , with pork chops and apple sauce , a duck , and a spotted currant pudding . Also a large can . “ [You]1179-you pay [me]1183-the cabman [my]1183-the cabman fare , ”[1183-the cabman] [he]1183-the cabman said threateningly , and looked down at the mound , muttering again about [his]1183-the cabman tea . “ [We]1184-they ’ll take [another cab]3145-another cab , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril with dignity . “ Give [me]131-cyril change for [a sovereign]3146-a sovereign , if [you]1179-you please . ”[131-cyril] But [the cabman]1183-the cabman , as it turned out , was not at all a nice character . [He]1183-the cabman took the sovereign , whipped up [his]1183-the cabman horse , and disappeared in the stream of [cabs]1187-cabs and [omnibuses and wagons]1188-omnibuses and wagons , without giving [them]1184-they any change at all . Already [a little crowd]1189-a little crowd was collecting round [the party]2630-the party . “ Come on , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , leading the wrong way . [They]1184-they were in [a narrow street where [many gentlemen in black coats and without hats]1193-many gentlemen in black coats and without hats were standing about on [the pavement]2257-the pavement talking very loudly]1192-a narrow street where many gentlemen in black coats and without hats were standing about on the pavement talking very loudly . “ How ugly [their]1193-many gentlemen in black coats and without hats clothes are , ”[2869-the queen of babylon] said [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon . “ [They]1193-many gentlemen in black coats and without hats ’d be [rather fine men]3147-rather fine men , [some of [them]1193-many gentlemen in black coats and without hats]3148-some of them , if [they]1193-many gentlemen in black coats and without hats were dressed decently , especially [the ones with the beautiful long , curved noses]3149-the ones with the beautiful long , curved noses . The moment [the almost fainting Psammead]136-the psammead had blown itself out [every man in [Throgmorton Street]64-throgmorton street]1196-every man in throgmorton street appeared abruptly in Babylonian full dress . [All]655-all were carefully powdered , [their]655-all hair and beards were scented and curled , [their]655-all garments richly embroidered . [They]655-all wore rings and armlets , flat gold collars and swords , and impossible‐looking head‐dresses . A stupefied silence fell on [them]655-all . “ [I]1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired say , ”[1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired] [a youth who had always been fair‐haired]1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired broke that silence , “ it ’s only fancy of course — something wrong with [my]1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired eyes — but [you]655-all [chaps]3152-chaps do look so rum . ”[1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired] “ [Rum]200-rum , ”[1199-his friend] said [[his]1198-a youth who had always been fair‐haired friend]1199-his friend . “ Look at [you]655-all . A bad tream — a bad tream . ” [The Members of [the Stock Exchange]3158-the stock exchange]3157-the members of the stock exchange are said to be at all times a noisy lot . [One]203-one had to shout before [one]346-one could hear [oneself]346-one speak . “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish , ” said [the clerk who thought it was conjuring]3161-the clerk who thought it was conjuring — [he]0-i was quite close to [the children]278-the children and [they]278-the children trembled , because [they]278-the children knew that whatever [he]0-i wished would come true . “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish [we]1202-they knew who ’d done it . ” And , of course , instantly [they]1202-they did know , and [they]1202-they pressed round [the Queen]382-the queen . “[680-the police] Scandalous ! Shameful ! Ought to be put down by law . Give [her]1203-her in charge . Fetch [the police]680-the police , ” [two or three voices]3164-two or three voices shouted at once . [The Queen]160-the queen recoiled . “[680-the police] What is it ? ” [she]382-the queen asked . “[680-the police] [they]680-the police sound like caged lions — lions by the thousand . What is it that [they]680-the police say ? ” “[680-the police] [They]680-the police say ‘ [Police]1205-police ! , ’ ” said [Cyril]131-cyril briefly . “[680-the police] [I]0-i knew [they]680-the police would sooner or later . And [I]0-i do n’t blame [them]680-the police , mind [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [[my]0-i guards]1206-my guards were [here]2247-here ! ” cried [the Queen]382-the queen . [The exhausted Psammead]136-the psammead was panting and trembling , but [[the Queen]382-the queen ’s guards]3167-the queen ’s guards in red and green garments , and brass and iron gear , choked [Throgmorton Street]64-throgmorton street , and bared weapons flashed round [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m mad , ” said [a Mr Rosenbaum]204-a mr rosenbaum ; “[0-i] dat ’s what it is — mad ! ” “[0-i] It ’s a judgement on [you]0-i , [Rosy]205-rosy , ” said [[his]0-i partner]3169-his partner . “[205-rosy] [I]0-i always said [you]0-i were too hard in that matter of [Flowerdew]206-flowerdew . It ’s a judgement , and [I]0-i ’m in it too . ” [The members of [the Stock Exchange]3158-the stock exchange]3157-the members of the stock exchange had edged carefully away from the gleaming blades , the mailed figures , the hard , cruel Eastern faces . But [Throgmorton Street]64-throgmorton street is narrow , and [the crowd]2541-the crowd was too thick for [them]3157-the members of the stock exchange to get away as quickly as [they]3157-the members of the stock exchange wished . “[0-i] Kill [them]1208-them , ” cried [the Queen]382-the queen . “[0-i] Kill the dogs ! ” [The guards]3174-the guards obeyed . “[0-i] It is all a dream , ” cried [Mr Levinstein]202-old mr levinstein , cowering in a doorway behind [[his]202-old mr levinstein clerk]1200-his clerk . “[0-i] It is n’t , ” said [the clerk]1201-the clerk . “[0-i] It is n’t . [Henry Hirsh]207-henry hirsh is down now , and [Prentice]208-prentice is cut in two — oh , [Lord]1212-lord ! and [Huth]209-huth , and there goes [Lionel Cohen]210-lionel cohen with [his]210-lionel cohen head off , and [Guy Nickalls]211-guy nickalls has lost [his]211-guy nickalls head now . A dream ? [I]0-i wish to goodness it was all a dream . ” And , of course , instantly it was ! [The entire Stock Exchange]3177-the entire stock exchange rubbed [its]3177-the entire stock exchange eyes and went back to close , to over , and either side of seven‐eights , and [Trunks]212-trunks , and [Kaffirs]213-kaffirs , and Steel Common , and Contangoes , and Backwardations , Double Options , and all the interesting subjects concerning which [they]3177-the entire stock exchange talk in [the Street]481-the street without ceasing . [No one]344-no one said a word about it to [anyone else]529-anyone else . [I]0-i think [I]0-i have explained before that [business men]3181-business men do not like it to be known that [they]3181-business men have been dreaming in business hours . Especially mad dreams including such dreadful things as [hungry people]3182-hungry people getting dinners , and the destruction of [the Stock Exchange]3158-the stock exchange . [The children]278-the children were in [the dining‐room at 300 , [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street]3185-the dining‐room at 300 , fitzroy street , pale and trembling . [The Psammead]136-the psammead crawled out of the embroidered bag , and lay flat on the table , its leg stretched out , looking more like a dead hare than anything else . “[0-i] Thank Goodness that ’s over , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , drawing a deep breath . “[0-i] [She]1213-she wo n’t come back , will [she]1213-she ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane tremulously . “[1213-she] No , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1213-she] [she]1213-she ’s thousands of years ago . But [we]1214-we spent a whole precious pound on [her]1213-she . It ’ll take all [our]1214-we pocket‐money for ages to pay that back . ” “[162-panther] Not if it was all a dream , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[162-panther] The wish said all a dream , [you]1215-you know , [Panther]162-panther ; [you]1215-you cut up and ask if [he]1216-you lent [you]1215-you anything . ” “[162-panther] [I]0-i beg [your]1216-you pardon , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea politely , following the sound of [her]133-anthea knock into the presence of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , “[1216-you] [I]0-i ’m so sorry to trouble [you]1216-you , but did [you]1216-you lend [me]0-i a pound today ? ” “[1216-you] No , ” said [he]2353-the learned gentleman , looking kindly at [her]133-anthea through [his]2353-the learned gentleman spectacles . “[1216-you] But it ’s extraordinary that [you]1215-you should ask [me]0-i , for [I]0-i dozed for a few moments this afternoon , a thing [I]0-i very rarely do , and [I]0-i dreamed quite distinctly that [you]1215-you brought [me]0-i a ring that [you]1215-you said belonged to [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon , and that [I]0-i lent [you]1215-you [a sovereign]3146-a sovereign , and that [you]1215-you left one of [the Queen]382-the queen ’s rings here . The ring was a magnificent specimen . ” [He]2353-the learned gentleman sighed . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish it had n’t been a dream , ” [he]2353-the learned gentleman said smiling . [He]2353-the learned gentleman was really learning to smile quite nicely . [Anthea]133-anthea could not be too thankful that [the Psammead]136-the psammead was not there to grant [his]2353-the learned gentleman wish . [YOU]3187-you will understand that the adventure of [the Babylonian queen in [London]2-london]3188-the babylonian queen in london was the only one that had occupied any time at all . But [the children]278-the children ’s time was very fully taken up by talking over all the wonderful things seen and done in the Past , where , by the power of the Amulet , [they]278-the children seemed to spend hours and hours , only to find when [they]278-the children got back to [London]2-london that the whole thing had been briefer than a lightning flash . [They]278-the children talked of the Past at [their]278-the children meals , in [their]278-the children walks , in [the dining‐room]3190-the dining‐room , in [the first‐floor drawing‐room]3191-the first‐floor drawing‐room , but most of all on the stairs . [It]3192-it was [an old house]3193-an old house ; [it]3192-it had once been [a fashionable one]3194-a fashionable one , and was a fine one still . The banister rails of the stairs were excellent for sliding down , and in the corners of [the landings]3195-the landings were big alcoves that had once held graceful statues , and now quite often held the graceful forms of [Cyril]131-cyril , [Robert]132-robert , [Anthea]133-anthea , and [Jane]134-jane . One day [Cyril]131-cyril and [Robert]132-robert in tight white underclothing had spent a pleasant hour in reproducing the attitudes of statues seen either in [the British Museum]306-the british museum , or in [Father]137-father ’s big photograph book . But the show ended abruptly because [Robert]132-robert wanted to be [the Venus of [Milo]66-milo]3197-the venus of milo , and for this purpose pulled at the sheet which served for drapery at the very moment when [Cyril]131-cyril , looking really quite like the Discobolos — with a gold and white saucer for the disc — was standing on one foot , and under that one foot was the sheet . Of course [the Discobolos]214-the discobolos and [his]131-cyril disc and the would‐be Venus came down together , and every one was a good deal hurt , especially the saucer , which would never be the same again , however neatly one might join its uneven bits with seccotine or the white of an egg . “[0-i] [I]0-i hope [you]1220-you ’re satisfied , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , holding [his]131-cyril head where a large lump was rising . “[1220-you] Quite , thanks , ” said [Robert]132-robert bitterly . [His]132-robert thumb had caught in the banisters and bent itself back almost to breaking point . “[0-i] [I]0-i am so sorry , poor , dear [Squirrel]215-squirrel , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea ; “[215-squirrel] and [you]215-squirrel were looking so lovely . [I]0-i ’ll get a wet rag . [Bobs]161-bobs , go and hold [your]161-bobs hand under the hot‐water tap . It ’s what [ballet girls]1221-ballet girls do with [their]1221-ballet girls legs when [they]1221-ballet girls hurt [them]1221-ballet girls . [I]0-i saw it in a book . ” “[0-i] What book ? ” said [Robert]132-robert disagreeably . But [he]132-robert went . When [he]132-robert came back [Cyril]131-cyril ’s head had been bandaged by [[his]131-cyril sisters]3198-his sisters , and [he]131-cyril had been brought to the state of mind where [he]131-cyril was able reluctantly to admit that [he]131-cyril supposed [Robert]132-robert had n’t done it on purpose . [It]1224-its will like [us]1222-we asking , even if [we]1222-we do n’t take it . ” The Psammead was brought up in its green silk embroidered bag , but before it could be asked anything the door of [[the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s room]737-the learned gentleman ’s room opened and the voice of [the visitor who had been lunching with [him]2353-the learned gentleman]3204-the visitor who had been lunching with him was heard on the stairs . [The others]325-the others followed . The Amulet grew smaller again , and there [they]325-the others all were , standing on the deck of [a ship whose [sailors]2552-sailors were busy making [her]3224-a ship whose sailors were busy making her fast with chains to rings on a white quay‐side fast with chains to rings on [a white quay‐side]3226-a white quay‐side]3224-a ship whose sailors were busy making her fast with chains to rings on a white quay‐side . What [they]325-the others saw was the most beautiful sight any of [them]325-the others had ever seen — or ever dreamed of . [The blue sea]3236-the blue sea sparkled in soft sunlight ; little white‐capped waves broke softly against the marble breakwaters that guarded the shipping of [a great city]3237-a great city from [the wildness of winter winds and seas]3238-the wildness of winter winds and seas . [The quay]3239-the quay was of marble , white and sparkling with a veining bright as gold . [The city]3240-the city was of marble , red and white . [The greater buildings]3241-the greater buildings that seemed to be [temples and palaces]3242-temples and palaces were roofed with what looked like gold and silver , but most of the roofs were of copper that glowed golden‐red on [the houses on [the hills among which [the city]3240-the city]3244-the hills among which the city stood]3243-the houses on the hills among which the city stood , and shaded into marvellous tints of green and blue and purple where they had been touched by the salt sea spray and the fumes of the dyeing and smelting works of [the lower town]3246-the lower town .
