There were [streets]2520-streets and [shops]3275-shops and [houses]2783-houses and [markets]3277-markets . “[1277-him] It ’s just like [Babylon]40-babylon , ” whispered [Jane]134-jane , “[1277-him] only everything ’s perfectly different . ” “[1277-him] It ’s a great comfort [the ten Kings]1279-the ten kings have been properly brought up — to be kind to [strangers]1269-strangers , ” [Anthea]133-anthea whispered to [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1279-the ten kings] Yes , ” [he]131-cyril said , “[1279-the ten kings] [no deepest dungeons here]1281-no deepest dungeons here . ” There were no horses or chariots in [the street]481-the street , but there were handcarts and low trolleys running on thick log‐wheels , and [porters]3279-porters carrying packets on [their]3279-porters heads , and [a good many of [the people]2548-the people]3280-a good many of the people were riding on what looked like elephants , only the great beasts were hairy , and [they]3280-a good many of the people had not that mild expression [we]3282-we are accustomed to meet on the faces of the elephants at [the Zoo]417-the zoo . “[1279-the ten kings] Mammoths ! ” murmured [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , and stumbled over a loose stone . [The people in [the streets]3286-the streets]3285-the people in the streets kept crowding round [them]3285-the people in the streets as [they]3285-the people in the streets went along , but [the Captain]810-the captain always dispersed [the crowd]2541-the crowd before it grew uncomfortably thick by saying — “[1279-the ten kings] [Children of the Sun God]222-children of the sun god and [[their]222-children of the sun god High Priest]1282-their high priest — come to bless [the City]3240-the city . ” And then [the people]2548-the people would draw back with a low murmur that sounded like a suppressed cheer . [Many of [the buildings]3291-the buildings]3290-many of the buildings were covered with gold , but the gold on [the bigger buildings]3292-the bigger buildings was of a different colour , and [they]3292-the bigger buildings had sorts of steeples of burnished silver rising above [them]3292-the bigger buildings . “[1282-their high priest] Are all [these houses]2519-these houses real gold ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane . “[1282-their high priest] [The temples]1285-the temples are covered with gold , of course , ” answered [the Captain]810-the captain , “[1282-their high priest] but [the houses]828-the houses are only oricalchum . It ’s not quite so expensive . ” [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , now very pale , stumbled along in a dazed way , repeating : “[1282-their high priest] [Oricalchum]74-oricalchum — oricalchum . ” “[1282-their high priest] Do n’t be frightened , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea ; “[1282-their high priest] [we]1287-we can get [home]357-home in a minute , just by holding up the charm . Would [you]1289-you rather go back now ? [We]1287-we could easily come some other day without [you]1289-you . ” “[1287-we] Oh , no , no , ” [he]2353-the learned gentleman pleaded fervently ; “[1287-we] let the dream go on . Please , please do . ” “[220-ji — jimmy] [The High Ji]220-ji — jimmy — [jimmy]219-jimmy is perhaps weary with [his]219-jimmy magic journey , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain , noticing the blundering walk of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ; “[219-jimmy] and [we]1287-we are yet very far from [the Great Temple]1290-the great temple , where today [the Kings]1267-the kings make sacrifice . ” [He]810-the captain stopped at the gate of [a great enclosure]3297-a great enclosure . [It]1290-the great temple seemed to be a sort of park , for trees showed high above [its]1290-the great temple brazen wall . [The party]2630-the party waited , and almost at once [the Captain]810-the captain came back with one of the hairy elephants and begged [them]2630-the party to mount . This [they]2630-the party did . It was a glorious ride . The elephant at [the Zoo]417-the zoo — to ride on [him]220-ji — jimmy is also glorious , but [he]220-ji — jimmy goes such a very little way , and then [he]220-ji — jimmy goes back again , which is always dull . But this great hairy beast went on and on and on along [streets]2520-streets and through [squares and gardens]3302-squares and gardens . [It]1290-the great temple was [a glorious city]3303-a glorious city ; almost everything was built of marble , red , or white , or black . Every now and then [the party]2630-the party crossed [a bridge]3305-a bridge . It was not till [they]2630-the party had climbed to the hill which is [the centre of [the town]783-the town]3306-the centre of the town that [they]2630-the party saw that [the whole city]3308-the whole city was divided into twenty circles , alternately [land and water]3309-land and water , and over each of [the water circles]3310-the water circles were [the bridges by which [they]2630-the party had come]3311-the bridges by which they had come . And now [they]2630-the party were in [a great square]3312-a great square . [A vast building filled up one side of [it]3312-a great square]3313-a vast building filled up one side of it ; [it]3313-a vast building filled up one side of it was overlaid with gold , and had a dome of silver . The rest of [the buildings round [the square]3315-the square]3314-the buildings round the square were of oricalchum . And [it]3313-a vast building filled up one side of it looked more splendid than [you]1292-you can possibly imagine , standing up bold and shining in the sunlight . “[1292-you] [You]1292-you would like a bath , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain , as the hairy elephant went clumsily down on [his]3317-his knees . “[1292-you] It ’s customary , [you]1292-you know , before entering [the Presence]1293-the presence . [We]1294-we have baths for [men]2526-men , [women]2450-women , horses , and cattle . [The High Class Baths]1297-the high class baths are [here]2247-here . [[Our]1294-we Father [Poseidon]221-poseidon]1299-our father poseidon gave [us]1294-we a spring of hot water and one of cold . ” [The children]278-the children had never before bathed in baths of gold . “[221-poseidon] It feels very splendid , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , splashing . “[221-poseidon] At least , of course , it ’s not gold ; it ’s or — what ’s its name , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[219-jimmy] Hand over that towel . ” [The bathing hall]3319-the bathing hall had several great pools sunk below the level of the floor ; one went down to [them]3319-the bathing hall by steps . “[219-jimmy] [Jimmy]219-jimmy , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea timidly , when , very clean and boiled‐looking , [they]1294-we all met in [the flowery courtyard of [the Public]3321-the public]3320-the flowery courtyard of the public , “[219-jimmy] do n’t [you]219-jimmy think all this seems much more like now than [Babylon]40-babylon or [Egypt]21-egypt — ? Oh , [I]0-i forgot , [you]219-jimmy ’ve never been [there]321-there . ” “[219-jimmy] [I]0-i know a little of [those nations]1301-those nations , however , ” said [he]0-i , “[0-i] and [I]0-i quite agree with [you]219-jimmy . A most discerning remark — [[my]0-i dear]533-my dear , ” [he]0-i added awkwardly ; “[533-my dear] [this city]453-this city certainly seems to indicate a far higher level of civilization than [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian or [Babylonish]42-babylonish , and — ” “[0-i] Follow [me]0-i , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain . “[0-i] Now , [boys]1305-boys , get out of the way . ” [He]0-i pushed through [a little crowd of boys who were playing with dried chestnuts fastened to a string]3323-a little crowd of boys who were playing with dried chestnuts fastened to a string . “[223-ginger] [Ginger]223-ginger ! ” remarked [Robert]132-robert , “[1306-they] [they]1306-they ’re playing conkers , just like [the kids in [Kentish Town Road]75-kentish town road]1307-the kids in kentish town road ! ” [They]1305-boys could see now that three walls surrounded [the island on which [they]1305-boys were]3324-the island on which they were . The outermost wall was of brass , [the Captain]810-the captain told [them]1305-boys ; the next , which looked like silver , was covered with tin ; and [the innermost one]3326-the innermost one was of oricalchum . And right in the middle was a wall of gold , with golden towers and gates . “[1306-they] Behold [the Temples of [Poseidon]221-poseidon]1308-the temples of poseidon , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain . “[221-poseidon] It is not lawful for [me]0-i to enter . [I]0-i will await [your]1305-boys return here . ” [He]0-i told [them]1305-boys what [they]1305-boys ought to say , and [the five people from [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street]3328-the five people from fitzroy street took hands and went forward . The golden gates slowly opened . “[0-i] [We]1309-we are [the children of the Sun]1310-the children of the sun , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , as [he]131-cyril had been told , “[1310-the children of the sun] and [[our]1309-we High Priest]1311-our high priest , at least that ’s what [the Captain]810-the captain calls [him]1311-our high priest . [We]1309-we have a different name for [him]1311-our high priest at [home]357-home . ” “[1309-we] What is [his]1311-our high priest name ? ” asked [a white‐robed man who stood in the doorway]3329-a white‐robed man who stood in the doorway with [his]1311-our high priest arms extended . “[1309-we] [Ji — jimmy]220-ji — jimmy , ” replied [Cyril]131-cyril , and [he]131-cyril hesitated as [Anthea]133-anthea had done . It really did seem to be taking a great liberty with [so learned a gentleman]3330-so learned a gentleman . “[220-ji — jimmy] And [we]1309-we have come to speak with [[your]1314-you Kings]1315-your kings in [the Temple of [Poseidon]221-poseidon]1316-the temple of poseidon — does that word sound right ? ” [he]131-cyril whispered anxiously . “[1315-your kings] Quite , ” said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “[1315-your kings] It ’s very odd [I]0-i can understand what [you]1314-you say to [them]1315-your kings , but not what [they]1315-your kings say to [you]1314-you . ” “[1315-your kings] [The Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon found that too , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “[2869-the queen of babylon] it ’s part of the magic . ” “[2869-the queen of babylon] Oh , what a dream ! ” said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . [The white‐robed priest]3333-the white‐robed priest had been joined by [others]2498-others , and all were bowing low . “[2869-the queen of babylon] Enter , ” [he]3333-the white‐robed priest said , “[2869-the queen of babylon] enter , [Children of the Sun]1318-children of the sun , with [your]1318-children of the sun High Ji — jimmy . ” In [an inner courtyard]3335-an inner courtyard stood [the Temple]3336-the temple — all of silver , with gold pinnacles and doors , and twenty enormous statues in bright gold of [men]2526-men and [women]2450-women . Also an immense pillar of the other precious yellow metal . [They]1279-the ten kings went through the doors , and [the priest]3339-the priest led [them]1279-the ten kings up a stair into [a gallery from which [they]1279-the ten kings could look down on to [the glorious place]3341-the glorious place]3340-a gallery from which they could look down on to the glorious place . “[1279-the ten kings] [The ten Kings]1279-the ten kings are even now choosing the bull . It is not lawful for [me]0-i to behold , ” said [the priest]3339-the priest , and fell face downward on the floor outside [the gallery]3343-the gallery . [The children]278-the children looked down . The roof was of ivory adorned with the three precious metals , and the walls were lined with the favourite oricalchum . At the far end of [the Temple]3336-the temple was a statue‐group , the like of which [no one living]3346-no one living has ever seen . It was of gold , and the head of [the chief figure]3347-the chief figure reached to the roof . [That figure]3348-that figure was [Poseidon]221-poseidon , [the Father of [the City]3240-the city]3349-the father of the city . [He]221-poseidon stood in [a great chariot drawn by six enormous horses]3351-a great chariot drawn by six enormous horses , and round about [it]3351-a great chariot drawn by six enormous horses were a hundred mermaids riding on dolphins . [Ten men , splendidly dressed and armed only with sticks and ropes]3352-ten men , splendidly dressed and armed only with sticks and ropes , were trying to capture [one of some fifteen bulls who ran this way and that about [the floor of [the Temple]3336-the temple]3354-the floor of the temple]3353-one of some fifteen bulls who ran this way and that about the floor of the temple . [The children]278-the children held [their]278-the children breath , for the bulls looked dangerous , and the great horned heads were swinging more and more wildly . [Anthea]133-anthea did not like looking at the bulls . [She]133-anthea looked about [the gallery]3343-the gallery , and noticed that another staircase led up from [it]3343-the gallery to [a still higher story]3358-a still higher story ; also that a door led out into the open air , where there seemed to be [a balcony]3359-a balcony . So that when a shout went up and [Robert]132-robert whispered , “[1320-him] Got [him]1320-him , ” and [she]133-anthea looked down and saw the herd of bulls being driven out of [the Temple]3336-the temple by whips , and [the ten Kings]1279-the ten kings following , one of [them]1279-the ten kings spurring with [his]132-robert stick a black bull that writhed and fought in the grip of a lasso , [she]133-anthea answered [the boy]2860-the boy ’s agitated , “[1320-him] Now [we]1321-we sha n’t see anything more , ” with — “[1321-we] Yes [we]1321-we can , there ’s [an outside balcony]1322-an outside balcony . ” So [they]1321-we crowded out . But very soon [the girls]311-the girls crept back . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t like sacrifices , ” [Jane]134-jane said . So [she]133-anthea and [Anthea]133-anthea went and talked to [the priest]3339-the priest , who was no longer lying on [his]3339-the priest face , but sitting on the top step mopping [his]3339-the priest forehead with [his]3339-the priest robe , for it was a hot day . “[0-i] It ’s a special sacrifice , ” [he]3339-the priest said ; “[0-i] usually it ’s only done on the justice days every five years and six years alternately . And then [they]1323-they drink the cup of wine with some of the bull ’s blood in it , and swear to judge truly . And [they]1323-they wear the sacred blue robe , and put out all the Temple fires . But this today is because [the City]3240-the city ’s so upset by the odd noises from [the sea]2414-the sea , and [the god inside [the big mountain]1327-the big mountain speaking with [his]1326-the god inside the big mountain speaking with his thunder‐voice thunder‐voice]1326-the god inside the big mountain speaking with his thunder‐voice . But all that ’s happened so often before . If anything could make [me]0-i uneasy it would n’t be that . ” “[1326-the god inside the big mountain speaking with his thunder‐voice] What would it be ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane kindly . “[224-the lemmings] It would be [the Lemmings]224-the lemmings . ” “[224-the lemmings] Who are [they]224-the lemmings — [enemies]1328-enemies ? ” “[224-the lemmings] [They]224-the lemmings ’re a sort of rat ; and every year [they]224-the lemmings come swimming over from [the country]290-the country that [no man]1330-no man knows , and stay [here]2247-here awhile , and then swim away . This year [they]224-the lemmings have n’t come . [You]1332-you know rats wo n’t stay on [a ship that ’s going to be wrecked]1333-a ship that ’s going to be wrecked . If anything horrible were going to happen to [us]1334-us , it ’s [my]0-i belief [those Lemmings]1335-those lemmings would know ; and that may be why [they]224-the lemmings ’ve fought shy of [us]1334-us . ” “[224-the lemmings] What do [you]0-i call [this country]1336-this country ? ” asked [the Psammead]400-the psammead , suddenly putting its head out of its bag . “[0-i] [Atlantis]69-atlantis , ” said [the priest]3339-the priest . “[0-i] Then [I]0-i advise [you]1332-you to get on to [the highest ground [you]1332-you can find]1337-the highest ground you can find . [I]0-i remember hearing something about a flood here . Look here , [you”—it]1332-you turned to [Anthea]133-anthea ; “[1339-the prospect] let ’s get [home]357-home . [The prospect]1339-the prospect ’s too wet for [my]0-i whiskers . ” [The girls]311-the girls obediently went to find [[their]311-the girls brothers]3368-their brothers , who were leaning on the balcony railings . “[1339-the prospect] Where ’s [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ? ” asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “[2353-the learned gentleman] There [he]2353-the learned gentleman is — below , ” said [the priest]3339-the priest , who had come with [them]311-the girls . “[2353-the learned gentleman] [Your]1332-you High Ji — [jimmy]219-jimmy is with [the Kings]225-the kings . ” [The ten Kings]1279-the ten kings were no longer alone . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman — [no one]344-no one had noticed how [he]2353-the learned gentleman got [there]321-there — stood with [them]311-the girls on the steps of an altar , on which lay the dead body of the black bull . [All the rest of [the courtyard]3101-the courtyard]3374-all the rest of the courtyard was thick with [people]280-people , seemingly of all classes , and [all]655-all were shouting , “[225-the kings] [The sea]2414-the sea — [the sea]2414-the sea ! ” “[225-the kings] Be calm , ” said [the most kingly of [the Kings]225-the kings]3378-the most kingly of the kings , [he]3378-the most kingly of the kings who had lassoed the bull . “[225-the kings] [Our town]728-our town is strong against the thunders of [the sea]2414-the sea and of the sky ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i want to go [home]357-home , ” whined [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “[0-i] [We]1346-they ca n’t go without [him]1347-him , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea firmly . “[219-jimmy] [Jimmy]219-jimmy , ” [she]133-anthea called , “[219-jimmy] [Jimmy]219-jimmy ! ” and waved to [him]219-jimmy . [He]219-jimmy heard [her]133-anthea , and began to come towards [her]133-anthea through [the crowd]2541-the crowd . [They]1346-they could see from the balcony the sea‐captain edging [his]219-jimmy way out from among [the people]2548-the people . And [his]219-jimmy face was dead white , like paper . “[219-jimmy] To [the hills]1348-the hills ! ” [he]219-jimmy cried in a loud and terrible voice . And above [his]219-jimmy voice came another voice , louder , more terrible — the voice of [the sea]2414-the sea . [The girls]311-the girls looked seaward . Across the smooth distance of [the sea]2414-the sea something huge and black rolled towards [the town]783-the town . It was a wave , but a wave a hundred feet in height , a wave that looked like [a mountain]3385-a mountain — a wave rising higher and higher till suddenly it seemed to break in two — one half of it rushed out to [sea]3386-sea again ; the other — “[219-jimmy] Oh ! ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea , “[219-jimmy] [the town]783-the town — [the poor people]1350-the poor people ! ” “[219-jimmy] It ’s all thousands of years ago , really , ” said [Robert]132-robert but [his]132-robert voice trembled . [They]1346-they hid [their]1346-they eyes for a moment . [They]1346-they could not bear to look down , for the wave had broken on [the face of [the town]783-the town]3387-the face of the town , sweeping over [the quays]3389-the quays and [docks]3390-docks , overwhelming [the great storehouses]3391-the great storehouses and [factories]3392-factories , tearing gigantic stones from [forts]3393-forts and [bridges]3394-bridges , and using [them]3391-the great storehouses as battering rams against [the temples]1285-the temples . [Great ships]3396-great ships were swept over the roofs of [the houses]828-the houses and dashed down half‐way up [the hill]3398-the hill among [ruined gardens]3399-ruined gardens and [broken buildings]3400-broken buildings . [The water]2469-the water ground brown fishing‐boats to powder on [the golden roofs of [Palaces]3403-palaces]3402-the golden roofs of palaces . Then the wave swept back towards [the sea]2414-the sea . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to go [home]357-home , ” cried [the Psammead]136-the psammead fiercely . “[0-i] Oh , yes , yes ! ” said [Jane]134-jane , and [the boys]313-the boys were ready — but [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman had not come . Then suddenly [they]313-the boys heard [him]2353-the learned gentleman dash up to [the inner gallery]3407-the inner gallery , crying — “[0-i] [I]0-i must see the end of the dream . ” [He]2353-the learned gentleman rushed up [the higher flight]3408-the higher flight . [The others]325-the others followed [him]2353-the learned gentleman . [They]313-the boys found [themselves]313-the boys in a sort of turret — roofed , but open to the air at the sides . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman was leaning on the parapet , and as [they]313-the boys rejoined [him]2353-the learned gentleman the vast wave rushed back on [the town]783-the town . This time it rose higher — destroyed more . “[0-i] Come [home]357-home , ” cried [the Psammead]136-the psammead ; “[219-jimmy] that ’s the last , [I]0-i know it is ! That ’s the last — over there . ” It pointed with a claw that trembled . “[219-jimmy] Oh , come ! ” cried [Jane]134-jane , holding up the Amulet . “[219-jimmy] [I]0-i will see the end of the dream , ” cried [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “[0-i] [You]1353-you ’ll never see anything else if [you]1353-you do , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1353-you] Oh , [Jimmy]219-jimmy ! ” appealed [Anthea]133-anthea . “[219-jimmy] [I]0-i ’ll never bring [you]219-jimmy out again ! ” “[0-i] [You]1353-you ’ll never have the chance if [you]1353-you do n’t go soon , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “[0-i] [I]0-i will see the end of the dream , ” said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman obstinately . [The hills around]3414-the hills around were black with [people]280-people fleeing from [the villages]3416-the villages to [the mountains]2624-the mountains . And even as [they]280-people fled thin smoke broke from [the great white peak]3418-the great white peak , and then a faint flash of flame . Then [the volcano]3419-the volcano began to throw up its mysterious fiery inside parts . [The earth]3420-the earth trembled ; ashes and sulphur showered down ; a rain of fine pumice‐stone fell like snow on [all the dry land]3421-all the dry land . [The elephants from [the forest]3423-the forest]3422-the elephants from the forest rushed up towards [the peaks]3424-the peaks ; great lizards thirty yards long broke from [the mountain pools]3425-the mountain pools and rushed down towards [the sea]2414-the sea . The snows melted and rushed down , first in avalanches , then in roaring torrents . Great rocks cast up by [the volcano]3419-the volcano fell splashing in [the sea miles away]3428-the sea miles away . “[0-i] Oh , this is horrible ! ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] Come [home]357-home , come [home]357-home ! ” “[0-i] The end of the dream , ” gasped [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “[0-i] Hold up the Amulet , ” cried [the Psammead]136-the psammead suddenly . The place where [they]280-people stood was now crowded with [men]2526-men and [women]2450-women , and [the children]278-the children were strained tight against the parapet . [The turret]3433-the turret rocked and swayed ; the wave had reached the golden wall . [Jane]134-jane held up the Amulet . “[0-i] Now , ” cried [the Psammead]136-the psammead , “[0-i] say the word ! ” And as [Jane]134-jane said it [the Psammead]136-the psammead leaped from its bag and bit the hand of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . At the same moment [the boys]313-the boys pushed [him]2353-the learned gentleman through the arch and all followed [him]2353-the learned gentleman . [He]2353-the learned gentleman turned to look back , and through [the arch]3436-the arch [he]2353-the learned gentleman saw nothing but [a waste of waters]3437-a waste of waters , with above it [the peak of [the terrible mountain]3439-the terrible mountain with fire raging from [it]3438-the peak of the terrible mountain with fire raging from it]3438-the peak of the terrible mountain with fire raging from it . [He]2353-the learned gentleman staggered back to [his]2353-the learned gentleman chair . “[0-i] What a ghastly dream ! ” [he]2353-the learned gentleman gasped . “[0-i] Oh , [you]1356-you ’re here , [[my]0-i — er — dears]1357-my — er — dears . Can [I]0-i do anything for [you]1356-you ? ” “[0-i] [You]1356-you ’ve hurt [your]1356-you hand , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea gently ; “[1356-you] let [me]0-i bind it up . ” The hand was indeed bleeding rather badly . [The Psammead]136-the psammead had crept back to its bag . [All the children]3440-all the children were very white . “[0-i] Never again , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead later on , “[0-i] will [I]0-i go into [the Past]1358-the past with [a grown‐up person]1359-a grown‐up person ! [I]0-i will say for [you]1356-you four , [you]1356-you do do as [you]1356-you ’re told . ” “[0-i] [We]1360-we did n’t even find the Amulet , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea later still . “[1360-we] Of course [you]1356-you did n’t ; it was n’t [there]321-there . Only the stone it was made of was there . It fell on to [a ship miles away that managed to escape and got to [Egypt]21-egypt]1362-a ship miles away that managed to escape and got to egypt . [I]0-i could have told [you]1356-you that . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]1356-you had , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , and [her]133-anthea voice was still rather shaky . “[0-i] Why did n’t [you]1356-you ? ” “[1356-you] [You]1356-you never asked [me]0-i , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead very sulkily . “[1356-you] [I]0-i ’m not the sort of chap to go shoving [my]0-i oar in where it ’s not wanted . ” “[0-i] [Mr Ji‐jimmy ’s friend]1363-mr ji‐jimmy ’s friend will have something worth having to put in [his]1363-mr ji‐jimmy ’s friend article now , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril very much later indeed . “[1363-mr ji‐jimmy ’s friend] Not [he]1363-mr ji‐jimmy ’s friend , ” said [Robert]132-robert sleepily . “[1363-mr ji‐jimmy ’s friend] [the learned Ji‐jimmy]226-the learned ji‐jimmy will think it ’s a dream , and it ’s ten to one [he]226-the learned ji‐jimmy never tells [the other chap]1364-the other chap a word about it at all . ” [Robert]132-robert was quite right on both points . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman did . And [he]2353-the learned gentleman never did . [A GREAT City]3237-a great city swept away by [the sea]2414-the sea , [a beautiful country devastated by an active volcano]3444-a beautiful country devastated by an active volcano — these are not the sort of things [you]3445-you see every day of the week . And when [you]3445-you do see them , no matter how many other wonders [you]3445-you may have seen in [your]3445-you time , such sights are rather apt to take [your]3445-you breath away . [Atlantis]69-atlantis had certainly this effect on the breaths of [Cyril]131-cyril , [Robert]132-robert , [Anthea]133-anthea , and [Jane]134-jane . [They]3446-they remained in a breathless state for some days . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman seemed as breathless as [anyone]283-anyone ; [he]2353-the learned gentleman spent a good deal of what little breath [he]2353-the learned gentleman had in telling [Anthea]133-anthea about a wonderful dream [he]2353-the learned gentleman had . “[226-the learned ji‐jimmy] [You]1365-you would hardly believe , ” [he]2353-the learned gentleman said , “[1365-you] that [anyone]283-anyone could have such a detailed vision . ” But [Anthea]133-anthea could believe it , [she]133-anthea said , quite easily . [He]2353-the learned gentleman had ceased to talk about thought‐transference . [He]2353-the learned gentleman had now seen too many wonders to believe that . In consequence of [their]3446-they breathless condition [none of [the children]278-the children]3449-none of the children suggested any new excursions through [the Amulet]166-the amulet . [Robert]132-robert voiced the mood of [the others]325-the others when [he]132-robert said that [they]325-the others were “[226-the learned ji‐jimmy] fed up ” with Amulet for a bit . [They]325-the others undoubtedly were . As for [the Psammead]136-the psammead , it went to sand and stayed there , worn out by the terror of the flood and the violent exercise it had had to take in obedience to the inconsiderate wishes of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman and [the Babylonian queen]3041-the babylonian queen . [The children]278-the children let [it]136-the psammead sleep . The danger of taking it about among [strange people who might at any moment utter undesirable wishes]3455-strange people who might at any moment utter undesirable wishes was becoming more and more plain . And there are pleasant things to be done in [London]2-london without any aid from Amulets or [Psammeads]228-psammeads . [You]3456-you can , for instance visit [the Tower of [London]2-london]79-the tower of london , [the Houses of Parliament]1158-the houses of parliament , [the National Gallery]3458-the national gallery , [the Zoological Gardens]3459-the zoological gardens , [the various Parks]3460-the various parks , [the Museums at [South Kensington]80-south kensington]3461-the museums at south kensington , [[Madame Tussaud]229-madame tussaud ’s Exhibition of Waxworks]81-madame tussaud ’s exhibition of waxworks , or [the Botanical Gardens at [Kew]82-kew]3462-the botanical gardens at kew . [You]3456-you can go to [Kew]82-kew by [a river steamer]3463-a river steamer — and this is the way that [the children]278-the children would have gone if [they]278-the children had gone at all . Only [they]278-the children never did , because it was when [they]278-the children were discussing the arrangements for the journey , and what [they]278-the children should take with [them]278-the children to eat and how much of it , and what the whole thing would cost , that the adventure of [the Little Black Girl]3465-the little black girl began to happen . [The children]278-the children were sitting on a seat in [St. James ’s Park]83-st. james ’s park . [They]278-the children had been watching the pelican repulsing with careful dignity the advances of the seagulls who are always so anxious to play games with it . [The pelican]3467-the pelican thinks , very properly , that it has n’t the figure for games , so [it]3467-the pelican spends most of its time pretending that that is not the reason why it wo n’t play . The breathlessness caused by [Atlantis]69-atlantis was wearing off a little . [Cyril]131-cyril , who always wanted to understand all about everything , was turning things over in [his]131-cyril mind . “[226-the learned ji‐jimmy] [I]0-i ’m not ; [I]0-i ’m only thinking , ” [he]0-i answered when [Robert]132-robert asked [him]0-i what [he]0-i was so grumpy about . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]1367-you when [I]0-i ’ve thought it all out . ” “[0-i] If it ’s about the Amulet [I]0-i do n’t want to hear it , ” said [Jane]134-jane . “[0-i] [Nobody]2255-nobody asked [you]1367-you to , ” retorted [Cyril]131-cyril mildly , “[2255-nobody] and [I]0-i have n’t finished [my]0-i inside thinking about it yet . Let ’s go to [Kew]82-kew in the meantime . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’d rather go in [a steamer]1369-a steamer , ” said [Robert]132-robert ; and [the girls]311-the girls laughed . “[0-i] That ’s right , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[0-i] be funny . [I]0-i would . ” “[1370-he] Well , [he]1370-he was , rather , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[1370-he] [I]0-i would n’t think , [Squirrel]215-squirrel , if it hurts [you]215-squirrel so , ” said [Robert]132-robert kindly . “[215-squirrel] Oh , shut up , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[1370-he] or else talk about [Kew]82-kew . ” “[82-kew] [I]0-i want to see the palms there , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea hastily , “[82-kew] to see if [they]1371-they ’re anything like the ones on [the island]1372-the island where [we]1373-we united [the Cook]1374-the cook and [the Burglar]1375-the burglar by [the Reverend Half‐Curate]1376-the reverend half‐curate . ” All disagreeableness was swept away in a pleasant tide of recollections , and ’ Do [you]131-cyril remember ... ? ”[1373-we] [they]1373-we said . “ Have [you]131-cyril forgotten ... ? ”[1373-we] “ [My]131-cyril hat ! ”[131-cyril] remarked [Cyril]131-cyril pensively , as the flood of reminiscence ebbed a little ; “ [we]1373-we have had some times . ”[131-cyril] “ [We]1373-we have that , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ Do n’t let ’s have any more , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane anxiously . “ That ’s what [I]131-cyril was thinking about , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril replied ; and just then [they]1373-we heard [the Little Black Girl]3465-the little black girl sniff . [She]3465-the little black girl was quite close to [them]1373-we . [She]3465-the little black girl was not really [a little black girl]1378-a little black girl . [She]3465-the little black girl was shabby and not very clean , and [she]3465-the little black girl had been crying so much that [you]1379-you could hardly see , through the narrow chink between [her]3465-the little black girl swollen lids , how very blue [her]3465-the little black girl eyes were . It was [her]3465-the little black girl dress that was black , and it was too big and too long for [her]3465-the little black girl , and [she]3465-the little black girl wore a speckled black‐ribboned sailor hat that would have fitted a much bigger head than [her]3465-the little black girl little flaxen one . And [she]3465-the little black girl stood looking at [the children]278-the children and sniffing . “ Oh , [dear]1252-dear ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , jumping up . “ Whatever is the matter ? ”[133-anthea] [She]133-anthea put [her]133-anthea hand on [the little girl]1381-the little girl ’s arm . It was rudely shaken off . “ [You]1381-the little girl leave [me]1381-the little girl be , ”[1381-the little girl] said [the little girl]1381-the little girl . “ [I]1381-the little girl ai n’t doing nothing to [you]1381-the little girl . ”[1381-the little girl] “ But what is it ? ”[133-anthea] [Anthea]133-anthea asked . “ Has [some one]376-some one been hurting [you]1381-the little girl ? ”[133-anthea] “ What ’s that to [you]1381-the little girl ? ”[1381-the little girl] said [the little girl]1381-the little girl fiercely . “ [You]1381-the little girl ’re all right . ”[1381-the little girl] “ Come away , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , pulling at [Anthea]133-anthea ’s sleeve . “ [She]1381-the little girl ’s [a nasty , rude little kid]3471-a nasty , rude little kid . ”[132-robert] “ Oh , no , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [She]1381-the little girl ’s only dreadfully unhappy . What is it ? ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea asked again . “ Oh , [you]1381-the little girl ’re all right , ”[1384-the child] [the child]1384-the child repeated ; “ [you]1381-the little girl ai n’t agoin ’ to [the Union]3472-the union . ”[1384-the child] “ Ca n’t [we]3473-we take [you]1381-the little girl [home]357-home ? ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea ; and [Jane]134-jane added , “ Where does [[your]1381-the little girl mother]2415-your mother live ? ”[134-jane] “ [She]2415-your mother do n’t live nowheres — [she]2415-your mother ’s dead — so now ! ”[1381-the little girl] said [the little girl]1381-the little girl fiercely , in tones of miserable triumph . Then [she]1381-the little girl opened [her]1381-the little girl swollen eyes widely , stamped [her]1381-the little girl foot in fury , and ran away . [She]1381-the little girl ran no further than to the next bench , flung [herself]1381-the little girl down there and began to cry without even trying not to . [Anthea]133-anthea , quite at once , went to [the little girl]1381-the little girl and put [her]133-anthea arms as tight as [she]133-anthea could round [the hunched‐up black figure]1387-the hunched‐up black figure . “ Oh , do n’t cry so , [dear]1252-dear , do n’t , do n’t ! ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea whispered under the brim of the large sailor hat , now very crooked indeed . “ Tell [Anthea]133-anthea all about it ; [Anthea’ll]231-anthea’ll help [you]133-anthea . There , there , [dear]1252-dear , do n’t cry . ”[133-anthea] [The others]325-the others stood at a distance . [One or two passers‐by]1389-one or two passers‐by stared curiously . [The child]1384-the child was now only crying part of the time ; the rest of the time [she]1384-the child seemed to be talking to [Anthea]133-anthea . [Presently Anthea]133-anthea beckoned [Cyril]131-cyril . “ It ’s horrible ! ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said in a furious whisper , “ [[her]1384-the child father]3478-her father was [a carpenter]3479-a carpenter and [he]3478-her father was [a steady man]3480-a steady man , and never touched a drop except on a Saturday , and [he]3478-her father came up to [London]2-london for work , and there was n’t any , and then [he]3478-her father died ; and [her]1384-the child name is [Imogen]232-imogen , and [she]1384-the child ’s nine come next [November]194-november . And now [[her]1384-the child mother]3481-her mother ’s dead , and [she]1384-the child ’s to stay tonight with [Mrs Shrobsall]233-mrs shrobsall — that ’s [a landlady that ’s been kind]3482-a landlady that ’s been kind — and tomorrow [the Relieving Officer]3483-the relieving officer is coming for [her]1384-the child , and [she]1384-the child ’s going into [the Union]3472-the union ; that means [the Workhouse]3485-the workhouse . It ’s too terrible . What can [we]2268-the whole party do ? ”[133-anthea] “ Let ’s ask [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane brightly . And as [no one else]3270-no one else could think of anything better [the whole party]2268-the whole party walked back to [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street as fast as it could , [the little girl]1381-the little girl holding tight to [Anthea]133-anthea ’s hand and now not crying any more , only sniffing gently . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman looked up from [his]2353-the learned gentleman writing with the smile that had grown much easier to [him]2353-the learned gentleman than it used to be . [They]1395-them were quite at [home]357-home in [[his]2353-the learned gentleman room]514-his room now ; it really seemed to welcome [them]1395-them . [Even the mummy‐case]1398-even the mummy‐case appeared to smile as if in its distant superior ancient Egyptian way it were rather pleased to see [them]1395-them than not . [Anthea]133-anthea sat on the stairs with [Imogen]232-imogen , who was [nine come next November]1399-nine come next november , while [the others]325-the others went in and explained the difficulty . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman listened with grave attention . “ It really does seem rather rough luck , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril concluded , “ because [I]131-cyril ’ve often heard about [rich people]3487-rich people who wanted [children]437-children most awfully — though [I]131-cyril know [I]131-cyril never should — but [they]3487-rich people do . There must be somebody who ’d be glad to have [her]133-anthea . ”[131-cyril] “ [Gipsies]3489-gipsies are awfully fond of [children]437-children , ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert hopefully said . “ [They]3489-gipsies ’re always stealing [them]437-children . Perhaps [they]3489-gipsies ’d have [her]133-anthea . ”[132-robert] “ [She]133-anthea ’s quite [a nice little girl]3491-a nice little girl really , ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane added ; “ [she]133-anthea was only rude at first because [we]3492-we looked jolly and happy , and [she]133-anthea was n’t . [You]132-robert understand that , do n’t [you]132-robert ? ”[134-jane] “ Yes , ”[132-robert] said [he]132-robert , absently fingering a little blue image from [Egypt]21-egypt . “ [I]132-robert understand that very well . As [you]134-jane say , there must be [some home where [she]133-anthea would be welcome]3493-some home where she would be welcome . ”[132-robert] [He]132-robert scowled thoughtfully at the little blue image . [Anthea]133-anthea outside thought the explanation was taking a very long time . [She]133-anthea was so busy trying to cheer and comfort [the little black girl]3465-the little black girl that [she]133-anthea never noticed the Psammead who , roused from sleep by [her]3465-the little black girl voice , had shaken itself free of sand , and was coming crookedly up [the stairs]847-the stairs . It was close to [her]133-anthea before [she]133-anthea saw it . [She]133-anthea picked it up and settled it in [her]133-anthea lap . “ What is it ? ”[1404-the black child] asked [the black child]1404-the black child . “ Is it a cat or a organ‐monkey , or what ? ”[1404-the black child] And then [Anthea]133-anthea heard [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman say — “ Yes , [I]2353-the learned gentleman wish [we]3494-we could find [a home where [they]3496-they would be glad to have [her]232-imogen]3495-a home where they would be glad to have her , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] and instantly [she]133-anthea felt [the Psammead]136-the psammead begin to blow itself out as it sat on [her]133-anthea lap . [She]133-anthea jumped up lifting [the Psammead]136-the psammead in [her]133-anthea skirt , and holding [Imogen]232-imogen by the hand , rushed into [[the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s room]737-the learned gentleman ’s room . “ At least let [’s]3497-’s keep together , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea cried . “ [All]655-all hold hands — quick ! ”[133-anthea] The circle was like that formed for the Mulberry Bush or [Ring o ’ Roses]1408-ring o ’ roses . And [Anthea]133-anthea was only able to take part in it by holding in [her]133-anthea teeth the hem of [her]133-anthea frock which , thus supported , formed a bag to hold the Psammead . “ Is it a game ? ”[2353-the learned gentleman] asked [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman feebly . [No one]344-no one answered . There was a moment of suspense ; then came that curious upside‐down , inside‐out sensation which [one]346-one almost always feels when transported from one place to another by magic . Also there was that dizzy dimness of sight which comes on these occasions . The mist cleared , the upside‐down , inside‐out sensation subsided , and there stood [the six in a ring]1412-the six in a ring , as before , only [their]1412-the six in a ring twelve feet , instead of standing on the carpet of [[the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s room]737-the learned gentleman ’s room , stood on green grass . Above [them]1412-the six in a ring , instead of the dusky ceiling of [the Fitzroy Street floor]1415-the fitzroy street floor , was a pale blue sky . And where the walls had been and the painted mummy‐case , were tall dark green trees , oaks and ashes , and in between the trees and under them tangled bushes and creeping ivy . There were beech‐trees too , but there was nothing under [them]1416-them but [their]1416-them own dead red drifted leaves , and here and there a delicate green fern‐frond . And there [they]1412-the six in a ring stood in a circle still holding hands , as though [they]1412-the six in a ring were playing Ring o ’ Roses or the Mulberry Bush . Just [six people]1417-six people hand in hand in a wood . That sounds simple , but then [you]1418-you must remember that [they]1412-the six in a ring did not know where the wood was , and what ’s more , [they]1412-the six in a ring did n’t know when then wood was . There was a curious sort of feeling that made [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman say — “ Another dream , dear [me]2353-the learned gentleman ! ”[2353-the learned gentleman] and made [the children]278-the children almost certain that [they]278-the children were in a time a very long while ago . As for [little Imogen]232-imogen , [she]232-imogen said , “ Oh , [my]232-imogen ! ”[232-imogen] and kept [her]232-imogen mouth very much open indeed . “ Where are [we]278-the children ? ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril asked [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ In [Britain]84-britain , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ But when ? ”[133-anthea] asked [Anthea]133-anthea anxiously . “ About the year fifty‐five before the year [you]133-anthea reckon time from , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead crossly . “ Is there anything else [you]133-anthea want to know ? ”[136-the psammead] [it]136-the psammead added , sticking its head out of the bag formed by [Anthea]133-anthea ’s blue linen frock , and turning its snail ’s eyes to right and left . “ [I]136-the psammead ’ve been [here]2247-here before — it ’s very little changed . ”[136-the psammead] “ Yes , but why here ? ”[133-anthea] asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [[Your]133-anthea inconsiderate friend]3500-your inconsiderate friend , ”[400-the psammead] [the Psammead]400-the psammead replied , “ wished to find some home where [they]3500-your inconsiderate friend would be glad to have [that unattractive and immature female human being whom [you]133-anthea have picked up]3501-that unattractive and immature female human being whom you have picked up — gracious knows how . In Megatherium days properly brought‐up [children]437-children did n’t talk to [shabby strangers]3503-shabby strangers in [parks]3504-parks . [[Your]133-anthea thoughtless friend]3505-your thoughtless friend wanted [a place where [some one]376-some one would be glad to have [this undesirable stranger]3508-this undesirable stranger]3506-a place where some one would be glad to have this undesirable stranger . And now here [you]133-anthea are ! ”[400-the psammead] “ [I]133-anthea see [we]3509-we are , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea patiently , looking round on the tall gloom of [the forest]3423-the forest . “ But why here ? Why now ? ”[133-anthea] “ [You]133-anthea do n’t suppose [anyone]283-anyone would want [a child like that]3511-a child like that in [your]133-anthea times — in [[your]133-anthea towns]3512-your towns ? ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead in irritated tones . “ [You]133-anthea ’ve got [[your]133-anthea country]1047-your country into such a mess that there ’s no room for half [[your]133-anthea children]3514-your children — and [no one]344-no one to want [them]3514-your children . ”[136-the psammead] “ That ’s not [our]3516-our doing , [you]133-anthea know , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea gently . “ And bringing [me]136-the psammead [here]2247-here without any waterproof or anything , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead still more crossly , “ when [every one]2347-every one knows how damp and foggy Ancient [Britain]84-britain was . ”[136-the psammead] “ Here , take [my]132-robert coat , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , taking it off . [Anthea]133-anthea spread the coat on the ground and , putting the Psammead on it , folded it round so that only the eyes and furry ears showed . “ There , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said comfortingly . “ Now if it does begin to look like rain , [I]133-anthea can cover [you]133-anthea up in a minute . Now what are [we]3519-we to do ? ”[133-anthea] [The others who had stopped holding hands]1423-the others who had stopped holding hands crowded round to hear the answer to this question . [Imogen]232-imogen whispered in an awed tone — “ Ca n’t the organ monkey talk neither ! [I]232-imogen thought it was only parrots ! ”[232-imogen] “ Do ? ”[136-the psammead] replied [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ [I]136-the psammead do n’t care what [you]133-anthea do ! ”[136-the psammead] And it drew head and ears into the tweed covering of [Robert]132-robert ’s coat . [The others]325-the others looked at [each other]312-each other . “ It ’s only a dream , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman hopefully ; “ something is sure to happen if [we]3519-we can prevent [ourselves]3519-we from waking up . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] And sure enough , something did . The brooding silence of [the dark forest]1427-the dark forest was broken by the laughter of [children]437-children and the sound of voices . “ Let ’s go and see , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ It ’s only a dream , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman to [Jane]134-jane , who hung back ; “ if [you]134-jane do n’t go with the tide of a dream — if [you]134-jane resist — [you]134-jane wake up , [you]134-jane know . ”[134-jane] There was a sort of break in the undergrowth that was like [a silly person]1430-a silly person ’s idea of [a path]1431-a path . [They]1432-they went along this in Indian file , [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman leading . Quite soon [they]1432-they came to [a large clearing in [the forest]3423-the forest]1434-a large clearing in the forest . There were [a number of houses]1436-a number of houses — huts perhaps [you]1437-you would have called [them]1436-a number of houses — with a sort of mud and wood fence . “ It ’s like [the old Egyptian town]3520-the old egyptian town , ”[133-anthea] whispered [Anthea]133-anthea . And it was , rather . [Some children , with no clothes on at all]1438-some children , with no clothes on at all , were playing what looked like [Ring o ’ Roses]1408-ring o ’ roses or [Mulberry Bush]85-mulberry bush . That is to say , [they]1438-some children , with no clothes on at all were dancing round in a ring , holding hands . On [a grassy bank]1440-a grassy bank [several women , dressed in blue and white robes and tunics of beast‐skins]1441-several women , dressed in blue and white robes and tunics of beast‐skins sat watching [the playing children]1442-the playing children . [The children from [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street]1443-the children from fitzroy street stood on the fringe of [the forest]3423-the forest looking at the games . [One woman with long , fair braided hair]1445-one woman with long , fair braided hair sat a little apart from [the others]325-the others , and there was a look in [her]1445-one woman with long , fair braided hair eyes as [she]1445-one woman with long , fair braided hair followed the play of [the children]278-the children that made [Anthea]133-anthea feel sad and sorry . “ [None of those little girls]3521-none of those little girls is [[her]1448-the little black‐clad london child own little girl]3522-her own little girl , ”[133-anthea] thought [Anthea]133-anthea . [The little black‐clad London child]1448-the little black‐clad london child pulled at [Anthea]133-anthea ’s sleeve . “ Look , ”[1448-the little black‐clad london child] [she]1448-the little black‐clad london child said , “ [that one there]3523-that one there — [she]3523-that one there ’s precious like [mother]297-mother ; [mother]297-mother ’s ’ air was somethink lovely , when [she]3523-that one there ’ ad time to comb it out . [Mother]138-mother would n’t never a‐beat [me]1448-the little black‐clad london child if [she]3523-that one there ’d lived ’ ere — [I]1448-the little black‐clad london child do n’t suppose there ’s e’er [a public nearer than [Epping]86-epping]3526-a public nearer than epping , do [you]1384-the child , [Miss]3527-miss ? ”[1448-the little black‐clad london child] In [her]1448-the little black‐clad london child eagerness [the child]1384-the child had stepped out of the shelter of [the forest]3423-the forest . [The sad‐eyed woman]1451-the sad‐eyed woman saw [her]1384-the child . [She]1451-the sad‐eyed woman stood up , [her]1451-the sad‐eyed woman thin face lighted up with a radiance like sunrise , [her]1451-the sad‐eyed woman long , lean arms stretched towards [the London child]1452-the london child . “ [Imogen]232-imogen ! ”[1451-the sad‐eyed woman] [she]1451-the sad‐eyed woman cried — at least the word was more like that than any other word—“Imogen ! ”[1451-the sad‐eyed woman] There was a moment of great silence ; [the naked children]1453-the naked children paused in [their]1453-the naked children play , [the women on the bank]1454-the women on the bank stared anxiously . “ Oh , it is [mother]297-mother — it is ! ”[234-imogen‐from‐london] cried [Imogen‐from‐London]234-imogen‐from‐london , and rushed across [the cleared space]1455-the cleared space . [She]234-imogen‐from‐london and [[her]234-imogen‐from‐london mother]3481-her mother clung together — so closely , so strongly that [they]1457-they stood an instant like a statue carved in stone . Then [the women]2547-the women crowded round . “ It is [[my]613-the woman [Imogen]232-imogen]3529-my imogen ! ”[613-the woman] cried [the woman]613-the woman . “ Oh it is ! And [she]232-imogen was n’t eaten by wolves . [She]232-imogen ’s come back to [me]613-the woman . Tell [me]613-the woman , [[my]613-the woman darling]3530-my darling , how did [you]3530-my darling escape ? Where have [you]3530-my darling been ?
