And [Imogen]232-imogen , clinging with black‐clothed arms to the bare neck , answered — “ Oh , yes , [mother]297-mother , [I]232-imogen know [you]297-mother right ’ nough . ”[232-imogen] “ What is it ? What do [they]3533-they say ? ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman asked anxiously . “ [You]3530-my darling wished to come where [some one]376-some one wanted [the child]1384-the child , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ [The child]1384-the child says this is [[her]1384-the child mother]3481-her mother . ”[136-the psammead] “ And [the mother]3538-the mother ? ”[232-imogen] “ [You]3530-my darling can see , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ But is [she]3538-the mother really ? [[Her]3538-the mother child]3539-her child , [I]136-the psammead mean ? ”[136-the psammead] “ Who knows ? ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead ; “ but [each one]3540-each one fills the empty place in the other ’s heart . It is enough . ”[136-the psammead] “ Oh , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , “ this is a good dream . [I]2353-the learned gentleman wish [the child]1384-the child might stay in the dream . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] [The Psammead]136-the psammead blew [itself]136-the psammead out and granted the wish . So [Imogen]232-imogen ’s future was assured . [She]232-imogen had found [some one]376-some one to want [her]232-imogen . “ If only all [the children]278-the children that [no one]344-no one wants , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] began [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman — but [the woman]613-the woman interrupted . [She]613-the woman came towards [them]1467-them . “ Welcome , all ! ”[613-the woman] [she]613-the woman cried . “ [I]613-the woman am [the Queen]382-the queen , and [[my]613-the woman child]3545-my child tells [me]613-the woman that [you]613-the woman have befriended [her]3545-my child ; and this [I]613-the woman well believe , looking on [your]613-the woman faces . [Your]613-the woman garb is strange , but faces [I]613-the woman can read . [The child]1384-the child is bewitched , [I]613-the woman see that well , but in this [she]1384-the child speaks truth . Is it not so ? ”[613-the woman] [The children]278-the children said it was n’t worth mentioning . [I]0-i wish [you]1469-you could have seen all the honours and kindnesses lavished on [the children]278-the children and [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman by [those ancient Britons]1472-those ancient britons . [You]1469-you would have thought , to see [them]278-the children , that [a child]1473-a child was something to make a fuss about , not a bit of rubbish to be hustled about [the streets]3286-the streets and hidden away in [the workhouse]3485-the workhouse . It was n’t as grand as the entertainment at [Babylon]40-babylon , but somehow it was more satisfying . “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman think [[you]278-the children [children]437-children]3547-you children have some wonderful influence on [me]2353-the learned gentleman , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman never dreamed such dreams before [I]2353-the learned gentleman knew [you]278-the children . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] It was when [they]1477-we were alone that night under the stars where [the Britons]235-the britons had spread a heap of dried fern for [them]1477-we to sleep on , that [Cyril]131-cyril spoke . “ Well , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said , “ [we]1477-we ’ve made it all right for [Imogen]232-imogen , and had a jolly good time . [I]131-cyril vote [we]1477-we get [home]357-home again before the fighting begins . ”[131-cyril] “ What fighting ? ”[134-jane] asked [Jane]134-jane sleepily . “ Why , [Julius Cæsar]236-cæsar , [you]278-the children little goat , ”[1478-her kind brother] replied [[her]134-jane kind brother]1478-her kind brother . “ Do n’t [you]278-the children see that if this is the year fifty‐five , [Julius Cæsar]236-cæsar may happen at any moment . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]132-robert thought [you]132-robert liked [Cæsar]236-cæsar , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ So [I]132-robert do — in the history . But that ’s different from being killed by [[his]236-cæsar soldiers]3550-his soldiers . ”[132-robert] “ If [we]3551-we saw [Cæsar]236-cæsar [we]3551-we might persuade [him]236-cæsar not to , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [You]132-robert persuade [Cæsar]236-cæsar , ”[133-anthea] [Robert]132-robert laughed . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , before [anyone]283-anyone could stop [him]132-robert , said , “ [I]2353-the learned gentleman only wish [we]3551-we could see [Cæsar]236-cæsar some time . ”[2353-the learned gentleman] And , of course , in just the little time [the Psammead]400-the psammead took to blow itself out for wish‐giving , the five , or six counting [the Psammead]400-the psammead , found [themselves]1483-they in [[Cæsar]236-cæsar ’s camp]1484-cæsar ’s camp , just outside [[Cæsar]236-cæsar ’s tent]1485-cæsar ’s tent . And [they]1483-they saw [Cæsar]236-cæsar . [The Psammead]136-the psammead must have taken advantage of the loose wording of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman ’s wish , for it was not the same time of day as that on which the wish had been uttered among the dried ferns . It was sunset , and [the great man]1487-the great man sat on a chair outside [[his]1487-the great man tent]1488-his tent gazing over [the sea]2414-the sea towards [Britain]84-britain — [every one]2347-every one knew without being told that it was towards [Britain]84-britain . Two golden eagles on the top of posts stood on each side of [the tent]1491-the tent , and on the flaps of [the tent]1491-the tent which was very gorgeous to look at were the letters S.P.Q.R. [The great man]1487-the great man turned unchanged on [the newcomers]1494-the newcomers the august glance that [he]1487-the great man had turned on [the violet waters of [the Channel]3-channel]1495-the violet waters of the channel . Though [they]1483-they had suddenly appeared out of nothing , [Cæsar]236-cæsar never showed by the faintest movement of an eyelid , by the least tightening of that firm mouth , that [they]1483-they were not some long expected embassy . [He]236-cæsar waved a calm hand towards [the sentinels]1496-the sentinels , who sprang weapons in hand towards [the newcomers]1494-the newcomers . “ Back ! ”[236-cæsar] [he]236-cæsar said in a voice that thrilled like music . “ Since when has [Cæsar]236-cæsar feared [children]437-children and [students]3553-students ? ”[236-cæsar] To [the children]278-the children [he]236-cæsar seemed to speak in the only language [they]278-the children knew ; but [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman heard — in rather a strange accent , but quite intelligibly — the lips of [Cæsar]236-cæsar speaking in the Latin tongue , and in that tongue , a little stiffly , [he]236-cæsar answered — “ It is a dream , [O Cæsar]236-cæsar . ”[236-cæsar] “ A dream ? ”[236-cæsar] repeated [Cæsar]236-cæsar . “ What is a dream ? ”[236-cæsar] “ This , ”[2353-the learned gentleman] said [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman . “ Not it , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ it ’s a sort of magic . [We]3554-we come out of another time and [another place]3555-another place . ”[131-cyril] “ And [we]3554-we want to ask [you]236-cæsar not to trouble about conquering [Britain]84-britain , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea ; “ it ’s [a poor little place]3556-a poor little place , not worth bothering about . ”[133-anthea] “ Are [you]236-cæsar from [Britain]84-britain ? ”[131-cyril] [the General]2343-the general asked . “ [Your]236-cæsar clothes are uncouth , but well woven , and [your]236-cæsar hair is short as the hair of [Roman citizens]3557-roman citizens , not long like the hair of [barbarians]3558-barbarians , yet such [I]2343-the general deem [you]236-cæsar to be . ”[2343-the general] “ [We]3554-we ’re not , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane with angry eagerness ; “ [we]3554-we ’re not [barbarians]3558-barbarians at all . [We]3554-we come from [the country where the sun never sets]3560-the country where the sun never sets , and [we]3554-we ’ve read about [you]236-cæsar in books ; and [[our]3554-we country]939-our country ’s full of fine things — [St Paul ’s]88-st paul ’s , and [the Tower of [London]2-london]3562-the tower of london , and [[Madame Tussaud]229-madame tussaud ’s Exhibition]89-madame tussaud ’s exhibition , and — ”[134-jane] Then [the others]325-the others stopped [her]134-jane . “ Do n’t talk nonsense , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert in a bitter undertone . [Cæsar]236-cæsar looked at [the children]278-the children a moment in silence . Then [he]236-cæsar called [a soldier]1504-a soldier and spoke with [him]1504-a soldier apart . Then [he]236-cæsar said aloud — “ [[You]278-the children [three elder children]3564-three elder children]3563-you three elder children may go where [you]278-the children will within [the camp]3565-the camp . [Few children]3566-few children are privileged to see [the camp of [Cæsar]236-cæsar]3567-the camp of cæsar . [The student]3568-the student and [the smaller girl‐child]3569-the smaller girl‐child will remain here with [me]236-cæsar . ”[236-cæsar] [Nobody]2255-nobody liked this ; but when [Cæsar]236-cæsar said a thing that thing was so , and there was an end to it . So [the three]2340-the three went . Left alone with [Jane]134-jane and [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman , [the great Roman]1508-the great roman found it easy enough to turn [them]2340-the three inside out . But it was not easy , even for [him]1508-the great roman , to make head or tail of the insides of [their]2340-the three minds when [he]1508-the great roman had got at [them]2340-the three . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman insisted that the whole thing was a dream , and refused to talk much , on the ground that if [he]2353-the learned gentleman did [he]2353-the learned gentleman would wake up . [Jane]134-jane , closely questioned , was full of information about railways , electric lights , balloons , [men‐of‐war]1510-men‐of‐war , cannons , and dynamite . “ And do [they]2340-the three fight with swords ? ”[2343-the general] asked [the General]2343-the general . “ Yes , swords and guns and cannons . ”[2343-the general] [Cæsar]236-cæsar wanted to know what guns were . “ [You]236-cæsar fire [them]2340-the three , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane , “ and [they]2340-the three go bang , and [people]280-people fall down dead . ”[134-jane] “ But what are guns like ? ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane found them hard to describe . “ But [Robert]132-robert has a toy one in [his]132-robert pocket , ”[134-jane] [she]134-jane said . So [the others]325-the others were recalled . [The boys]313-the boys explained the pistol to [Cæsar]236-cæsar very fully , and [he]236-cæsar looked at it with the greatest interest . It was a two‐shilling pistol , the one that had done such good service in [the old Egyptian village]1514-the old egyptian village . “ [I]236-cæsar shall cause guns to be made , ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar , “ and [you]236-cæsar will be detained till [I]236-cæsar know whether [you]236-cæsar have spoken the truth . [I]236-cæsar had just decided that [Britain]84-britain was not worth the bother of invading . But what [you]236-cæsar tell [me]236-cæsar decides [me]236-cæsar that it is very much worth while . ”[236-cæsar] “ But it ’s all nonsense , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [Britain]84-britain is just [a savage sort of island]3571-a savage sort of island — all fogs and trees and [big rivers]3572-big rivers . But [the people]2548-the people are kind . [We]313-the boys know [a little girl there named [Imogen]232-imogen]3574-a little girl there named imogen . And it ’s no use [your]236-cæsar making guns because [you]236-cæsar ca n’t fire them without gunpowder , and that wo n’t be invented for hundreds of years , and [we]313-the boys do n’t know how to make it , and [we]313-the boys ca n’t tell [you]236-cæsar . Do go straight [home]357-home , [dear Cæsar]236-cæsar , and let poor little [Britain]84-britain alone . ”[133-anthea] “ But [this other girl‐child]3576-this other girl‐child says — ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar . “ All [Jane]134-jane ’s been telling [you]236-cæsar is what it ’s going to be , ”[236-cæsar] [Anthea]133-anthea interrupted , “ hundreds and hundreds of years from now . ”[133-anthea] “ [The little one]3577-the little one is [a prophetess]3578-a prophetess , eh ? ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar , with a whimsical look . “ Rather young for the business , is n’t [she]3577-the little one ? ”[236-cæsar] “ [You]236-cæsar can call [her]3577-the little one [a prophetess]3578-a prophetess if [you]236-cæsar like , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ but what [Anthea]133-anthea says is true . ”[131-cyril] “ [Anthea]133-anthea ? ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar . “ That ’s a Greek name . ”[236-cæsar] “ Very likely , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , worriedly . “ [I]131-cyril say , [I]131-cyril do wish [you]236-cæsar ’d give up this idea of conquering [Britain]84-britain . It ’s not worth while , really it is n’t ! ”[131-cyril] “ On the contrary , ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar , “ what [you]236-cæsar ’ve told [me]236-cæsar has decided [me]236-cæsar to go , if it ’s only to find out what [Britain]84-britain is really like . [Guards]3580-guards , detain [these children]2807-these children . ”[236-cæsar] “ Quick , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ before [the guards]3174-the guards begin detaining . [We]3583-we had enough of that in [Babylon]40-babylon . ”[132-robert] [Jane]134-jane held up the Amulet away from the sunset , and said the word . [The learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman was pushed through and [the others]325-the others more quickly than ever before passed through the arch back into [their]325-the others own times and [the quiet dusty sitting‐room of [the learned gentleman]2353-the learned gentleman]1517-the quiet dusty sitting‐room of the learned gentleman . It is a curious fact that when [Cæsar]236-cæsar was encamped on [the coast of [Gaul]90-gaul]1519-the coast of gaul — [somewhere near [Boulogne]91-boulogne]1520-somewhere near boulogne it was , [I]0-i believe — [he]236-cæsar was sitting before [[his]236-cæsar tent]1488-his tent in the glow of the sunset , looking out over [the violet waters of [the English Channel]92-the english channel]1522-the violet waters of the english channel . Suddenly [he]236-cæsar started , rubbed [his]236-cæsar eyes , and called [[his]236-cæsar secretary]1523-his secretary . [The young man]1524-the young man came quickly from within [the tent]1491-the tent . “ [Marcus]237-marcus , ”[236-cæsar] said [Cæsar]236-cæsar . “ [I]236-cæsar have dreamed a very wonderful dream . Some of it [I]236-cæsar forget , but [I]236-cæsar remember enough to decide what was not before determined . Tomorrow [the ships that have been brought round from [the Ligeris]93-the ligeris]3584-the ships that have been brought round from the ligeris shall be provisioned . [We]3585-we shall sail for [this three‐cornered island]3586-this three‐cornered island . First , [we]3585-we will take but [two legions]3587-two legions . This , if what [we]3585-we have heard be true , should suffice . But if [my]236-cæsar dream be true , then [a hundred legions]3588-a hundred legions will not suffice . For the dream [I]236-cæsar dreamed was the most wonderful that ever tormented the brain even of [Cæsar]236-cæsar . And [Cæsar]236-cæsar has dreamed some strange things in [his]236-cæsar time . ”[236-cæsar] “ And if [you]134-jane had n’t told [Cæsar]236-cæsar all that about how things are now , [he]236-cæsar ’d never have invaded [Britain]84-britain , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert to [Jane]134-jane as [they]1526-we sat down to tea . “ Oh , nonsense , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , pouring out ; “ it was all settled hundreds of years ago . ”[133-anthea] “ [I]131-cyril do n’t know , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ [Jam]238-jam , please . This about time being only a thingummy of thought is very confusIng . If everything happens at the same time — ”[131-cyril] “ It ca n’t ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea stoutly , “ the present ’s the present and the past ’s the past . ”[133-anthea] “ Not always , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ When [we]1526-we were in the Past the present was the future . Now then ! ”[132-robert] [he]132-robert added triumphantly . And [Anthea]133-anthea could not deny it . “ [I]132-robert should have liked to see more of [the camp]3565-the camp , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ Yes , [we]1526-we did n’t get much for [our]1526-we money — but [Imogen]232-imogen is happy , that ’s one thing , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [We]1526-we left [her]232-imogen happy in [the Past]20-the past . [I]133-anthea ’ve often seen about [people]280-people being happy in [the Past]20-the past , in poetry books . [I]133-anthea see what it means now . ”[133-anthea] “ It ’s not a bad idea , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead sleepily , putting its head out of its bag and taking it in again suddenly , “ being left in [the Past]20-the past . ”[136-the psammead] [Every one]2347-every one remembered this afterwards , when — IT was the day after the adventure of [Julius Cæsar]236-cæsar and [the Little Black Girl]3465-the little black girl that [Cyril]131-cyril , bursting into [the bathroom]1529-the bathroom to wash [his]131-cyril hands for dinner ( [you]1530-you have no idea how dirty they were , for [he]131-cyril had been playing shipwrecked mariners all the morning on the leads at the back of [the house]390-the house , where the water‐cistern is ) , found [Anthea]133-anthea leaning [her]133-anthea elbows on the edge of the bath , and crying steadily into it . “ [Hullo]216-hullo ! ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said , with brotherly concern , “ what ’s up now ? Dinner’ll be cold before [you]133-anthea ’ve got enough salt‐water for a bath . ”[131-cyril] “ Go away , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea fiercely . “ [I]133-anthea hate [you]131-cyril ! [I]133-anthea hate [everybody]2317-everybody ! ”[133-anthea] There was a stricken pause . “ [I]131-cyril did n’t know , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril tamely . “ [Nobody]2255-nobody ever does know anything , ”[133-anthea] sobbed [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [I]131-cyril did n’t know [you]133-anthea were waxy . [I]131-cyril thought [you]133-anthea ’d just hurt [your]133-anthea fingers with the tap again like [you]133-anthea did last week , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril carefully explained . “ Oh — fingers ! ”[131-cyril] sneered [Anthea]133-anthea through [her]133-anthea sniffs . “ [Here]2247-here , drop it , [Panther]162-panther , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said uncomfortably . “ [You]133-anthea have n’t been having a row or anything ? ”[131-cyril] “ No , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said . “ Wash [your]133-anthea horrid hands , for goodness ’ sake , if that ’s what [you]133-anthea came for , or go . ”[133-anthea] [Anthea]133-anthea was so seldom cross that when [she]133-anthea was cross [the others]325-the others were always more surprised than angry . [Cyril]131-cyril edged along the side of [the bath]2299-the bath and stood beside [her]133-anthea . [He]131-cyril put [his]131-cyril hand on [her]133-anthea arm . “ Dry up , do , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said , rather tenderly for [him]131-cyril . And , finding that though [she]133-anthea did not at once take [his]131-cyril advice [she]133-anthea did not seem to resent it , [he]131-cyril put [his]131-cyril arm awkwardly across [her]133-anthea shoulders and rubbed [his]131-cyril head against [her]133-anthea ear . “ There ! ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said , in the tone of one administering a priceless cure for all possible sorrows . “ Now , what ’s up ? ”[131-cyril] “ Promise [you]131-cyril wo n’t laugh ? ”[131-cyril] “ [I]131-cyril do n’t feel laughish [myself]131-cyril , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , dismally . “ Well , then , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , leaning [her]133-anthea ear against [his]131-cyril head , “ it ’s [Mother]138-mother . ”[133-anthea] “ What ’s the matter with [Mother]138-mother ? ”[131-cyril] asked [Cyril]131-cyril , with apparent want of sympathy . “ [she]138-mother was all right in [her]138-mother letter this morning . ”[131-cyril] “ Yes ; but [I]131-cyril want [her]138-mother so . ”[131-cyril] “ [You]133-anthea ’re not [the only one]3594-the only one , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril briefly , and the brevity of [his]131-cyril tone admitted a good deal . “ Oh , yes , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ [I]131-cyril know . [We]3595-we all want [her]138-mother all the time . But [I]131-cyril want [her]138-mother now most dreadfully , awfully much . [I]131-cyril never wanted anything so much . [That Imogen child]3596-that imogen child — the way [the ancient British Queen]3597-the ancient british queen cuddled [her]138-mother up ! And [Imogen]232-imogen was n’t [me]131-cyril , and [the Queen]382-the queen was n’t [Mother]138-mother . And then [her]232-imogen letter this morning ! And about [The Lamb]145-the lamb liking the salt bathing ! And [she]232-imogen bathed [him]145-the lamb in this very bath the night before [she]232-imogen went away — oh , oh , oh ! ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril thumped [her]133-anthea on the back . “ Cheer up , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said . “ [You]133-anthea know [my]131-cyril inside thinking that [I]131-cyril was doing ? Well , that was partly about [Mother]138-mother . [We]3599-we ’ll soon get [her]138-mother back . If [you]133-anthea ’ll chuck it , like [a sensible kid]3600-a sensible kid , and wash [your]133-anthea face , [I]131-cyril ’ll tell [you]133-anthea about it . That ’s right . [You]133-anthea let [me]131-cyril get to the tap . Ca n’t [you]133-anthea stop crying ? Shall [I]131-cyril put the door‐key down [your]133-anthea back ? ”[131-cyril] “ That ’s for noses , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ and [I]133-anthea ’m not [a kid]3601-a kid any more than [you]131-cyril are , ”[133-anthea] but [she]133-anthea laughed a little , and [her]133-anthea mouth began to get back into its proper shape . [You]1534-you know what an odd shape [your]1534-you mouth gets into when [you]1534-you cry in earnest . “ Look here , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , working the soap round and round between [his]131-cyril hands in a thick slime of grey soapsuds . “ [I]131-cyril ’ve been thinking . [We]3602-we ’ve only just played with the Amulet so far . [We]3602-we ’ve got to work it now — work it for all it ’s worth . And it is n’t only [Mother]297-mother either . There ’s [Father]137-father out there all among the fighting . [I]131-cyril do n’t howl about it , but [I]131-cyril think — Oh , bother the soap ! ”[131-cyril] The grey‐lined soap had squirted out under the pressure of [his]131-cyril fingers , and had hit [Anthea]133-anthea ’s chin with as much force as though it had been shot from a catapult . “ There now , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said regretfully , “ now [I]133-anthea shall have to wash [my]133-anthea face . ”[133-anthea] “ [You]133-anthea ’d have had to do that anyway , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril with conviction . “ Now , [my]131-cyril idea ’s this . [You]133-anthea know missionaries ? ”[131-cyril] “ Yes , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , who did not know [a single one]1535-a single one . “ Well , [they]3604-they always take [the savages]3605-the savages beads and brandy , and stays , and hats , and braces , and really useful things — things [the savages]3605-the savages have n’t got , and never heard about . And [the savages]3605-the savages love [them]3605-the savages for [their]3605-the savages kind generousness , and give [them]3605-the savages pearls , and shells , and ivory , and cassowaries . And that ’s the way — ”[133-anthea] “ Wait a sec , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , splashing . “ [I]133-anthea ca n’t hear what [you]131-cyril ’re saying . Shells and — ”[133-anthea] “ Shells , and things like that . The great thing is to get [people]280-people to love [you]3609-you by being generous . And that ’s what [we]3610-we ’ve got to do . Next time [we]3610-we go into [the Past]20-the past [we]3610-we ’ll regularly fit out the expedition . [You]3609-you remember how [the Babylonian Queen]3041-the babylonian queen froze on to that pocket‐book ? Well , [we]3610-we ’ll take things like that . And offer them in exchange for a sight of the Amulet . ”[133-anthea] “ A sight of it is not much good . ”[133-anthea] “ No , silly . But , do n’t [you]3609-you see , when [we]3610-we ’ve seen it [we]3610-we shall know where it is , and [we]3610-we can go and take it in the night when [everybody]2317-everybody is asleep . ”[133-anthea] “ It would n’t be stealing , would it ? ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea thoughtfully , “ because it will be such an awfully long time ago when [we]3610-we do it . Oh , there ’s that bell again . ”[133-anthea] As soon as dinner was eaten ( it was tinned salmon and lettuce , and a jam tart ) , and the cloth cleared away , the idea was explained to [the others]325-the others , and [the Psammead]136-the psammead was aroused from sand , and asked what [it]136-the psammead thought would be good merchandise with which to buy the affection of say , [the Ancient Egyptians]1537-the ancient egyptians , and whether [it]136-the psammead thought the Amulet was likely to be found in [the Court of [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh]1538-the court of pharaoh . But [it]136-the psammead shook [its]136-the psammead head , and shot out [its]136-the psammead snail ’s eyes hopelessly . “ [I]136-the psammead ’m not allowed to play in this game , ”[136-the psammead] [it]136-the psammead said . “ Of course [I]136-the psammead could find out in a minute where the thing was , only [I]136-the psammead may n’t . But [I]136-the psammead may go so far as to own that [your]3613-your idea of taking things with [you]3613-your is n’t a bad one . And [I]136-the psammead should n’t show [them]278-the children all at once . Take small things and conceal them craftily about [[your]3613-your persons]3614-your persons . ”[136-the psammead] This advice seemed good . Soon the table was littered over with things which [the children]278-the children thought likely to interest [the Ancient Egyptians]240-the ancient egyptians . [Anthea]133-anthea brought dolls , puzzle blocks , a wooden tea‐service , a green leather case with Nécessaire written on it in gold letters . [Aunt Emma]139-aunt emma had once given it to [Anthea]133-anthea , and it had then contained scissors , penknife , bodkin , stiletto , thimble , corkscrew , and glove‐buttoner . The scissors , knife , and thimble , and penknife were , of course , lost , but the other things were there and as good as new . [Cyril]131-cyril contributed [lead soldiers]1540-lead soldiers , a cannon , a catapult , a tin‐opener , a tie‐clip , and a tennis ball , and a padlock — no key . [Robert]132-robert collected a candle ( “ [I]132-robert do n’t suppose [they]278-the children ever saw [a self‐fitting paraffin one]3615-a self‐fitting paraffin one , ”[132-robert] [he]132-robert said ) , a penny Japanese pin‐tray , a rubber stamp with [[his]132-robert father]2539-his father ’s name and address on it , and a piece of putty . [Jane]134-jane added a key‐ring , the brass handle of a poker , a pot that had held cold‐cream , a smoked pearl button off [her]134-jane winter coat , and a key — no lock . “ [We]309-the four children ca n’t take all this rubbish , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , with some scorn . “ [We]309-the four children must just each choose one thing . ”[132-robert] The afternoon passed very agreeably in the attempt to choose from the table the four most suitable objects . But [the four children]309-the four children could not agree what was suitable , and at last [Cyril]131-cyril said — “ Look here , let ’s each be blindfolded and reach out , and the first thing [you]3616-you touch [you]3616-you stick to . ”[131-cyril] This was done . [Cyril]131-cyril touched the padlock . [Anthea]133-anthea got the Nécessaire . [Robert]132-robert clutched the candle . [Jane]134-jane picked up the tie‐clip . “ It ’s not much , ”[134-jane] [she]134-jane said . “ [I]134-jane do n’t believe [Ancient Egyptians]240-the ancient egyptians wore ties . ”[134-jane] “ Never mind , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [I]133-anthea believe it ’s luckier not to really choose . In the stories it ’s always the thing [[the wood‐cutter]3617-the wood‐cutter ’s son]3618-the wood‐cutter ’s son picks up in [the forest]3423-the forest , and almost throws away because [he]3618-the wood‐cutter ’s son thinks it ’s no good , that turns out to be the magic thing in the end ; or else [some one]376-some one ’s lost it , and [he]3618-the wood‐cutter ’s son is rewarded with the hand of [[the King]2789-the king ’s daughter]3622-the king ’s daughter in marriage . ”[133-anthea] “ [I]131-cyril do n’t want any hands in marriage , thank [you]131-cyril . ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril firmly . “ Nor yet [me]132-robert , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ It ’s always the end of the adventures when it comes to the marriage hands . ”[132-robert] “ Are [we]3623-we ready ? ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ It is [Egypt]21-egypt [we]3623-we ’re going to , is n’t it?—nice [Egypt]21-egypt ? ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ [I]134-jane wo n’t go anywhere [I]134-jane do n’t know about — like that dreadful big‐wavy burning‐mountain city , ”[134-jane] [she]134-jane insisted . Then the Psammead was coaxed into its bag . “ [I]131-cyril say , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril suddenly , “ [I]131-cyril ’m rather sick of [kings]3624-kings . And [people]280-people notice [you]131-cyril so in [palaces]3403-palaces . Besides the Amulet ’s sure to be in [a Temple]3627-a temple . Let ’s just go among [the common people]3628-the common people , and try to work [ourselves]278-the children up by degrees . [We]278-the children might get taken on as [Temple assistants]3629-temple assistants . ”[131-cyril] “ Like beadles , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ or [vergers]3630-vergers . [They]3630-vergers must have splendid chances of stealing the Temple treasures . ”[133-anthea] “ Righto ! ”[1543-the general rejoinder] was [the general rejoinder]1543-the general rejoinder . The charm was held up . It grew big once again , and once again the warm golden Eastern light glowed softly beyond it . As [the children]278-the children stepped through [it]1545-it loud and furious voices rang in [their]278-the children ears . [They]278-the children went suddenly from the quiet of [Fitzroy Street dining‐room]1546-fitzroy street dining‐room into [a very angry Eastern crowd]1547-a very angry eastern crowd , a crowd much too angry to notice [them]278-the children . [They]278-the children edged through [it]1547-a very angry eastern crowd to the wall of [a house]1548-a house and stood there . [The crowd]2541-the crowd was of [men]2526-men , [women]2450-women , and [children]437-children . [They]2541-the crowd were of all sorts of complexions , and pictures of [them]2541-the crowd might have been coloured by [any child with a shilling paint‐box]1553-any child with a shilling paint‐box . The colours [that child]1554-that child would have used for complexions would have been yellow ochre , red ochre , light red , sepia , and indian ink . But [their]2541-the crowd faces were painted already — black eyebrows and lashes , and some red lips . [The women]2547-the women wore a sort of pinafore with shoulder straps , and loose things wound round [their]2547-the women heads and shoulders . [The men]615-the men wore very little clothing — for [they]615-the men were [the working people]1557-the working people — and [the Egyptian boys]1558-the egyptian boys and [girls]730-girls wore nothing at all , unless [you]1560-you count the little ornaments hung on chains round [their]2541-the crowd necks and waists . [The children]278-the children saw all this before [they]278-the children could hear anything distinctly . [Every one]2347-every one was shouting so . But a voice sounded above the other voices , and presently it was speaking in a silence . “ [Comrades]3631-comrades and [fellow workers]3632-fellow workers , ”[1563-a tall , coppery‐coloured man who had climbed into a chariot that had been stopped by the crowd] it said , and it was the voice of [a tall , coppery‐coloured man who had climbed into [a chariot]1564-a chariot that had been stopped by [the crowd]2541-the crowd]1563-a tall , coppery‐coloured man who had climbed into a chariot that had been stopped by the crowd . [Its owner]1566-its owner had bolted , muttering something about calling [the Guards]3174-the guards , and now [the man]2282-the man spoke from it . “ [Comrades]3631-comrades and [fellow workers]3632-fellow workers , how long are [we]3635-our to endure the tyranny of [[our]3635-our masters]3636-our masters , who live in idleness and luxury on the fruit of [our]3635-our toil ? [They]3636-our masters only give [us]3635-our a bare subsistence wage , and [they]3636-our masters live on [the fat of [the land]3638-the land]3637-the fat of the land . [We]3635-our labour all [our]3635-our lives to keep [them]3636-our masters in wanton luxury . Let [us]3635-our make an end of it ! ”[2282-the man] A roar of applause answered [him]2282-the man . “ How are [you]2282-the man going to do it ? ”[1569-a voice] cried [a voice]1569-a voice . “ [You]2282-the man look out , ”[1570-another] cried [another]1570-another , “ or [you]2282-the man ’ll get [yourself]2282-the man into trouble . ”[1570-another] “ [I]132-robert ’ve heard almost every single word of that , ”[132-robert] whispered [Robert]132-robert , “ in [Hyde Park]94-hyde park last Sunday ! ”[132-robert] “ Let [us]3635-our strike for more bread and onions and beer , and a longer mid‐day rest , ”[1571-the speaker] [the speaker]1571-the speaker went on . “ [You]2282-the man are tired , [you]2282-the man are hungry , [you]2282-the man are thirsty . [You]2282-the man are poor , [[your]2282-the man wives]3639-your wives and [children]437-children are pining for food . [The barns of [the rich]3642-the rich]3641-the barns of the rich are full to bursting with the corn [we]3635-our want , the corn [our]3635-our labour has grown . To [the granaries]3643-the granaries ! ”[1571-the speaker] “ To the granaries ! ”[2541-the crowd] cried half [the crowd]2541-the crowd ; but [another voice]1573-another voice shouted clear above the tumult , “ To [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh ! To [the King]2789-the king ! Let ’s present a petition to [the King]2789-the king ! [He]2789-the king will listen to the voice of [the oppressed]3646-the oppressed ! ”[1573-another voice] For a moment [the crowd]2541-the crowd swayed one way and another — first towards [the granaries]3643-the granaries and then towards [the palace]2811-the palace . Then , with a rush like that of an imprisoned torrent suddenly set free , it surged along [the street]481-the street towards [the palace]2811-the palace , and [the children]278-the children were carried with it . [Anthea]133-anthea found it difficult to keep [the Psammead]136-the psammead from being squeezed very uncomfortably . [The crowd]2541-the crowd swept through [the streets of dull‐looking houses with few windows , very high up , across [the market]832-the market where [people]280-people were not buying but exchanging goods]1581-the streets of dull‐looking houses with few windows , very high up , across the market where people were not buying but exchanging goods . In a momentary pause [Robert]132-robert saw a basket of onions exchanged for a hair comb and five fish for a string of beads . [The people in [the market]832-the market]1584-the people in the market seemed better off than [those in the crowd]1586-those in the crowd ; [they]1584-the people in the market had finer clothes , and more of [them]1584-the people in the market . [They]1584-the people in the market were [the kind of people who , nowadays , would have lived at [Brixton]96-brixton or [Brockley]97-brockley]1587-the kind of people who , nowadays , would have lived at brixton or brockley . “ What ’s the trouble now ? ”[1584-the people in the market] [a languid , large‐eyed lady in a crimped , half‐transparent linen dress , with [her]1588-a languid , large‐eyed lady in a crimped , half‐transparent linen dress , with her black hair very much braided and puffed out black hair very much braided and puffed out]1588-a languid , large‐eyed lady in a crimped , half‐transparent linen dress , with her black hair very much braided and puffed out , asked of [a date‐seller]1589-a date‐seller . “ Oh , [the working‐men]3647-the working‐men — discontented as usual , ”[2282-the man] [the man]2282-the man answered . “ Listen to [them]3647-the working‐men . [Anyone]283-anyone would think it mattered whether [they]3647-the working‐men had a little more or less to eat . [Dregs of society]3649-dregs of society ! ”[1591-the date‐seller] said [the date‐seller]1591-the date‐seller . “ [Scum]3650-scum ! ”[1074-the lady] said [the lady]1074-the lady . “ And [I]132-robert ’ve heard that before , too , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . At that moment the voice of [the crowd]2541-the crowd changed , from anger to doubt , from doubt to fear . There were other voices shouting ; [they]1594-they shouted defiance and menace , and [they]1594-they came nearer very quickly . There was the rattle of wheels and the pounding of hoofs . A voice shouted , “ [Guards]3580-guards ! ”[1573-another voice] “ [The Guards]3174-the guards ! [The Guards]3174-the guards ! ”[1573-another voice] shouted [another voice]1573-another voice , and the crowd of [workmen]1596-workmen took up the cry . “ [The Guards]3174-the guards ! [Pharaoh ’s Guards]3655-pharaoh ’s guards ! ”[1596-workmen] And swaying a little once more , [the crowd]2541-the crowd hung for a moment as it were balanced . Then as the trampling hoofs came nearer [the workmen]1598-the workmen fled dispersed , up [alleys]1599-alleys and into [the courts of houses]1600-the courts of houses , and [the Guards]3174-the guards in [[their]3174-the guards embossed leather chariots]1602-their embossed leather chariots swept down [the street]481-the street at the gallop , [their]3174-the guards wheels clattering over the stones , and [their]3174-the guards dark‐coloured , blue tunics blown open and back with the wind of [their]3174-the guards going . “ So that riot ’s over , ”[1604-the crimped‐linen‐dressed lady] said [the crimped‐linen‐dressed lady]1604-the crimped‐linen‐dressed lady ; “ that ’s a blessing ! And did [you]309-the four children notice [the Captain of the Guard]2966-the captain of the guard ? Now [they]309-the four children each drew a long breath and looked at [the others]325-the others . “ [We]309-the four children ’re well out of that , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ Yes , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ but [I]133-anthea do wish [the poor men]3658-the poor men had n’t been driven back before [they]3658-the poor men could get to [the King]2789-the king . [He]2789-the king might have done something for [them]3658-the poor men . ”[133-anthea] “ Not if [he]2789-the king was [the one in the Bible]3660-the one in the bible [he]2789-the king would n’t , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ [He]2789-the king had a hard heart . ”[134-jane] “ Ah , that was [the Moses one]3661-the moses one , ”[133-anthea] [Anthea]133-anthea explained . “ [The Joseph one]3662-the joseph one was quite different . To right and left of [it]1611-it were other buildings only a little less magnificent . “ Did [you]1612-them wish to seek out [the Temple of Amen‐Rā]3673-the temple of amen‐rā ? ”[132-robert] asked a soft voice behind [them]1612-them , “ or [the Temple of Mut]3674-the temple of mut , or [the Temple of Khonsu]3675-the temple of khonsu ? ”[132-robert] [They]1612-them turned to find beside [them]1612-them [a young man]1613-a young man . [He]1613-a young man was shaved clean from head to foot , and on [his]1613-a young man feet were light papyrus sandals . [He]1613-a young man was clothed in a linen tunic of white , embroidered heavily in colours . [He]1613-a young man was gay with anklets , bracelets , and armlets of gold , richly inlaid . [He]1613-a young man wore a ring on [his]1613-a young man finger , and [he]1613-a young man had a short jacket of gold embroidery something like [the Zouave soldiers]1614-the zouave soldiers wear , and on [his]1613-a young man neck was a gold collar with many amulets hanging from it . But among the amulets [the children]278-the children could see none like [theirs]278-the children . “ It does n’t matter which Temple , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril frankly . “ Tell [me]1524-the young man [your]131-cyril mission , ”[1524-the young man] said [the young man]1524-the young man . “ [I]1524-the young man am [a divine father of [the Temple of [Amen‐Rā]267-amen‐rā]98-the temple of amen‐rā]3676-a divine father of the temple of amen‐rā and perhaps [I]1524-the young man can help [you]131-cyril . ”[1524-the young man] “ Well , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ [we]3677-we ’ve come from [the great Empire on which the sun never sets]3678-the great empire on which the sun never sets . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]3339-the priest thought somehow that [you]131-cyril ’d come from [some odd , out‐of‐the‐way spot]3679-some odd , out‐of‐the‐way spot , ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest with courtesy . “ And [we]3677-we ’ve seen [a good many palaces]3680-a good many palaces . The Psammead stirred uneasily in its embroidered bag . “ Have [you]131-cyril brought gifts to [the Temple]3336-the temple ? ”[3339-the priest] asked [the priest]3339-the priest cautiously . “ [We]3677-we have got some gifts , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril with equal caution . “ [You]131-cyril see there ’s magic mixed up in it . So [we]3677-we ca n’t tell [you]131-cyril everything . But [we]3677-we do n’t want to give [our]3677-we gifts for nothing . ”[131-cyril] “ Beware how [you]131-cyril insult [the god]925-the god , ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest sternly . “ [I]3339-the priest also can do magic . [I]3339-the priest can make a waxen image of [you]131-cyril , and [I]3339-the priest can say words which , as the wax image melts before the fire , will make [you]131-cyril dwindle away and at last perish miserably . ”[3339-the priest] “ Pooh ! ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril stoutly , “ that ’s nothing . [I]131-cyril can make fire itself ! ”[131-cyril] “ [I]3339-the priest should jolly well like to see [you]131-cyril do it , ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest unbelievingly . “ Well , [you]131-cyril shall , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ nothing easier . Just stand close round [me]131-cyril . ”[131-cyril] “ Do [you]131-cyril need no preparation — no fasting , no incantations ? ”[3339-the priest] [The priest]3339-the priest ’s tone was incredulous . “ The incantation ’s quite short , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , taking the hint ; “ and as for fasting , it ’s not needed in [my]131-cyril sort of magic . [Union Jack]241-union jack , Printing Press , Gunpowder , [Rule Britannia]242-rule britannia ! Come , Fire , at the end of this little stick ! ”[131-cyril] [He]131-cyril had pulled a match from [his]131-cyril pocket , and as [he]131-cyril ended the incantation which contained no words that it seemed likely [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian had ever heard [he]131-cyril stooped in the little crowd of [[his]131-cyril relations]1623-his relations and [the priest]3339-the priest and struck the match on [his]131-cyril boot . [He]131-cyril stood up , shielding the flame with one hand . “ See ? ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said , with modest pride . “ Here , take it into [your]3339-the priest hand . ”[131-cyril] “ No , thank [you]131-cyril , ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest , swiftly backing . “ Can [you]131-cyril do that again ? ”[3339-the priest] “ Yes . ”[131-cyril] “ Then come with [me]131-cyril to [the great double house of [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh]3684-the great double house of pharaoh . [He]239-pharaoh loves good magic , and [he]239-pharaoh will raise [you]3339-the priest to honour and glory . There ’s no need of secrets between [initiates]3685-initiates , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril went on confidentially . “ The fact is , [I]131-cyril am out of favour at present owing to a little matter of failure of prophecy . [I]131-cyril told [him]239-pharaoh [a beautiful princess]3686-a beautiful princess would be sent to [him]239-pharaoh from [Syria]100-syria , and , lo ! [a woman thirty years old]3687-a woman thirty years old arrived . But [she]3687-a woman thirty years old was [a beautiful woman]3688-a beautiful woman not so long ago . Time is only a mode of thought , [you]3339-the priest know . ”[131-cyril] [The children]278-the children thrilled to the familiar words . “ So [you]3339-the priest know that too , do [you]3339-the priest ? ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ It is part of the mystery of all magic , is it not ? ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest . “ Now if [I]3339-the priest bring [you]3339-the priest to [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh the little unpleasantness [I]3339-the priest spoke of will be forgotten . And [I]3339-the priest will ask [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , the Great House , [Son of the Sun]3689-son of the sun , and [Lord of [the South and North]3691-the south and north]3690-lord of the south and north , to decree that [you]3339-the priest shall lodge in [the Temple]3336-the temple . Then [you]3339-the priest can have a good look round , and teach [me]3339-the priest [your]3339-the priest magic . And [I]3339-the priest will teach [you]3339-the priest [mine]3339-the priest . ”[3339-the priest] This idea seemed good — at least it was better than any other which at that moment occurred to [anybody]575-anybody , so [they]1629-they followed [the priest]3339-the priest through [the city]3240-the city . [The streets]3286-the streets were very narrow and dirty . [The best houses]1633-the best houses , [the priest]3339-the priest explained , were built within walls twenty to twenty‐five feet high , and such windows as showed in the walls were very high up . The tops of palm‐trees showed above the walls . [[The poor people]1350-the poor people ’s houses]1636-the poor people ’s houses were [little square huts with a door and two windows]1637-little square huts with a door and two windows , and smoke coming out of a hole in the back . “ [The poor Egyptians]3693-the poor egyptians have n’t improved so very much in [[their]3693-the poor egyptians building]3694-their building since the first time [we]3695-we came to [Egypt]21-egypt , ”[131-cyril] whispered [Cyril]131-cyril to [Anthea]133-anthea . [The huts]2529-the huts were roofed with palm branches , and everywhere there were chickens , and goats , and [little naked children kicking about in the yellow dust]1639-little naked children kicking about in the yellow dust . On one roof was a goat , who had climbed up and was eating the dry palm‐leaves with snorts and head‐tossings of delight . Over every [house]1640-house door was some sort of figure or shape . “ Amulets , ”[3339-the priest] [the priest]3339-the priest explained , “ to keep off the evil eye . ”[3339-the priest] “ [I]132-robert do n’t think much of [[your]134-jane ‘ nice Egypt]3696-your ‘ nice egypt , ’ ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert whispered to [Jane]134-jane ; “ it ’s simply not a patch on [Babylon]40-babylon . ”[132-robert] “ Ah , [you]132-robert wait till [you]132-robert see [the palace]2811-the palace , ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane whispered back . [The palace]2811-the palace was indeed much more magnificent than anything [they]1643-they had yet seen that day , though [it]2811-the palace would have made but a poor show beside that of [the Babylonian King]1644-the babylonian king . [They]1643-they came to [it]2811-the palace through a great square pillared doorway of sandstone that stood in a high brick wall . The shut doors were of massive cedar , with bronze hinges , and were studded with bronze nails . At the side was a little door and a wicket gate , and through this [the priest]3339-the priest led [the children]278-the children . [He]3339-the priest seemed to know a word that made [the sentries]1647-the sentries make way for [him]3339-the priest . Inside was [a garden]1648-a garden , planted with hundreds of different kinds of trees and flowering shrubs , [a lake full of fish]1649-a lake full of fish , with blue lotus flowers at the margin , and ducks swimming about cheerfully , and looking , as [Jane]134-jane said , quite modern . “ [The guard‐chamber]3698-the guard‐chamber , [the store‐houses]3699-the store‐houses , [[the Queen]382-the queen ’s house]3701-the queen ’s house , ”[3339-the priest] said [the priest]3339-the priest , pointing [them]278-the children out . [They]1643-they passed through [open courtyards]1651-open courtyards , paved with flat stones , and [the priest]3339-the priest whispered to [a guard]1653-a guard at a great inner gate . “ [We]1643-they are fortunate , ”[3339-the priest] [he]3339-the priest said to [the children]278-the children , “ [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh is even now in [the Court of Honour]3702-the court of honour . Now , do n’t forget to be overcome with respect and admiration . It wo n’t do any harm if [you]278-the children fall flat on [your]278-the children faces . And whatever [you]278-the children do , do n’t speak until [you]278-the children ’re spoken to . ”[3339-the priest] “ There used to be that rule in [[our]1643-they country]939-our country , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ when [[my]132-robert father]624-my father was [a little boy]3705-a little boy . ”[132-robert] At the outer end of [the great hall]2958-the great hall [a crowd of people]1656-a crowd of people were arguing with and even shoving [the Guards]3174-the guards , who seemed to make it a rule not to let [anyone]283-anyone through unless [they]3174-the guards were bribed to do it . [The children]278-the children heard several promises of the utmost richness , and wondered whether they would ever be kept . All round [the hall]1660-the hall were pillars of painted wood . The roof was of cedar , gorgeously inlaid . About half‐way up [the hall]1660-the hall was a wide , shallow step that went right across [the hall]1660-the hall ; then a little farther on another ; and then a steep flight of narrower steps , leading right up to the throne on which [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh sat . [He]239-pharaoh sat there very splendid , [his]239-pharaoh red and white double crown on [his]239-pharaoh head , and [his]239-pharaoh sceptre in [his]239-pharaoh hand . The throne had a canopy of wood and wooden pillars painted in bright colours . On a low , broad bench that ran all round [the hall]1660-the hall sat [the friends]1664-the friends , [relatives]1665-relatives , and [courtiers of [the King]2789-the king]1666-courtiers of the king , leaning on richly‐covered cushions . [The priest]3339-the priest led [the children]278-the children up the steps till [they]278-the children all stood before the throne ; and then , suddenly , [he]239-pharaoh fell on [his]239-pharaoh face with hands outstretched . [The others]325-the others did the same , [Anthea]133-anthea falling very carefully because of the Psammead . “ Raise [them]278-the children , ”[239-pharaoh] said the voice of [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , “ that [they]278-the children may speak to [me]239-pharaoh . ”[239-pharaoh] [The officers of [[the King]2789-the king ’s household]1673-the king ’s household]1671-the officers of the king ’s household raised [them]278-the children . “ Who are [these strangers]3706-these strangers ? ”[239-pharaoh] [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh asked , and added very crossly , “ And what do [you]1671-the officers of the king ’s household mean , [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , by daring to come into [my]239-pharaoh presence while [your]243-rekh‐marā innocence is not established ? ”[239-pharaoh] “ Oh , [great King]3707-great king , ”[1674-the young priest] said [the young priest]1674-the young priest , “ [you]243-rekh‐marā are the very image of [Rā]22-amen rā , and the likeness of [[his]22-amen rā son]561-his son [Horus]245-horus in every respect . [You]243-rekh‐marā know the thoughts of the hearts of the gods and of [men]2526-men , and [you]243-rekh‐marā have divined that [these strangers]3706-these strangers are [the children of [the children of the vile and conquered Kings of [the Empire]2791-the empire where the sun never sets]3712-the children of the vile and conquered kings of the empire where the sun never sets]3711-the children of the children of the vile and conquered kings of the empire where the sun never sets . [They]3706-these strangers know a magic not known to [the Egyptians]240-the ancient egyptians . And [they]3706-these strangers come with gifts in [their]3706-these strangers hands as tribute to [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , in whose heart is the wisdom of [the gods]3714-the gods , and on [his]239-pharaoh lips [their]3706-these strangers truth . ”[1674-the young priest] “ That is all very well , ”[239-pharaoh] said [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , “ but where are the gifts ? ”[239-pharaoh] [The children]278-the children , bowing as well as [they]278-the children could in [their]278-the children embarrassment at finding [themselves]278-the children the centre of interest in a circle more grand , more golden and more highly coloured than [they]278-the children could have imagined possible , pulled out the padlock , the Nécessaire , and the tie‐clip . “ But it ’s not tribute all the same , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril muttered . “ [England]8-england does n’t pay tribute ! ”[131-cyril] [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh examined all the things with great interest when [the chief of the household]1676-the chief of the household had taken them up to [him]239-pharaoh . “ Deliver [them]3706-these strangers to [the Keeper of [the Treasury]3716-the treasury]3715-the keeper of the treasury , ”[239-pharaoh] [he]239-pharaoh said to [one near [him]239-pharaoh]1677-one near him . And to [the children]278-the children [he]239-pharaoh said — “ A small tribute , truly , but strange , and not without worth . And the magic , [O Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā ? ”[239-pharaoh] “ [These unworthy sons of [a conquered nation]3718-a conquered nation]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation ... ”[243-rekh‐marā] began [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā . “ Nothing of the kind ! ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril whispered angrily . “ ... of [a vile and conquered nation]3719-a vile and conquered nation , can make fire to spring from dry wood — in the sight of all . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]239-pharaoh should jolly well like to see [them]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation do it , ”[239-pharaoh] said [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , just as [the priest]3339-the priest had done . So [Cyril]131-cyril , without more ado , did it . “ Do more magic , ”[2789-the king] said [the King]2789-the king , with simple appreciation . “ [He]2789-the king can not do any more magic , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea suddenly , and all eyes were turned on [her]133-anthea , “ because of the voice of [the free people who are shouting for bread and onions and beer and a long mid‐day rest]3720-the free people who are shouting for bread and onions and beer and a long mid‐day rest . If [the people]2548-the people had what [they]2548-the people wanted , [he]2789-the king could do more . ”[133-anthea] “ [A rude‐spoken girl]3722-a rude‐spoken girl , ”[239-pharaoh] said [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh . “ But give the dogs what [they]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation want , ”[239-pharaoh] [he]239-pharaoh said , without turning [his]239-pharaoh head . “ Let [them]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation have [their]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation rest and [their]3717-these unworthy sons of a conquered nation extra rations . There are plenty of [slaves]2875-slaves to work . ”[239-pharaoh] [A richly‐dressed official]1681-a richly‐dressed official hurried out . “ [You]243-rekh‐marā will be [the idol of [the people]2548-the people]3724-the idol of the people , ”[243-rekh‐marā] [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā whispered joyously ; “ [the Temple of Amen]3726-the temple of amen will not contain [their]2548-the people offerings . ”[243-rekh‐marā] [Cyril]131-cyril struck another match , and [all the court]1682-all the court was overwhelmed with delight and wonder . And when [Cyril]131-cyril took the candle from [his]131-cyril pocket and lighted it with the match , and then held the burning candle up before [the King]2789-the king [the enthusiasm]1684-the enthusiasm knew no bounds . “ Oh , [greatest of all , before whom sun and moon and stars]3727-greatest of all , before whom sun and moon and stars bow down , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā insinuatingly , “ am [I]243-rekh‐marā pardoned ? Is [my]243-rekh‐marā innocence made plain ? ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ As plain as it ever will be , [I]239-pharaoh daresay , ”[239-pharaoh] said [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh shortly . “ Get along with [you]243-rekh‐marā . [You]243-rekh‐marā are pardoned . Go in peace . ”[3339-the priest] [The priest]3339-the priest went with lightning swiftness . “ And what , ”[2789-the king] said [the King]2789-the king suddenly , “ is it that moves in that sack ? Show [me]2789-the king , oh [strangers]1269-strangers . ”[2789-the king] There was nothing for it but to show [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ Seize it , ”[239-pharaoh] said [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh carelessly . “ [A very curious monkey]3729-a very curious monkey . It will be a nice little novelty for [my]239-pharaoh wild beast collection . ”[239-pharaoh] And instantly , the entreaties of [the children]278-the children availing as little as the bites of [the Psammead]136-the psammead , though both bites and entreaties were fervent , it was carried away from before [their]278-the children eyes . “ Oh , do be careful ! ”[133-anthea] cried [Anthea]133-anthea . “ At least keep it dry ! Keep it in [its sacred house]3730-its sacred house ! ”[133-anthea] [She]133-anthea held up the embroidered bag . “ It ’s a magic creature , ”[132-robert] cried [Robert]132-robert ; “ it ’s simply priceless ! ”[132-robert] “ [You]243-rekh‐marā ’ve no right to take it away , ”[134-jane] cried [Jane]134-jane incautiously . “ It ’s a shame , [a barefaced robbery]3731-a barefaced robbery , that ’s what it is ! ”[134-jane] There was an awful silence . Then [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh spoke . “ Take [the sacred house of the beast from [them]278-the children]3732-the sacred house of the beast from them , ”[239-pharaoh] [he]239-pharaoh said , “ and imprison all . To‐night after supper it may be [our]278-the children pleasure to see more magic . Guard [them]278-the children well , and do not torture [them]278-the children — yet ! ”[239-pharaoh] “ Oh , dear ! ”[134-jane] sobbed [Jane]134-jane , as [they]278-the children were led away . “ [I]134-jane knew exactly what it would be ! Oh , [I]134-jane wish [you]131-cyril had n’t ! ”[134-jane] “ Shut up , [silly]3733-silly , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ [You]3733-silly know [you]3733-silly would come to [Egypt]21-egypt . It was [your]3733-silly own idea entirely . Shut up . It ’ll be all right . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]134-jane thought [we]278-the children should play ball with [queens]2812-queens , ”[134-jane] sobbed [Jane]134-jane , “ and have no end of larks ! And now everything ’s going to be perfectly horrid ! ”[134-jane] [The room [they]278-the children were shut up in]1688-the room they were shut up in was [a room]345-a room , and not [a dungeon]1690-a dungeon , as [the elder ones]1691-the elder ones had feared . That , as [Anthea]133-anthea said , was one comfort . There were paintings on the wall that at any other time would have been most interesting . And a sort of low couch , and chairs . When [they]278-the children were alone [Jane]134-jane breathed a sigh of relief . “ Now [we]278-the children can get [home]357-home all right , ”[134-jane] [she]134-jane said . “ And leave [the Psammead]136-the psammead ? ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea reproachfully . “ Wait a sec . [I]131-cyril ’ve got an idea , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . [He]131-cyril pondered for a few moments . Then [he]131-cyril began hammering on the heavy cedar door . It opened , and [a guard]1653-a guard put in [his]131-cyril head . “ Stop that row , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said sternly , “ or — ”[131-cyril] “ Look here , ”[131-cyril] [Cyril]131-cyril interrupted , “ it ’s very dull for [you]131-cyril is n’t it ? Would n’t [you]131-cyril like to see it ? ”[131-cyril] “ [I]2960-the guard do n’t mind if [I]2960-the guard do , ”[2960-the guard] said [the guard]2960-the guard . “ Well then , [you]131-cyril get [us]278-the children that monkey of [ours]278-the children that was taken away , and [we]278-the children ’ll show [you]131-cyril . ”[2960-the guard] “ How do [I]1694-the soldier know [you]1694-the soldier ’re not making game of [me]1694-the soldier ? ”[1694-the soldier] asked [the soldier]1694-the soldier . “ Should n’t wonder if [you]1694-the soldier only wanted to get the creature so as to set it on [me]1694-the soldier . [I]1694-the soldier daresay its teeth and claws are poisonous . ”[1694-the soldier] “ Well , look here , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ [You]1694-the soldier see [we]278-the children ’ve got nothing with [us]278-the children ? [You]1694-the soldier just shut the door , and open it again in five minutes , and [we]278-the children ’ll have got a magic — oh , [I]132-robert do n’t know — a magic flower in a pot for [you]1694-the soldier . ”[132-robert] “ If [you]1694-the soldier can do that [you]1694-the soldier can do anything , ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier , and [he]1694-the soldier went out and barred the door . Then , of course , [they]1696-they held up the Amulet . [They]1696-they found the East by holding it up , and turning slowly till the Amulet began to grow big , walked [home]357-home through it , and came back with a geranium in full scarlet flower from the staircase window of [the Fitzroy Street house]2504-the fitzroy street house . “ Well ! ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier when [he]1694-the soldier came in . “ [I]1694-the soldier really am — ! ”[1694-the soldier] “ [We]1696-they can do much more wonderful things than that — oh , ever so much , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea persuasively , “ if [we]1696-they only have [our]1696-they monkey . And here ’s twopence for [yourself]1694-the soldier . ”[133-anthea] [The soldier]1694-the soldier looked at the twopence . “ What ’s this ? ”[1694-the soldier] [he]1694-the soldier said . [Robert]132-robert explained how much simpler it was to pay money for things than to exchange them as [the people]2548-the people were doing in [the market]832-the market . Later on [the soldier]1694-the soldier gave the coins to [[his]1694-the soldier captain]1704-his captain , who , later still , showed them to [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh , who of course kept them and was much struck with the idea . That was really how coins first came to be used in [Egypt]21-egypt . [You]1705-you will not believe this , [I]0-i daresay , but really , if [you]1705-you believe the rest of the story , [I]0-i do n’t see why [you]1705-you should n’t believe this as well . “ [I]133-anthea say , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , struck by a sudden thought , “ [I]133-anthea suppose it ’ll be all right about [those workmen]3736-those workmen ? [The King]2789-the king wo n’t go back on what [he]2789-the king said about [them]3736-those workmen just because [he]2789-the king ’s angry with [us]3738-we ? ”[133-anthea] “ Oh , no , ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier , “ [you]1705-you see , [he]2789-the king ’s rather afraid of magic . [He]2789-the king ’ll keep to [his]2789-the king word right enough . ”[1694-the soldier] “ Then that ’s all right , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert ; and [Anthea]133-anthea said softly and coaxingly — “ Ah , do get [us]3738-we the monkey , and then [you]1705-you ’ll see some lovely magic . Do — there ’s [a nice , kind soldier]3739-a nice , kind soldier . ”[133-anthea] “ [I]132-robert do n’t know where [they]3736-those workmen ’ve put [your]1705-you precious monkey , but if [I]132-robert can get [another chap]3740-another chap to take on [my]132-robert duty [here]2247-here [I]132-robert ’ll see what [I]132-robert can do , ”[132-robert] [he]132-robert said grudgingly , and went out . “ Do [you]1705-you mean , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ that [we]3738-we ’re going off without even trying for the other half of the Amulet ? ”[132-robert] “ [I]133-anthea really think [we]3738-we ’d better , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea tremulously . “ Of course the other half of the Amulet ’s here somewhere or [our]3738-we half would n’t have brought [us]3738-we here . [I]133-anthea do wish [we]3738-we could find it . It is a pity [we]3738-we do n’t know any real magic . Then [we]3738-we could find out . [I]133-anthea do wonder where it is — exactly . ”[133-anthea] If [they]1707-they had only known it , something very like the other half of the Amulet was very near [them]1707-they . It hung round the neck of [some one]376-some one , and that [some one]376-some one was watching [them]1707-they through a chink , high up in the wall , specially devised for watching [people who were imprisoned]1710-people who were imprisoned . But [they]1707-they did not know . There was nearly an hour of anxious waiting . [They]1707-they tried to take an interest in the picture on the wall , a picture of [harpers]1711-harpers playing very odd harps and [women]2450-women dancing at a feast . [They]1707-they examined the painted plaster floor , and the chairs were of white painted wood with coloured stripes at intervals . But the time went slowly , and [every one]2347-every one had time to think of how [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh had said , “ Do n’t torture [them]1707-they — yet . ”[239-pharaoh] “ If the worst comes to the worst , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ [we]3738-we must just bunk , and leave [the Psammead]136-the psammead . [I]131-cyril believe it can take care of itself well enough . [They]1707-they wo n’t kill it or hurt [it]136-the psammead when [they]1707-they find it can speak and give wishes . [They]1707-they ’ll build it [a temple]3627-a temple , [I]131-cyril should n’t wonder . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]133-anthea could n’t bear to go without it , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ and [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh said ‘ After supper , ’ that wo n’t be just yet . And [the soldier]1694-the soldier was curious . [I]133-anthea ’m sure [we]3738-we ’re all right for the present . ”[133-anthea] All the same , the sounds of the door being unbarred seemed one of the prettiest sounds possible . “ Suppose [he]1694-the soldier has n’t got the Psammead ? ”[134-jane] whispered [Jane]134-jane . But that doubt was set at rest by [the Psammead]136-the psammead itself ; for almost before the door was open it sprang through the chink of it into [Anthea]133-anthea ’s arms , shivering and hunching up its fur . “ Here ’s its fancy overcoat , ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier , holding out the bag , into which the Psammead immediately crept . “ Now , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ what would [you]1694-the soldier like [us]3738-we to do ? Anything [you]1694-the soldier ’d like [us]3738-we to get for [you]1694-the soldier ? ”[131-cyril] “ Any little trick [you]1694-the soldier like , ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier . “ If [you]1694-the soldier can get a strange flower blooming in an earthenware vase [you]1694-the soldier can get anything , [I]131-cyril suppose , ”[131-cyril] [he]131-cyril said . “ [I]131-cyril just wish [I]131-cyril ’d got [two men]3744-two men ’s loads of jewels from [[the King]2789-the king ’s treasury]3746-the king ’s treasury . That ’s what [I]131-cyril ’ve always wished for . ”[131-cyril] At the word “ wish ”[1694-the soldier] [the children]278-the children knew that [the Psammead]136-the psammead would attend to that bit of magic . [It]136-the psammead did , and the floor was littered with a spreading heap of gold and precious stones . “ Any other little trick ? ”[131-cyril] asked [Cyril]131-cyril loftily . “ Shall [we]3747-we become invisible ? Vanish ? ”[131-cyril] “ Yes , if [you]134-jane like , ”[1694-the soldier] said [the soldier]1694-the soldier ; “ but not through the door , [you]134-jane do n’t . ”[1694-the soldier] [He]1694-the soldier closed it carefully and set [his]1694-the soldier broad Egyptian back against it . “ No ! no ! ”[131-cyril] cried a voice high up among the tops of the tall wooden pillars that stood against the wall . There was a sound of [some one moving above]1718-some one moving above . [The soldier]1694-the soldier was as much surprised as [anybody]575-anybody . “ That ’s magic , if [you]134-jane like , ”[1694-the soldier] [he]1694-the soldier said . And then [Jane]134-jane held up the Amulet , uttering the word of Power . At the sound of it and at the sight of the Amulet growing into the great arch [the soldier]1694-the soldier fell flat on [his]1694-the soldier face among the jewels with a cry of awe and terror . [The children]278-the children went through the arch with a quickness born of long practice . But [Jane]134-jane stayed in the middle of the arch and looked back . [The others]325-the others , standing on the dining‐room carpet in [Fitzroy Street]7-fitzroy street , turned and saw [her]134-jane still in the arch . “ [Some one]376-some one ’s holding [her]134-jane , ”[131-cyril] cried [Cyril]131-cyril . “ [We]325-the others must go back . ”[131-cyril] But [they]325-the others pulled at [Jane]134-jane ’s hands just to see if [she]134-jane would come , and , of course , [she]134-jane did come . Then , as usual , [the arch]3436-the arch was little again and there [they]325-the others all were . “ Oh , [I]134-jane do wish [you]131-cyril had n’t ! ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane said crossly . “ It was so interesting . [The priest]3339-the priest had come in and [he]3339-the priest was kicking [the soldier]1694-the soldier , and telling [him]3339-the priest [he]3339-the priest ’d done it now , and [they]325-the others must take the jewels and flee for [their]325-the others lives . ”[134-jane] “ And did [they]325-the others ? ”[134-jane] “ [I]134-jane do n’t know . [You]131-cyril interfered , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane ungratefully . “ [I]134-jane should have liked to see the last of it . ”[134-jane] As a matter of fact , [none of [them]325-the others]1725-none of them had seen the last of it — if by “ it ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane meant the adventure of [the Priest]3339-the priest and [the Soldier]1694-the soldier . “ LOOK here , said [Cyril]131-cyril , sitting on the dining‐table and swinging [his]131-cyril legs ; “[0-i] [I]0-i really have got it . ” “[0-i] Got what ? ” was the not unnatural rejoinder of [the others]325-the others . [Cyril]131-cyril was making [a boat]3752-a boat with a penknife and a piece of wood , and [the girls]311-the girls were making warm frocks for [their]311-the girls dolls , for the weather was growing chilly . “[0-i] Why , do n’t [you]1728-you see ? It ’s really not any good [our]1729-we going into [the Past]20-the past looking for that Amulet . [The Past]20-the past ’s as full of different times as — as [the sea]2414-the sea is of sand . [We]1729-we ’re simply bound to hit upon the wrong time . [We]1729-we might spend [our]1729-we lives looking for the Amulet and never see a sight of it . Why , it ’s the end of September already . It ’s like looking for a needle in — ” “[0-i] A bottle of hay — [I]0-i know , ” interrupted [Robert]132-robert ; “[0-i] but if [we]1729-we do n’t go on doing that , what are [we]1729-we to do ? ” “[131-cyril] That ’s just it , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril in mysterious accents . “[131-cyril] Oh , bother ! ” [Old Nurse]142-old nurse had come in with the tray of knives , forks , and glasses , and was getting the tablecloth and table‐napkins out of the chiffonier drawer . “[131-cyril] It ’s always meal‐times just when [you]1728-you come to anything interesting . ” “[1731-a nice interesting handful] And [a nice interesting handful]1731-a nice interesting handful [you]1728-you ’d be , [Master Cyril]131-cyril , ” said [old Nurse]305-old nurse , “[131-cyril] if [I]0-i was n’t to bring [your]1728-you meals up to time . Do n’t [you]1728-you begin grumbling now , fear [you]1728-you get something to grumble at . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was n’t grumbling , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril quite untruly ; “[0-i] but it does always happen like that . ” “[1728-you] [You]1728-you deserve to have something happen , ” said [old Nurse]305-old nurse . “[1732-slave] [Slave]1732-slave , [slave]1732-slave , slave for [you]1728-you day and night , and never a word of thanks ... ” “[1732-slave] Why , [you]1728-you do everything beautifully , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[1728-you] It ’s the first time any of [you]1728-you ’s troubled to say so , anyhow , ” said [Nurse]142-old nurse shortly . “[1728-you] What ’s the use of saying ? ” inquired [Robert]132-robert . “[1734-we] [We]1734-we eat [our]1734-we meals fast enough , and almost always two helps . That ought to show [you]1728-you ! ” “[1734-we] Ah ! ” said [old Nurse]142-old nurse , going round the table and putting the knives and forks in their places ; “[1734-we] [you]1728-you ’re [a man]451-a man all over , [Master Robert]132-robert . There was [my]0-i poor [Green]246-green , all the years [he]246-green lived with [me]0-i [I]0-i never could get more out of [him]246-green than ‘ It ’s all right ! ’ when [I]0-i asked [him]246-green if [he]246-green ’d fancied [his]246-green dinner . And yet , when [he]246-green lay a‐dying , [his]246-green last words to [me]0-i was , ‘ [Maria]247-maria , [you]247-maria was always [a good cook]1736-a good cook ! ’ ” [She]1737-she ended with a trembling voice . “[246-green] And so [you]247-maria are , ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea , and [she]133-anthea and [Jane]134-jane instantly hugged [her]247-maria . When [she]133-anthea had gone out of [the room]2349-the room [Anthea]133-anthea said — “[247-maria] [I]0-i know exactly how [she]1737-she feels . Now , look here ! Let ’s do a penance to show [we]1738-we ’re sorry [we]1738-we did n’t think about telling [her]1737-she before what nice cooking [she]1737-she does , and what a dear [she]1737-she is . ” “[0-i] Penances are silly , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[0-i] Not if the penance is something to please [some one else]2942-some one else . [I]0-i did n’t mean old peas and hair shirts and sleeping on the stones . [I]0-i mean [we]1738-we ’ll make [her]1737-she [a sorry‐present]1740-a sorry‐present , ” explained [Anthea]133-anthea . “[1738-we] Look here ! [I]0-i vote [Cyril]131-cyril does n’t tell [us]1738-we [his]131-cyril idea until [we]1738-we ’ve done something for [old Nurse]142-old nurse . It ’s worse for [us]1738-we than [him]131-cyril , ” [she]133-anthea added hastily , “[131-cyril] because [he]131-cyril knows what it is and [we]1738-we do n’t . Do [you]1738-we all agree ? ” [The others]325-the others would have been ashamed not to agree , so [they]325-the others did . It was not till quite near the end of dinner — mutton fritters and blackberry and apple pie — that out of the earnest talk of [the four]3758-the four came an idea that pleased [everybody]2317-everybody and would , [they]325-the others hoped , please [Nurse]142-old nurse . [Cyril]131-cyril and [Robert]132-robert went out with the taste of apple still in [their]325-the others mouths and the purple of blackberries on [their]325-the others lips — and , in the case of [Robert]132-robert , on the wristband as well — and bought a big sheet of cardboard at [the stationers]3760-the stationers . Then at [[the plumber]3761-the plumber ’s shop]3762-the plumber ’s shop , that has tubes and pipes and taps and gas‐fittings in the window , [they]325-the others bought a pane of glass the same size as the cardboard . [The man]2282-the man cut it with a very interesting tool that had a bit of diamond at the end , and [he]2282-the man gave [them]325-the others , out of [his]2282-the man own free generousness , a large piece of putty and a small piece of glue . While [they]325-the others were out [the girls]311-the girls had floated four photographs of [the four children]309-the four children off [their]309-the four children cards in hot water . These were now stuck in a row along the top of the cardboard . [Cyril]131-cyril put the glue to melt in a jampot , and put the jampot in a saucepan and saucepan on the fire , while [Robert]132-robert painted a wreath of poppies round the photographs . [He]2282-the man painted rather well and very quickly , and poppies are easy to do if [you]3766-you ’ve once been shown how . Then [Anthea]133-anthea drew some printed letters and [Jane]134-jane coloured them . The words were : And when the painting was dry [they]325-the others all signed [their]325-the others names at the bottom and put the glass on , and glued brown paper round the edge and over the back , and put two loops of tape to hang it up by . Of course [every one]2347-every one saw when too late that there were not enough letters in “[1738-we] things , ” so the missing “[1738-we] n ” was put in . It was impossible , of course , to do the whole thing over again for just one letter . “[1738-we] There ! ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , placing it carefully , face up , under the sofa . “[1738-we] It ’ll be hours before the glue ’s dry . Now , [Squirrel]215-squirrel , fire ahead ! ” “[215-squirrel] Well , then , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril in a great hurry , rubbing at [his]131-cyril gluey hands with [his]131-cyril pocket handkerchief . “[215-squirrel] What [I]0-i mean to say is this . ” There was a long pause . “[0-i] Well , ” said [Robert]132-robert at last , “[0-i] what is it that [you]0-i mean to say ? ” “[0-i] It ’s like this , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , and again stopped short . “[0-i] Like what ? ” asked [Jane]134-jane . “[0-i] How can [I]0-i tell [you]0-i if [you]0-i will all keep on interrupting ? ” said [Cyril]131-cyril sharply . So [no one]344-no one said any more , and with wrinkled frowns [he]0-i arranged [his]0-i ideas . “[0-i] Look here , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] what [I]0-i really mean is — [we]1741-we can remember now what [we]1741-we did when [we]1741-we went to look for the Amulet . And if [we]1741-we ’d found it [we]1741-we should remember that too . ” “[1741-we] Rather ! ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[1741-we] Only , [you]0-i see [we]1741-we have n’t . ” “[1741-we] But in the future [we]1741-we shall have . ” “[1741-we] Shall [we]1741-we , though ? ” said [Jane]134-jane . “[1741-we] Yes — unless [we]1741-we ’ve been made fools of by [the Psammead]136-the psammead .
