Let ’s go into that time — and then [we]1741-we shall remember how [we]1741-we found it . And then [we]1741-we can go back and do the finding really . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i see , ” said [Robert]132-robert , and this time [he]132-robert did , and [I]0-i hope [you]215-squirrel do . “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] Oh , [Squirrel]215-squirrel , how clever of [you]215-squirrel ! ” “[215-squirrel] But will the Amulet work both ways ? ” inquired [Robert]132-robert . “[215-squirrel] It ought to , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[215-squirrel] if time ’s only a thingummy of whatsitsname . Anyway [we]1741-we might try . ” “[215-squirrel] Let ’s put on [our]1741-we best things , then , ” urged [Jane]134-jane . “[215-squirrel] [You]215-squirrel know what [people]280-people say about progress and [the world]294-the world growing better and brighter . [I]0-i expect [people]280-people will be awfully smart in the future . ” “[0-i] All right , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , “[0-i] [we]1741-we should have to wash anyway , [I]0-i ’m all thick with glue . ” When [every one]2347-every one was clean and dressed , the charm was held up . “[1741-we] [We]1741-we want to go into the future and see the Amulet after [we]1741-we ’ve found it , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , and [Jane]134-jane said the word of Power . [They]1741-we walked through the big arch of the charm straight into [the British Museum]101-the british museum . [They]1741-we knew it at once , and there , right in front of [them]1741-we , under a glass case , was the Amulet — [their]1741-we own half of it , as well as the other half [they]1741-we had never been able to find — and [the two]3771-the two were joined by a pin of red stone that formed a hinge . “[1741-we] Oh , glorious ! ” cried [Robert]132-robert . “[1741-we] Here it is ! ” “[1741-we] Yes , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , very gloomily , “[1741-we] here it is . But [we]1741-we ca n’t get it out . ” “[1741-we] No , ” said [Robert]132-robert , remembering how impossible [the Queen of [Babylon]40-babylon]2869-the queen of babylon had found it to get anything out of the glass cases in [the Museum]1108-the museum — except by Psammead magic , and then [she]2869-the queen of babylon had n’t been able to take anything away with [her]2869-the queen of babylon ; “[1741-we] no — but [we]1741-we remember where [we]1741-we got it , and [we]1741-we can — ” “[1741-we] Oh , do [we]1741-we ? ” interrupted [Cyril]131-cyril bitterly , “[1741-we] do [you]1741-we remember where [we]1741-we got it ? ” “[1741-we] No , ” said [Robert]132-robert , “[1741-we] [I]0-i do n’t exactly , now [I]0-i come to think of it . ” Nor did [any of [the others]325-the others]3774-any of the others ! “[0-i] But why ca n’t [we]1741-we ? ” said [Jane]134-jane . “[1741-we] Oh , [I]0-i do n’t know , ” [Cyril]131-cyril ’s tone was impatient , “[0-i] some silly old enchanted rule [I]0-i suppose . [I]0-i wish [people]280-people would teach [you]1746-you magic at [school]3006-school like [they]280-people do sums — or instead of . It would be some use having an Amulet then . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder how far [we]1741-we are in the future , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea ; [the Museum]1108-the museum looks just the same , only lighter and brighter , somehow . ”[0-i] “ Let ’s go back and try the Past again , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ Perhaps [the Museum people]3777-the museum people could tell [us]1741-we how [we]1741-we got it , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea with sudden hope . There was [no one]344-no one in [the room]2349-the room , but in [the next gallery]1750-the next gallery , where the Assyrian things are and still were , [they]1741-we found [a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs]1751-a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs . “ Oh , [they]1741-we ’ve got a new uniform , how pretty ! ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . When [they]1741-we asked [him]1751-a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs [their]1741-we question [he]1751-a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs showed [them]1741-we a label on the case . [It]1752-it said , “ From the collection of—. ”[1752-it] A name followed , and it was the name of [the learned gentleman who , among [themselves]1741-we , and to [his]1751-a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs face when [he]1751-a kind , stout man in a loose , blue gown , and stockinged legs had been with [them]1741-we at the other side of the Amulet]1753-the learned gentleman who , among themselves , and to his face when he had been with them at the other side of the amulet , [they]1741-we had called [Jimmy]219-jimmy . “ That ’s not much good , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ thank [you]131-cyril . ”[131-cyril] “ How is it [you]131-cyril ’re not at [school]3006-school ? ”[1754-the kind man in blue] asked [the kind man in blue]1754-the kind man in blue . “ Not expelled for long [I]1754-the kind man in blue hope ? ”[1754-the kind man in blue] “ [We]1741-we ’re not expelled at all , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril rather warmly . “ Well , [I]2282-the man should n’t do it again , if [I]2282-the man were [you]131-cyril , ”[2282-the man] said [the man]2282-the man , and [they]1741-we could see [he]2282-the man did not believe [them]1741-we . There is no company so little pleasing as that of [people who do not believe [you]1757-you]1756-people who do not believe you . “ Thank [you]131-cyril for showing [us]1741-we the label , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . And [they]1741-we came away . As [they]1741-we came through the doors of [the Museum]1108-the museum [they]1741-we blinked at the sudden glory of sunlight and blue sky . [The houses opposite the Museum]1759-the houses opposite the museum were gone . Instead there was [a big garden]1760-a big garden , with trees and flowers and smooth green lawns , and not a single notice to tell [you]1757-you not to walk on the grass and not to destroy the trees and shrubs and not to pick the flowers . There were comfortable seats all about , and [arbours covered with roses]1761-arbours covered with roses , and long , trellised walks , also rose‐covered . Whispering , splashing fountains fell into full white marble basins , white statues gleamed among the leaves , and the pigeons that swept about among the branches or pecked on the smooth , soft gravel were not black and tumbled like the Museum pigeons are now , but bright and clean and sleek as birds of new silver . [A good many people]1762-a good many people were sitting on the seats , and on the grass [babies]495-babies were rolling and kicking and playing — with very little on indeed . [Men]2526-men , as well as [women]2450-women , seemed to be in charge of [the babies]1766-the babies and were playing with [them]1766-the babies . “ It ’s like a lovely picture , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , and it was . For [the people]2548-the people ’s clothes were of bright , soft colours and all beautifully and very simply made . [No one]344-no one seemed to have any hats or bonnets , but there were a great many Japanese‐looking sunshades . And among the trees were hung lamps of coloured glass . “ [I]134-jane expect [they]278-the children light those in the evening , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ [I]134-jane do wish [we]1741-we lived in the future ! ”[134-jane] [They]1741-we walked down [the path]2509-the path , and as [they]1741-we went [the people on the benches]1770-the people on the benches looked at [the four children]309-the four children very curiously , but not rudely or unkindly . [The children]278-the children , in [their]278-the children turn , looked — [I]0-i hope [they]278-the children did not stare — at the faces of [these people in the beautiful soft clothes]1773-these people in the beautiful soft clothes . Those faces were worth looking at . Not that [they]309-the four children were all handsome , though even in the matter of handsomeness [they]309-the four children had the advantage of [any set of people [the children]278-the children had ever seen]1774-any set of people the children had ever seen . But it was the expression of [their]309-the four children faces that made [them]309-the four children worth looking at . [The children]278-the children could not tell at first what it was . “ [I]133-anthea know , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea suddenly . “ [They]2548-the people ’re not worried ; that ’s what it is . ”[133-anthea] And it was . [Everybody]2317-everybody looked calm , [no one]344-no one seemed to be in a hurry , [no one]344-no one seemed to be anxious , or fretted , and though [some]829-some did seem to be sad , [not a single one]1781-not a single one looked worried . But though [the people]2548-the people looked kind [every one]2347-every one looked so interested in [the children]278-the children that [they]278-the children began to feel a little shy and turned out of [the big main path]1785-the big main path into [a narrow little one that wound among trees and shrubs and [mossy , dripping springs]1787-mossy , dripping springs]1786-a narrow little one that wound among trees and shrubs and mossy , dripping springs . It was here , in a deep , shadowed cleft between tall cypresses , that [they]278-the children found [the expelled little boy]1788-the expelled little boy . [He]1788-the expelled little boy was lying face downward on the mossy turf , and the peculiar shaking of [his]1788-the expelled little boy shoulders was a thing [they]278-the children had seen , more than once , in each other . So [Anthea]133-anthea kneeled down by [him]1788-the expelled little boy and said — “ What ’s the matter ? ”[133-anthea] “ [I]2860-the boy ’m expelled from [school]3006-school , ”[2860-the boy] said [the boy]2860-the boy between [his]2860-the boy sobs . This was serious . [People]280-people are not expelled for light offences . “ Do [you]133-anthea mind telling [us]278-the children what [you]133-anthea ’d done ? ”[133-anthea] “ [I]1384-the child — [I]1384-the child tore up a sheet of paper and threw it about in [the playground]3780-the playground , ”[1384-the child] said [the child]1384-the child , in the tone of one confessing an unutterable baseness . “ [You]133-anthea wo n’t talk to [me]1384-the child any more now [you]133-anthea know that , ”[1384-the child] [he]1384-the child added without looking up . “ Was that all ? ”[133-anthea] asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “ It ’s about enough , ”[1384-the child] said [the child]1384-the child ; “ and [I]1384-the child ’m expelled for the whole day ! ”[1384-the child] “ [I]133-anthea do n’t quite understand , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , gently . [The boy]2860-the boy lifted [his]2860-the boy face , rolled over , and sat up . “ Why , whoever on earth are [you]2860-the boy ? ”[2860-the boy] [he]2860-the boy said . “ [We]3781-we ’re strangers from [a far country]3782-a far country , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ In [[our]3781-we country]939-our country it ’s not a crime to leave a bit of paper about . ”[133-anthea] “ It is here , ”[1384-the child] said [the child]1384-the child . “ If [grown‐ups]3784-grown‐ups do it [they]3784-grown‐ups ’re fined . When [we]3781-we do it [we]3781-we ’re expelled for the whole day . ”[1384-the child] “ Well , but , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ that just means a day ’s holiday . ”[132-robert] “ [You]2860-the boy must come from a long way off , ”[1795-the little boy] said [the little boy]1795-the little boy . “ A holiday ’s when [you]2860-the boy all have play and treats and jolliness , all of [you]2860-the boy together . On [your]2860-the boy expelled days [no one’ll]3785-no one’ll speak to [you]2860-the boy . [Every one]2347-every one sees [you]2860-the boy ’re [an Expelleder]3787-an expelleder or [you]2860-the boy ’d be in [school]3006-school . ”[1795-the little boy] “ Suppose [you]1384-the child were ill ? ”[1384-the child] “ [Nobody]2255-nobody is — hardly . If [they]2255-nobody are , of course [they]2255-nobody wear the badge , and [every one]2347-every one is kind to [you]2860-the boy . [I]1384-the child know [a boy that stole [[his]3791-a boy that stole his sister ’s illness badge and wore it when he was expelled for a day sister]961-his sister ’s illness badge and wore it when [he]3791-a boy that stole his sister ’s illness badge and wore it when he was expelled for a day was expelled for a day]3791-a boy that stole his sister ’s illness badge and wore it when he was expelled for a day . [He]3791-a boy that stole his sister ’s illness badge and wore it when he was expelled for a day got expelled for a week for that . It must be awful not to go to [school]3006-school for a week . ”[1384-the child] “ Do [you]1384-the child like [school]3006-school , then ? ”[132-robert] asked [Robert]132-robert incredulously . “ Of course [I]132-robert do . It ’s [the loveliest place there is]3795-the loveliest place there is . [I]132-robert chose railways for [my]132-robert special subject this year , there are such splendid models and things , and now [I]132-robert shall be all behind because of that torn‐up paper . ”[132-robert] “ [You]131-cyril choose [your]131-cyril own subject ? ”[131-cyril] asked [Cyril]131-cyril . “ Yes , of course . Where did [you]131-cyril come from ? Do n’t [you]131-cyril know anything ? ”[131-cyril] “ No , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane definitely ; “ so [you]131-cyril ’d better tell [us]3796-us . ”[134-jane] “ Well , on Midsummer Day [school]3006-school breaks up and everything ’s decorated with flowers , and [you]131-cyril choose [your]131-cyril special subject for next year . Of course [you]131-cyril have to stick to it for a year at least . Then there are all [your]131-cyril other subjects , of course , reading , and painting , and the rules of Citizenship . ”[131-cyril] “ Good gracious ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ Look here , ”[1384-the child] said [the child]1384-the child , jumping up , “ it ’s nearly four . The expelledness only lasts till then . Come [home]357-home with [me]1384-the child . [Mother]138-mother will tell [you]131-cyril all about everything . ”[1384-the child] “ Will [[your]131-cyril mother]2415-your mother like [you]131-cyril taking [home]357-home [strange children]3801-strange children ? ”[133-anthea] asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [I]1384-the child do n’t understand , ”[1384-the child] said [the child]1384-the child , settling [his]1384-the child leather belt over [his]1384-the child honey‐coloured smock and stepping out with hard little bare feet . “ Come on . ”[1384-the child] So [they]1798-them went . [The streets]3286-the streets were wide and hard and very clean . There were no horses , but [a sort of motor carriage]1800-a sort of motor carriage that made no noise . [The Thames]102-the thames flowed between green banks , and there were trees at the edge , and [people]280-people sat under [them]1802-them , fishing , for [the stream]2476-the stream was clear as crystal . Everywhere there were green trees and there was no smoke . [The houses]828-the houses were set in what seemed like [one green garden]1805-one green garden . [The little boy]1795-the little boy brought [them]1798-them to [a house]1548-a house , and at the window was [a good , bright mother‐face]1808-a good , bright mother‐face . [The little boy]1795-the little boy rushed in , and through the window [they]1798-them could see [him]1795-the little boy hugging [[his]1795-the little boy mother]1810-his mother , then [his]1795-the little boy eager lips moving and [his]1795-the little boy quick hands pointing . [A lady in soft green clothes]1811-a lady in soft green clothes came out , spoke kindly to [them]1798-them , and took [them]1798-them into [the oddest house [they]1798-them had ever seen]1812-the oddest house they had ever seen . [It]1812-the oddest house they had ever seen was very bare , there were no ornaments , and yet every single thing was beautiful , from the dresser with [its]1813-its rows of bright china , to the thick squares of Eastern‐looking carpet on the floors . [I]0-i ca n’t describe [that house]1814-that house ; [I]0-i have n’t the time . And [I]0-i have n’t heart either , when [I]0-i think how different [it]1812-the oddest house they had ever seen was from [[our]1815-our houses]1816-our houses . [The lady]1074-the lady took [them]1798-them all over [it]1812-the oddest house they had ever seen . The oddest thing of all was [the big room in the middle]1818-the big room in the middle . [It]1818-the big room in the middle had padded walls and a soft , thick carpet , and all the chairs and tables were padded . There was n’t a single thing in it that [anyone]283-anyone could hurt [itself]283-anyone with . “ What ever ’s this [for?—lunatics]3802-for?—lunatics ? ”[131-cyril] asked [Cyril]131-cyril . [The lady]1074-the lady looked very shocked . “ No ! It ’s for [the children]278-the children , of course , ”[1074-the lady] [she]1074-the lady said . “ Do n’t tell [me]1074-the lady that in [[your]131-cyril country]1047-your country there are [[no children]3805-no children ’s rooms]3806-no children ’s rooms . ”[1074-the lady] “ There are [nurseries]3807-nurseries , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea doubtfully , “ but the furniture ’s all cornery and hard , like [other rooms]3808-other rooms . ”[133-anthea] “ How shocking ! ”[1074-the lady] said [the lady]1074-the lady ; “ [you]131-cyril must be very much behind the times in [[your]131-cyril country]1047-your country ! Why , [the children]278-the children are [more than half of [the people]2548-the people]3811-more than half of the people ; it ’s not much to have [one room where [they]278-the children can have a good time and not hurt [themselves]278-the children]3813-one room where they can have a good time and not hurt themselves . ”[1074-the lady] “ But there ’s no fireplace , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ Hot‐air pipes , of course , ”[1074-the lady] said [the lady]1074-the lady . “ Why , how could [you]131-cyril have a fire in [a nursery]3814-a nursery ? [They]1473-a child might hurt [themselves]1473-a child . ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert fingered the scar on [his]132-robert forehead where [he]132-robert had hit it against the nursery fender when [he]132-robert was little . “ But does every one have [rooms like this]3818-rooms like this , [poor people]1174-poor people and all ? ”[133-anthea] asked [Anthea]133-anthea . “ There ’s [a room like this]3820-a room like this wherever there ’s [a child]1473-a child , of course , ”[1074-the lady] said [the lady]1074-the lady . “ How refreshingly ignorant [you]131-cyril are!—no , [I]1074-the lady do n’t mean ignorant , [[my]1074-the lady dear]533-my dear . Get it out , [Squirrel]215-squirrel . ” [The glazed testimonial]3873-the glazed testimonial was dragged out from under the sofa and displayed . “[215-squirrel] The glue ’s not dry yet , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[215-squirrel] look out ! ” “[215-squirrel] What a beauty ! ” cried [old Nurse]305-old nurse . “[215-squirrel] Well , [I]0-i never ! And [your]131-cyril pictures and the beautiful writing and all . Well , [I]0-i always did say [your]131-cyril hearts was in the right place , if a bit careless at times . Well ! [I]0-i never did ! [I]0-i do n’t know as [I]0-i was ever pleased better in [my]0-i life . ” [She]305-old nurse hugged [them]3875-them all , one after the other . And [the boys]313-the boys did not mind it , somehow , that day . “[0-i] How is it [we]1878-we can remember all about the future , now ? ” [Anthea]133-anthea woke [the Psammead]136-the psammead with laborious gentleness to put the question . “[0-i] How is it [we]1878-we can remember what [we]1878-we saw in the future , and yet , when [we]1878-we were in the future , [we]1878-we could not remember the bit of the future that was past then , the time of finding [the Amulet]166-the amulet ? ” “[0-i] Why , what a silly question ! ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead , “[131-cyril] of course [you]131-cyril can not remember what has n’t happened yet . ” “[131-cyril] But the future has n’t happened yet , ” [Anthea]133-anthea persisted , “[131-cyril] and [we]1878-we remember that all right . ” “[131-cyril] Oh , that is n’t what ’s happened , [[my]0-i good child]1133-my good child , ” said [the Psammead]136-the psammead , rather crossly , “[1133-my good child] that ’s prophetic vision . And [you]131-cyril remember dreams , do n’t [you]131-cyril ? So why not visions ? [You]131-cyril never do seem to understand the simplest thing . ” [It]3877-it went to sand again at once . [Anthea]133-anthea crept down in [her]133-anthea nightgown to give one last kiss to [old Nurse]142-old nurse , and one last look at the beautiful testimonial hanging , by its tapes , its glue now firmly set , in glazed glory on the wall of [the kitchen]3878-the kitchen . “[131-cyril] Good‐night , bless [your]131-cyril loving heart , ” said [old Nurse]142-old nurse , “[131-cyril] if only [you]131-cyril do n’t catch [your]131-cyril deathercold ! ” “[0-i] BLUE and red , ” said [Jane]134-jane softly , “[0-i] make purple . ” “[0-i] Not always they do n’t , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[0-i] it has to be [crimson lake]1880-crimson lake and Prussian blue . If [you]131-cyril mix Vermilion and [Indigo]250-indigo [you]131-cyril get the most loathsome slate colour . ” “[251-sepia] [Sepia]251-sepia ’s the nastiest colour in the box , [I]0-i think , ” said [Jane]134-jane , sucking [her]134-jane brush . [They]3879-they were all painting . [Nurse]142-old nurse in the flush of grateful emotion , excited by [Robert]132-robert ’s border of poppies , had presented each of the four with a shilling paint‐box , and had supplemented the gift with a pile of old copies of the Illustrated London News . “[251-sepia] [Sepia]251-sepia , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril instructively , “[251-sepia] is made out of beastly cuttle‐fish . ” “[251-sepia] Purple ’s made out of a fish , as well as out of red and blue , ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[251-sepia] Tyrian purple was , [I]0-i know . ” “[251-sepia] Out of lobsters ? ” said [Jane]134-jane dreamily . “[251-sepia] they ’re red when [they]1881-they ’re boiled , and blue when they are n’t . If [you]131-cyril mixed live and dead lobsters [you]131-cyril ’d get Tyrian purple . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should n’t like to mix anything with a live lobster , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea , shuddering . “[0-i] Well , there are n’t any other red and blue fish , ” said [Jane]134-jane ; “[0-i] [you]131-cyril ’d have to . ” “[131-cyril] [I]0-i ’d rather not have the purple , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea . “[0-i] The Tyrian purple was n’t that colour when it came out of the fish , nor yet afterwards , it was n’t , ” said [Robert]132-robert ; “[0-i] it was scarlet really , and [Roman Emperors]252-roman emperors wore it . And it was n’t any nice colour while the fish had it . It was a yellowish‐white liquid of a creamy consistency . ” “[1882-you] How do [you]1882-you know ? ” asked [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1882-you] [I]0-i read it , ” said [Robert]132-robert , with the meek pride of superior knowledge . “[0-i] Where ? ” asked [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1882-you] In print , ” said [Robert]132-robert , still more proudly meek . “[1882-you] [You]131-cyril think everything ’s true if it ’s printed , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , naturally annoyed , “[131-cyril] but it is n’t . [Father]137-father said so . Quite a lot of lies get printed , especially in newspapers . ” “[137-father] [You]131-cyril see , as it happens , ” said [Robert]132-robert , in what was really a rather annoying tone , “[137-father] it was n’t a newspaper , it was in a book . ” “[137-father] How sweet Chinese white is ! ” said [Jane]134-jane , dreamily sucking [her]134-jane brush again . “[137-father] [I]0-i do n’t believe it , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril to [Robert]132-robert . “[0-i] Have a suck [yourself]131-cyril , ” suggested [Robert]132-robert . “[131-cyril] [I]0-i do n’t mean about the Chinese white . [I]0-i mean about the cream fish turning purple and — ” “[0-i] Oh ! ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea , jumping up very quickly , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m tired of painting . Let ’s go somewhere by [Amulet]166-the amulet . [I]0-i say let ’s let it choose . ” [Cyril]131-cyril and [Robert]132-robert agreed that this was an idea . [Jane]134-jane consented to stop painting because , as [she]134-jane said , Chinese white , though certainly sweet , gives [you]1884-you a queer feeling in the back of the throat if [you]1884-you paint with it too long . The Amulet was held up . “[0-i] Take [us]1883-us somewhere , ” said [Jane]134-jane , “[0-i] anywhere [you]1884-you like in [the Past]20-the past — but somewhere where [you]1884-you are . ” Then [she]134-jane said the word . Next moment [every one]2347-every one felt a queer rocking and swaying — something like what [you]1884-you feel when [you]1884-you go out in [a fishing boat]3881-a fishing boat . And that was not wonderful , when [you]1884-you come to think of it , for it was in [a boat]3752-a boat that [they]1883-us found [themselves]1883-us . [A queer boat]3883-a queer boat , with high bulwarks pierced with holes for oars to go through . There was a high seat for [the steersman]3884-the steersman , and the prow was shaped like the head of some great animal with big , staring eyes . [The boat]3885-the boat rode at anchor in [a bay]3886-a bay , and [the bay]3887-the bay was very smooth . [The crew]3888-the crew were [dark , wiry fellows with black beards and hair]3889-dark , wiry fellows with black beards and hair . [They]3888-the crew had no clothes except a tunic from waist to knee , and round caps with knobs on the top . [They]3888-the crew were very busy , and what [they]3888-the crew were doing was so interesting to [the children]278-the children that at first [they]278-the children did not even wonder where the Amulet had brought [them]278-the children . And [the crew]3888-the crew seemed too busy to notice [the children]278-the children . [They]3888-the crew were fastening rush baskets to a long rope with a great piece of cork at the end , and in each basket [they]3888-the crew put mussels or little frogs . Then [they]3888-the crew cast out the rope , the baskets sank , but the cork floated . And all about on [the blue water]3893-the blue water were [other boats]3894-other boats and [all the crews of all [the boats]3896-the boats]3895-all the crews of all the boats were busy with ropes and baskets and frogs and mussels . “[1884-you] Whatever are [you]1885-you doing ? ” [Jane]134-jane suddenly asked [a man who had rather more clothes than [the others]325-the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer]3897-a man who had rather more clothes than the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer . [He]3897-a man who had rather more clothes than the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer started and stared at [her]134-jane , but [he]3897-a man who had rather more clothes than the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer had seen too many strange lands to be very much surprised at [these queerly‐dressed stowaways]3899-these queerly‐dressed stowaways . “[1885-you] Setting lines for the dye shell‐fish , ” [he]3897-a man who had rather more clothes than the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer said shortly . “[1885-you] How did [you]1885-you get [here]2247-here ? ” “[1885-you] A sort of magic , ” said [Robert]132-robert carelessly . [The Captain]810-the captain fingered an Amulet that hung round [his]3897-a man who had rather more clothes than the others , and seemed to be a sort of captain or overseer neck . “[1885-you] What is [this place]1887-this place ? ” asked [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1885-you] [Tyre]103-tyre , of course , ” said [the man]2282-the man . Then [he]2282-the man drew back and spoke in a low voice to [one of [the sailors]3903-the sailors]3902-one of the sailors . “[1885-you] Now [we]1888-we shall know about [your]1885-you precious cream‐jug fish , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril . “[1888-we] But [we]1888-we never said come to [Tyre]103-tyre , ” said [Jane]134-jane . “[1888-we] [The Amulet]166-the amulet heard [us]1888-we talking , [I]0-i expect . [I]0-i wonder which of [them]1890-them ’s got it . ” “[1890-them] Oh — look , look ! ” cried [Anthea]133-anthea suddenly . On the bare breast of [one of [the sailors]3903-the sailors]3902-one of the sailors gleamed something red . It was the exact counterpart of [their]1888-we precious half‐Amulet . A silence , full of emotion , was broken by [Jane]134-jane . “[1890-them] Then [we]1888-we ’ve found it ! ” [she]134-jane said . “[1890-them] Oh do let ’s take it and go [home]357-home ! ” “[1890-them] Easy to say ‘ take it ’ ” said [Cyril]131-cyril ; “[1892-he] [he]1892-he looks very strong . ” [He]1892-he did — yet not so strong as [the other sailors]3906-the other sailors . “[1892-he] It ’s odd , ” said [Anthea]133-anthea musingly , “[0-i] [I]0-i do believe [I]0-i ’ve seen [that man]431-that man somewhere before . ” “[431-that man] [He]431-that man ’s rather like [[our]1888-we learned gentleman]1894-our learned gentleman , ” said [Robert]132-robert , “[431-that man] but [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]1895-you who [he]431-that man ’s much more like — ” At that moment [that sailor]3907-that sailor looked up . [His]3907-that sailor eyes met [Robert’s]253-robert’s — and [Robert]132-robert and [the others]325-the others had no longer any doubt as to where [they]1888-we had seen [him]3907-that sailor before . [It]3907-that sailor was [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , [the priest who had led [them]1888-we to [the palace of [Pharaoh]239-pharaoh]3910-the palace of pharaoh — and whom [Jane]134-jane had looked back at through the arch , when [he]243-rekh‐marā was counselling [[Pharaoh]3911-pharaoh ’s guard]3912-pharaoh ’s guard to take the jewels and fly for [his]243-rekh‐marā life]3909-the priest who had led them to the palace of pharaoh — and whom jane had looked back at through the arch , when he was counselling pharaoh ’s guard to take the jewels and fly for his life . [Nobody]2255-nobody was quite pleased , and [nobody]2255-nobody quite knew why . [Jane]134-jane voiced the feelings of all when [she]134-jane said , fingering [their]1888-we Amulet through the folds of [her]134-jane frock , “[431-that man] [We]1896-we can go back in a minute if anything nasty happens . ” For the moment nothing worse happened than an offer of food — figs and cucumbers it was , and very pleasant . “[431-that man] [I]0-i see , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain , “[431-that man] that [you]1897-you are from [a far country]3782-a far country . Then [I]0-i will lead [you]1897-you to [one of [[our]1896-we great ones]1902-our great ones]1901-one of our great ones . [He]1901-one of our great ones loves [strangers]1269-strangers from [far lands]1904-far lands . ” “[1901-one of our great ones] Let ’s go [home]357-home , ” [Jane]134-jane whispered , “[1901-one of our great ones] all the frogs are drowning now . [I]0-i think [the people here]1906-the people here are cruel . ” But [the boys]313-the boys wanted to stay and see the lines taken up in the morning . “[0-i] It ’s just like eel‐pots and lobster‐pots , ” said [Cyril]131-cyril , “[0-i] the baskets only open from outside — [I]0-i vote [we]1896-we stay . ” So [they]313-the boys stayed . “[0-i] That ’s [Tyre]103-tyre over there , ” said [the Captain , who was evidently trying to be civil]3917-the captain , who was evidently trying to be civil . [He]3917-the captain , who was evidently trying to be civil pointed to [a great island rock]3918-a great island rock , that rose steeply from [the sea]2414-the sea , crowned with huge walls and towers . There was [another city]3920-another city on [the mainland]3921-the mainland . “[0-i] [That ’s part of [Tyre]103-tyre]1907-that ’s part of tyre , too , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain ; “[0-i] it ’s where [the great merchants]1908-the great merchants have [[their]1908-the great merchants pleasure‐houses and [gardens]2780-gardens and [farms]1911-farms]1909-their pleasure‐houses and gardens and farms . ” “[1908-the great merchants] Look , look ! ” [Cyril]131-cyril cried suddenly ; “[1908-the great merchants] what a lovely little ship ! ” [A ship in full sail]3923-a ship in full sail was passing swiftly through [the fishing fleet]3924-the fishing fleet . [The Captain]810-the captain ’s face changed . [He]810-the captain frowned , and [his]810-the captain eyes blazed with fury . “[1912-insolent young barbarian] [Insolent young barbarian]1912-insolent young barbarian ! ” [he]810-the captain cried . “[1912-insolent young barbarian] Do [you]1913-you call the ships of [Tyre]103-tyre little ? None greater sail [the seas]1914-the seas . [That ship]1915-that ship has been on a three years ’ voyage . [[Your]1913-you wife]1921-your wife might call [you]1913-you [[her]1921-your wife dear little husband]1922-her dear little husband , [you]1913-you know . ” “[1922-her dear little husband] [I]0-i should like to catch [her]1915-that ship at it , ” growled [the Captain]810-the captain , but [he]810-the captain stopped scowling . “[0-i] It ’s a rich trade , ” [he]810-the captain went on . “[1915-that ship] For cloth once dipped , second‐best glass , and the rough images [[our]1918-we young artists]1923-our young artists carve for practice , [the barbarian King in [Tessos]105-tessos]1924-the barbarian king in tessos lets [us]1918-we work [the silver mines]1925-the silver mines . [We]1918-we get so much silver there that [we]1918-we leave [them]1926-them [our]1918-we iron anchors and come back with silver ones . ” “[1927-barbarians from the outer darkness] How splendid ! ” said [Robert]132-robert . “[1927-barbarians from the outer darkness] Do go on . What ’s cloth once dipped ? ” “[1913-you] [You]1913-you must be [barbarians from the outer darkness]1927-barbarians from the outer darkness , ” said [the Captain]810-the captain scornfully . “[1913-you] [All wealthy nations]1928-all wealthy nations know that [our]1918-we finest stuffs are twice dyed — dibaptha . [[Our]1918-we merchants]1934-our merchants are [princes]1931-princes , ” scowled [the skipper]3928-the skipper . “[1931-princes] Oh , do n’t be cross , [we]1918-we do so like hearing about things . Well , [you]1913-you wo n’t get the secrets of the dye trade out of [me]0-i . ” [He]2282-the man went away , and [every one]2347-every one felt snubbed and uncomfortable . And all the time the long , narrow eyes of [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian were watching , watching . [They]2347-every one felt as though [he]2282-the man was watching [them]2347-every one through the darkness , when [they]2347-every one lay down to sleep on a pile of cloaks . Next morning the baskets were drawn up full of what looked like whelk shells . [The children]278-the children were rather in the way , but [they]278-the children made [themselves]278-the children as small as [they]278-the children could . It ’s a sort of murex — and there ’s another kind that [they]1936-they catch at [Sidon]106-sidon — and then , of course , there ’s the kind that ’s used for the dibaptha . But that ’s quite different . It ’s — ” “[1913-you] Hold [your]1937-your tongue ! ” shouted [the skipper]3928-the skipper . And [the man]2282-the man held it . [The laden boat]3939-the laden boat was rowed slowly round [the end of [the island]1372-the island]3940-the end of the island , and was made fast in [one of [the two great harbours that lay inside [a long breakwater]3944-a long breakwater]3943-the two great harbours that lay inside a long breakwater]3942-one of the two great harbours that lay inside a long breakwater . [The harbour]3945-the harbour was full of all sorts of [ships]3946-ships , so that [Cyril]131-cyril and [Robert]132-robert enjoyed [themselves]131-cyril much more than [[their]3947-their sisters]3948-their sisters . [The breakwater]3949-the breakwater and [the quays]3389-the quays were heaped with bales and baskets , and crowded with [slaves]2875-slaves and [sailors]2552-sailors . Farther along [some men]3953-some men were practising diving . “[1913-you] That ’s jolly good , ” said [Robert]132-robert , as a naked brown body cleft the water . “[0-i] [I]0-i should think so , ” said [the skipper]3928-the skipper . “[0-i] [The pearl‐divers of [Persia]107-persia]1938-the pearl‐divers of persia are not more skilful . Why , [we]1939-we ’ve got a fresh‐water spring that comes out at [the bottom of [the sea]2414-the sea]1940-the bottom of the sea . [[Our]1939-we divers]1942-our divers dive down and bring up the fresh water in skin bottles ! Can [[your]1939-we barbarian divers]1943-your barbarian divers do as much ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose not , ” said [Robert]132-robert , and put away a wild desire to explain to [the Captain]810-the captain the English system of [waterworks]3956-waterworks , pipes , taps , and the intricacies of [the plumbers]3957-the plumbers ’ trade . As [they]1939-we neared [the quay]3239-the quay [the skipper]3928-the skipper made a hasty toilet . [He]3928-the skipper did [his]3928-the skipper hair , combed [his]3928-the skipper beard , put on a garment like a jersey with short sleeves , an embroidered belt , a necklace of beads , and a big signet ring . “[0-i] Now , ” said [he]3928-the skipper , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m fit to be seen . Come along ? ” “[3928-the skipper] Where to ? ” said [Jane]134-jane cautiously . “[3928-the skipper] To [Pheles]254-pheles , [the great sea‐captain]1944-the great sea‐captain , said [the skipper]3928-the skipper , “ [the man [I]3928-the skipper told [you]134-jane of]3960-the man i told you of , who loves [barbarians]3558-barbarians . ”[3928-the skipper] Then [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā came forward , and , for the first time , spoke . “ [I]243-rekh‐marā have known [these children]2807-these children in [another land]3963-another land , ”[243-rekh‐marā] [he]243-rekh‐marā said . “ [You]134-jane know [my]243-rekh‐marā powers of magic .
