And [you]134-jane know how [they]3964-these barbarians will profit [you]134-jane . [I]243-rekh‐marā read [your]134-jane thoughts . Let [me]243-rekh‐marā come with [you]134-jane and see the end of [them]3964-these barbarians , and then [I]243-rekh‐marā will work the spell [I]243-rekh‐marā promised [you]134-jane in return for the little experience [you]134-jane have so kindly given [me]243-rekh‐marā on [[your]134-jane boat]3965-your boat . ”[243-rekh‐marā] [The skipper]3928-the skipper looked at [the Egyptian]255-the egyptian with some disfavour . “ So it was [your]132-robert doing , ”[3928-the skipper] [he]3928-the skipper said . “ [I]3928-the skipper might have guessed it . Well , come on . ”[3928-the skipper] So [he]3928-the skipper came , and [the girls]311-the girls wished [he]3928-the skipper had n’t . But [Robert]132-robert whispered — “ Nonsense — as long as [he]3928-the skipper ’s with [us]311-the girls [we]311-the girls ’ve got some chance of the Amulet . [We]311-the girls can always fly if anything goes wrong . ”[132-robert] The morning was so fresh and bright ; [their]311-the girls breakfast had been so good and so unusual ; [they]311-the girls had actually seen the Amulet round [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian ’s neck . One or two , or all these things , suddenly raised [the children]278-the children ’s spirits . [They]311-the girls went off quite cheerfully through the city gate — [it]1950-it was not arched , but roofed over with a great flat stone — and so through [the street]481-the street , which smelt horribly of fish and garlic and a thousand other things even less agreeable . But far worse than the street scents was the scent of [the factory]1952-the factory , where [the skipper]3928-the skipper called in to sell [his]3928-the skipper night ’s catch . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could tell [you]1954-you all about [that factory]1955-that factory , but [I]0-i have n’t time , and perhaps after all [you]1954-you are n’t interested in dyeing works . [I]0-i will only mention that [Robert]132-robert was triumphantly proved to be right . The dye was a yellowish‐white liquid of a creamy consistency , and it smelt more strongly of garlic than garlic itself does . While [the skipper]3928-the skipper was bargaining with [the master of the dye works]1957-the master of the dye works [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian came close to [the children]278-the children , and said , suddenly and softly — “ Trust [me]1304-the egyptian . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ [I]133-anthea wish [we]3967-we could , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ [You]278-the children feel , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian , “ that [I]1304-the egyptian want [your]278-the children Amulet . That makes [you]278-the children distrust [me]1304-the egyptian . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ Yes , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril bluntly . “ But [you]278-the children also , [you]278-the children want [my]131-cyril Amulet , and [I]131-cyril am trusting [you]278-the children . ”[131-cyril] “ There ’s something in that , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ [We]3968-our have the two halves of the Amulet , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest , “ but not yet the pin that joined [them]3969-them . [Our]3968-our only chance of getting that is to remain together . Once part these two halves and [they]3969-them may never be found in the same time and place . Be wise . [Our]3968-our interests are the same . ”[3339-the priest] Before [anyone]283-anyone could say more [the skipper]3928-the skipper came back , and with [him]3928-the skipper [the dye‐master]1964-the dye‐master . [His]1964-the dye‐master hair and beard were curled like [the men]615-the men ’s in [Babylon]40-babylon , and [he]1964-the dye‐master was dressed like [the skipper]3928-the skipper , but with added grandeur of gold and embroidery . [He]1964-the dye‐master had necklaces of beads and silver , and a glass amulet with [a man]451-a man ’s face , very like [his]1964-the dye‐master own , set between two bull ’s heads , as well as gold and silver bracelets and armlets . [He]1964-the dye‐master looked keenly at [the children]278-the children . Then [he]1964-the dye‐master said — “ [[My]1964-the dye‐master brother]3970-my brother [Pheles]254-pheles has just come back from [Tarshish]108-tarshish . [He]254-pheles ’s at [[his]254-pheles garden house]3971-his garden house — unless [he]254-pheles ’s hunting wild boar in [the marshes]3972-the marshes . [He]254-pheles gets frightfully bored on [shore]3973-shore . ”[1964-the dye‐master] “ Ah , ”[3928-the skipper] said [the skipper]3928-the skipper , “ [he]254-pheles ’s [a true‐born Phœnician]3974-a true‐born phœnician . ‘ [Tyre]103-tyre , [Tyre]103-tyre for ever ! Oh , [Tyre]103-tyre rules [the waves]3975-the waves ! ’ as the old song says . [I]1964-the dye‐master ’ll go at once , and show [him]254-pheles [[my]1964-the dye‐master young barbarians]3976-my young barbarians . ”[1964-the dye‐master] “ [I]1964-the dye‐master should , ”[1964-the dye‐master] said [the dye‐master]1964-the dye‐master . “ [They]3976-my young barbarians are very rum , are n’t [they]3976-my young barbarians ? What frightful clothes , and what [a lot of them]3977-a lot of them ! Observe the covering of [their]3976-my young barbarians feet . Hideous indeed . ”[1964-the dye‐master] [Robert]132-robert could not help thinking how easy , and at the same time pleasant , it would be to catch hold of [the dye‐master]1964-the dye‐master ’s feet and tip [him]1964-the dye‐master backward into [the great sunken vat just near [him]1964-the dye‐master]1972-the great sunken vat just near him . But if [he]132-robert had , flight would have had to be the next move , so [he]132-robert restrained [his]132-robert impulse . There was something about this Tyrian adventure that was different from all the others . It was , somehow , calmer . And there was the undoubted fact that the charm was there on the neck of [the Egyptian]255-the egyptian . So [they]1973-they enjoyed everything to the full , the row from [the Island City]1974-the island city to [the shore]1975-the shore , the ride on the donkeys that [the skipper]3928-the skipper hired at [the gate of [the mainland city]1978-the mainland city]1977-the gate of the mainland city , and [the pleasant country]1979-the pleasant country — palms and figs and cedars all about . It was like [a garden]1648-a garden — clematis , honeysuckle , and jasmine clung about the olive and mulberry trees , and there were tulips and gladiolus , and clumps of mandrake , which has bell‐flowers that look as though they were cut out of dark blue jewels . In the distance were [the mountains of [Lebanon]110-lebanon]1981-the mountains of lebanon . [The house]390-the house [they]1973-they came to at last was rather like [a bungalow]1983-a bungalow — long and low , with pillars all along the front . Cedars and sycamores grew near [it]390-the house and sheltered [it]390-the house pleasantly . [Every one]2347-every one dismounted , and the donkeys were led away . “ Why is this like [Rosherville]111-rosherville ? ”[132-robert] whispered [Robert]132-robert , and instantly supplied the answer . “ Because it ’s [the place]539-the place to spend a happy day . ”[132-robert] “ It ’s jolly decent of [the skipper]3928-the skipper to have brought [us]1973-they to [such a ripping place]3980-such a ripping place , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . “ Do [you]278-the children know , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ this feels more real than anything else [we]1973-they ’ve seen ? It ’s like a holiday in [the country]290-the country at [home]357-home . ”[133-anthea] [The children]278-the children were left alone in [a large hall]1986-a large hall . The floor was mosaic , done with wonderful pictures of [ships]3946-ships and [sea‐beasts]1988-sea‐beasts and fishes . Through an open doorway [they]278-the children could see [a pleasant courtyard with flowers]1989-a pleasant courtyard with flowers . “ [I]134-jane should like to spend a week here , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane , “ and donkey ride every day . ”[134-jane] [Every one]2347-every one was feeling very jolly . Even [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian looked pleasanter than usual . And then , quite suddenly , [the skipper]3928-the skipper came back with a joyous smile . With [him]3928-the skipper came [the master of [the house]390-the house]1993-the master of the house . [He]1993-the master of the house looked steadily at [the children]278-the children and nodded twice . “ Yes , ”[1993-the master of the house] [he]1993-the master of the house said , “ [[my]1993-the master of the house steward]3983-my steward will pay [you]278-the children the price . But [I]1993-the master of the house shall not pay at that high rate for the Egyptian dog . ”[1993-the master of the house] [The two]3771-the two passed on . “ This , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian , “ is a pretty kettle of fish . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ What is ? ”[278-the children] asked all [the children]278-the children at once . “ [Our]278-the children present position , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā . “ [[Our]278-the children seafaring friend]3984-our seafaring friend , ”[243-rekh‐marā] [he]243-rekh‐marā added , “ has sold [us]278-the children all for slaves ! ”[243-rekh‐marā] A hasty council succeeded the shock of this announcement . [The Priest]256-the priest was allowed to take part in it . [His]256-the priest advice was “ stay , ”[256-the priest] because [they]278-the children were in no danger , and [the Amulet]2910-the amulet in its completeness must be somewhere near , or , of course , [they]278-the children could not have come to [that place]2000-that place at all . And after some discussion [they]278-the children agreed to this . [The children]278-the children were treated more as [guests]2002-guests than as [slaves]2875-slaves , but [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian was sent to [the kitchen]3878-the kitchen and made to work . [Pheles]254-pheles , [the master of [the house]390-the house]1993-the master of the house , went off that very evening , by [the King]2789-the king ’s orders , to start on another voyage . And when [he]254-pheles was gone [[his]254-pheles wife]2009-his wife found [the children]278-the children amusing company , and kept [them]278-the children talking and singing and dancing till quite late . “ To distract [my]2009-his wife mind from [my]2009-his wife sorrows , ”[2009-his wife] [she]2009-his wife said . “ [I]134-jane do like being [a slave]3141-a slave , ”[134-jane] remarked [Jane]134-jane cheerfully , as [they]278-the children curled up on the big , soft cushions that were to be [their]278-the children beds . It was black night when [they]278-the children were awakened , each by a hand passed softly over its face , and a low voice that whispered — “ Be quiet , or all is lost . ”[2011-the whisperer] So [they]278-the children were quiet . “ It ’s [me]2011-the whisperer , [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , [the Priest of Amen]3986-the priest of amen , ”[2011-the whisperer] said [the whisperer]2011-the whisperer . “ [The man who brought [us]278-the children]3987-the man who brought us has gone to [sea]3386-sea again , and [he]3987-the man who brought us has taken [my]2011-the whisperer Amulet from [me]2011-the whisperer by force , and [I]2011-the whisperer know no magic to get it back . Is there magic for that in the Amulet [you]278-the children bear ? ”[2011-the whisperer] [Every one]2347-every one was instantly awake by now . “ [We]278-the children can go after [him]3987-the man who brought us , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , leaping up ; “ but [he]3987-the man who brought us might take [ours]278-the children as well ; or [he]3987-the man who brought us might be angry with [us]278-the children for following [him]3987-the man who brought us . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]1304-the egyptian ’ll see to that , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian in the dark . “ Hide [your]134-jane Amulet well . ”[1304-the egyptian] There in the deep blackness of [that room in [the Tyrian country house]2015-the tyrian country house]2014-that room in the tyrian country house the Amulet was once more held up and the word spoken . [All]655-all passed through on to [a ship that tossed and tumbled on [a wind‐blown sea]2018-a wind‐blown sea]2017-a ship that tossed and tumbled on a wind‐blown sea . [They]655-all crouched together there till morning , and [Jane]134-jane and [Cyril]131-cyril were not at all well . When the dawn showed , dove‐coloured , across the steely waves , [they]655-all stood up as well as [they]655-all could for the tumbling of [the ship]3228-the ship . [Pheles]254-pheles , [that hardy sailor and adventurer]2020-that hardy sailor and adventurer , turned quite pale when [he]254-pheles turned round suddenly and saw [them]655-all . “ Well ! ”[254-pheles] [he]254-pheles said , “ well , [I]254-pheles never did ! ”[254-pheles] “ [Master]1276-master , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian , bowing low , and that was even more difficult than standing up , “ [we]655-all are here by the magic of the sacred Amulet that hangs round [your]1276-master neck . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ [I]254-pheles never did ! ”[254-pheles] repeated [Pheles]254-pheles . “ Well , well ! ”[254-pheles] “ What port is [the ship]3228-the ship bound for ? ”[132-robert] asked [Robert]132-robert , with a nautical air . But [Pheles]254-pheles said , “ Are [you]132-robert [a navigator]3991-a navigator ? ”[254-pheles] [Robert]132-robert had to own that [he]132-robert was not . “ Then , ”[254-pheles] said [Pheles]254-pheles , “ [I]254-pheles do n’t mind telling [you]1276-master that [we]655-all ’re bound for [the Tin Isles]112-the tin isles . [Tyre]103-tyre alone knows where [the Tin Isles]112-the tin isles are . It is a splendid secret [we]655-all keep from all [the world]294-the world . It is as great a thing to [us]655-all as [your]1276-master magic to [you]1276-master . ”[254-pheles] [He]254-pheles spoke in quite a new voice , and seemed to respect both [the children]278-the children and [the Amulet]166-the amulet a good deal more than [he]254-pheles had done before . “ [The King]2789-the king sent [you]1276-master , did n’t [he]2789-the king ? ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ Yes , ”[254-pheles] answered [Pheles]254-pheles , “ [he]2789-the king bade [me]254-pheles set sail with [half a score brave gentlemen]3994-half a score brave gentlemen and [this crew]3995-this crew . [You]1276-master shall go with [us]278-the children , and see many wonders . ”[254-pheles] [He]254-pheles bowed and left [them]278-the children . “ What are [we]278-the children going to do now ? ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , when [Pheles]254-pheles had caused [them]278-the children to be left along with a breakfast of dried fruits and a sort of hard biscuit . “ Wait till [he]2789-the king lands in [the Tin Isles]112-the tin isles , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , “ then [we]278-the children can get [the barbarians]3996-the barbarians to help [us]278-the children . [We]278-the children will attack [him]2789-the king by night and tear the sacred Amulet from [his]2789-the king accursed heathen neck , ”[243-rekh‐marā] [he]243-rekh‐marā added , grinding [his]243-rekh‐marā teeth . “ When shall [we]278-the children get to [the Tin Isles]112-the tin isles ? ”[134-jane] asked [Jane]134-jane . “ Oh — six months , perhaps , or a year , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian cheerfully . “ A year of this ? ”[134-jane] cried [Jane]134-jane , and [Cyril]131-cyril , who was still feeling far too unwell to care about breakfast , hugged [himself]131-cyril miserably and shuddered . It was [Robert]132-robert who said — “ Look here , [we]278-the children can shorten that year . [Jane]134-jane , out with the Amulet ! Wish that [we]278-the children were where the Amulet will be when [the ship]3228-the ship is twenty miles from [the Tin Island]113-the tin island . That ’ll give [us]278-the children time to mature [our]278-the children plans . ”[132-robert] It was done — the work of a moment — and there [they]2024-they were on [the same ship]2025-the same ship , between [grey northern sky]2026-grey northern sky and [grey northern sea]2027-grey northern sea . The sun was setting in a pale yellow line . [It]2025-the same ship was [the same ship]2025-the same ship , but it was changed , and so were [the crew]3888-the crew . Weather‐worn and dirty were [the sailors]3903-the sailors , and [their]3903-the sailors clothes torn and ragged . And [the children]278-the children saw that , of course , though [they]278-the children had skipped the nine months , [the ship]3228-the ship had had to live through [them]278-the children . [Pheles]254-pheles looked thinner , and [his]254-pheles face was rugged and anxious . “ Ha ! ”[254-pheles] [he]254-pheles cried , “ the charm has brought [you]254-pheles back ! [I]254-pheles have prayed to it daily these nine months — and now [you]254-pheles are here ? Have [you]254-pheles no magic that can help ? ”[254-pheles] “ What is [your]254-pheles need ? ”[1304-the egyptian] asked [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian quietly . “ [I]1304-the egyptian need a great wave that shall whelm away [the foreign ship that follows [us]3999-us]3998-the foreign ship that follows us . A month ago it lay in wait for [us]3999-us , by the pillars of [the gods]3714-the gods , and it follows , follows , to find out the secret of [Tyre]103-tyre — [the place of [the Tin Islands]104-the tin islands]4001-the place of the tin islands . If [I]1304-the egyptian could steer by night [I]1304-the egyptian could escape [them]4002-them yet , but tonight there will be no stars . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ [My]1304-the egyptian magic will not serve [you]1304-the egyptian here , ”[1304-the egyptian] said [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian . But [Robert]132-robert said , “ [My]132-robert magic will not bring up great waves , but [I]132-robert can show [you]254-pheles how to steer without stars . ”[132-robert] [He]132-robert took out the shilling compass , still , fortunately , in working order , that [he]132-robert had bought off [another boy]2035-another boy at [school]3006-school for fivepence , a piece of indiarubber , a strip of whalebone , and half a stick of red sealing‐wax . And [he]132-robert showed [Pheles]254-pheles how it worked . And [Pheles]254-pheles wondered at the compass ’s magic truth . “ [I]132-robert will give it to [you]254-pheles , ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert said , “ in return for that charm about [your]254-pheles neck . ”[132-robert] [Pheles]254-pheles made no answer . [He]254-pheles first laughed , snatched the compass from [Robert]132-robert ’s hand , and turned away still laughing . “ Be comforted , ”[3339-the priest] [the Priest]3339-the priest whispered , “ [our]4003-we time will come . ”[3339-the priest] The dusk deepened , and [Pheles]254-pheles , crouched beside a dim lantern , steered by the shilling compass from [the Crystal Palace]114-the crystal palace . [No one]344-no one ever knew how [the other ship]2039-the other ship sailed , but suddenly , in the deep night , [the look‐out man at the stern]2040-the look‐out man at the stern cried out in a terrible voice — “ [She]2039-the other ship is close upon [us]4003-we ! ”[2040-the look‐out man at the stern] “ And [we]4003-we , ”[254-pheles] said [Pheles]254-pheles , “ are close to [the harbour]3945-the harbour . ”[254-pheles] [He]2040-the look‐out man at the stern was silent a moment , then suddenly [he]2040-the look‐out man at the stern altered [the ship]3228-the ship ’s course , and then [he]2040-the look‐out man at the stern stood up and spoke . “ [Good friends]4005-good friends and [gentlemen]2654-gentlemen , ”[2040-the look‐out man at the stern] [he]2040-the look‐out man at the stern said , “ who are bound with [me]2040-the look‐out man at the stern in this brave venture by [[our]4003-we King]4007-our king ’s command , [the false , foreign ship]4008-the false , foreign ship is close on [our]4003-we heels . If [we]4003-we land , [they]4008-the false , foreign ship land , and only [the gods]3714-the gods know whether [they]4008-the false , foreign ship might not beat [us]4003-we in fight , and [themselves]4008-the false , foreign ship survive to carry back the tale of [[Tyre]103-tyre ’s secret island]4010-tyre ’s secret island to enrich [[their]4008-the false , foreign ship own miserable land]4011-their own miserable land . Shall this be ? ”[2040-the look‐out man at the stern] “ Never ! ”[2042-the half‐dozen men near him] cried [the half‐dozen men near [him]2040-the look‐out man at the stern]2042-the half‐dozen men near him . [The slaves]2043-the slaves were rowing hard below and could not hear [his]2040-the look‐out man at the stern words . [The Egyptian]1304-the egyptian leaped upon [him]2040-the look‐out man at the stern ; suddenly , fiercely , as a wild beast leaps . “ Give [me]2040-the look‐out man at the stern back [my]2040-the look‐out man at the stern Amulet , ”[2040-the look‐out man at the stern] [he]2040-the look‐out man at the stern cried , and caught at the charm . The chain that held it snapped , and it lay in [the Priest]3339-the priest ’s hand . [Pheles]254-pheles laughed , standing balanced to the leap of [the ship that answered [the oarstroke]2047-the oarstroke]2046-the ship that answered the oarstroke . “ This is no time for charms and mummeries , ”[254-pheles] [he]254-pheles said . “ [We]4003-we ’ve lived like [men]2526-men , and [we]4003-we ’ll die like [gentlemen]2654-gentlemen for the honour and glory of [Tyre]103-tyre , [[our]4003-we splendid city]4014-our splendid city . ‘ [Tyre]103-tyre , [Tyre]103-tyre for ever ! It ’s [Tyre]103-tyre that rules [the waves]3975-the waves . ’ [I]254-pheles steer [her]4016-her straight for [the Dragon rocks]4017-the dragon rocks , and [we]4003-we go down for [[our]4003-we city]4018-our city , as [brave men]4019-brave men should . [The creeping cowards who follow]4020-the creeping cowards who follow shall go down as [slaves]2875-slaves — and [slaves]2875-slaves [they]2875-slaves shall be to [us]4003-we — when [we]4003-we live again . [Tyre]103-tyre , [Tyre]103-tyre for ever ! ”[254-pheles] A great shout went up , and [the slaves below]2048-the slaves below joined in it . “ Quick , the Amulet , ”[133-anthea] cried [Anthea]133-anthea , and held it up . [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā held up the one [he]243-rekh‐marā had snatched from [Pheles]254-pheles . The word was spoken , and the two great arches grew on [the plunging ship]2049-the plunging ship in the shrieking wind under the dark sky . From each Amulet a great and beautiful green light streamed and shone far out over [the waves]3975-the waves . It illuminated , too , the black faces and jagged teeth of the great rocks that lay not two ships ’ lengths from [the boat]3885-the boat ’s peaked nose . “ [Tyre]103-tyre , [Tyre]103-tyre for ever ! It ’s [Tyre]103-tyre that rules the waves ! ”[2052-the doomed] the voices of [the doomed]2052-the doomed rose in a triumphant shout . [The children]278-the children scrambled through the arch , and stood trembling and blinking in [the Fitzroy Street parlour]2054-the fitzroy street parlour , and in [their]278-the children ears still sounded the whistle of the wind , and the rattle of the oars , the crash of [the ship]3228-the ship ’s bow on the rocks , and the last shout of [the brave gentlemen‐adventurers who went to [their]2056-the brave gentlemen‐adventurers who went to their deaths singing , for the sake of the city they loved deaths singing , for the sake of [the city [they]2056-the brave gentlemen‐adventurers who went to their deaths singing , for the sake of the city they loved loved]2057-the city they loved]2056-the brave gentlemen‐adventurers who went to their deaths singing , for the sake of the city they loved . “ And so [we]278-the children ’ve lost the other half of the Amulet again , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , when [they]278-the children had told [the Psammead]136-the psammead all about it . “ Nonsense , pooh ! ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ that was n’t the other half . It was the same half that [you]133-anthea ’ve got — the one that was n’t crushed and lost . ”[136-the psammead] “ But how could it be the same ? ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea gently . “ Well , not exactly , of course . The one [you]133-anthea ’ve got is a good many years older , but at any rate it ’s not the other one . What did [you]133-anthea say when [you]133-anthea wished ? ”[133-anthea] “ [I]134-jane forget , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane . “ [I]136-the psammead do n’t , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead . “ [You]136-the psammead said , ‘ Take [us]278-the children where [you]133-anthea are’—and it did , so [you]133-anthea see it was the same half . ”[136-the psammead] “ [I]133-anthea see , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ But [you]136-the psammead mark [my]133-anthea words , ”[133-anthea] [the Psammead]136-the psammead went on , “ [you]136-the psammead ’ll have trouble with [that Priest]4023-that priest yet . ”[136-the psammead] “ Why , [he]4023-that priest was quite friendly , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea . “ All the same [you]136-the psammead ’d better beware of [the Reverend Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā . ”[133-anthea] “ Oh , [I]131-cyril ’m sick of the Amulet , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ [we]278-the children shall never get it . ”[131-cyril] “ Oh yes [we]278-the children shall , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ Do n’t [you]131-cyril remember December 3rd ? ”[132-robert] “ [Jinks]258-jinks ! ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ [I]131-cyril ’d forgotten that . ”[131-cyril] “ [I]134-jane do n’t believe it , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane , “ and [I]134-jane do n’t feel at all well . ”[134-jane] “ If [I]136-the psammead were [you]131-cyril , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead , “ [I]136-the psammead should not go out into the Past again till that date . [You]131-cyril ’ll find it safer not to go where [you]131-cyril ’re likely to meet [that Egyptian]4024-that egyptian any more just at present . ”[136-the psammead] “ Of course [we]278-the children ’ll do as [you]136-the psammead say , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea soothingly , “ though there ’s something about [his]4024-that egyptian face that [I]133-anthea really do like . ”[133-anthea] “ Still , [you]131-cyril do n’t want to run after [him]4024-that egyptian , [I]400-the psammead suppose , ”[400-the psammead] snapped [the Psammead]400-the psammead . “ [You]131-cyril wait till the 3rd , and then see what happens . ”[400-the psammead] [Cyril]131-cyril and [Jane]134-jane were feeling far from well , [Anthea]133-anthea was always obliging , so [Robert]132-robert was overruled . And [they]2059-they promised . And none of [them]2059-they , not even [the Psammead]136-the psammead , at all foresaw , as [you]2060-you no doubt do quite plainly , exactly what it was that would happen on that memorable date . IF [I]0-i only had time [I]0-i could tell [you]2060-you lots of things . For instance , how , in spite of the advice of [the Psammead]136-the psammead , [the four children]309-the four children did , one very wet day , go through [their]309-the four children Amulet Arch into [the golden desert]2062-the golden desert , and there find [the great Temple of [Baalbec]115-baalbec]2063-the great temple of baalbec and meet with [the Phœnix whom [they]309-the four children never thought to see again . And how [the Phœnix]259-the phœnix did not remember [them]309-the four children at all until it went into a sort of prophetic trance]259-the phœnix — if that can be called remembering . But , alas ! [I]0-i have n’t time , so [I]0-i must leave all that out though it was a wonderfully thrilling adventure . [I]0-i must leave out , too , all about the visit of [the children]278-the children to [the Hippodrome]116-the hippodrome with [the Psammead]136-the psammead in its travelling bag , and about how the wishes of [the people round about [them]278-the children]2065-the people round about them were granted so suddenly and surprisingly that at last [the Psammead]136-the psammead had to be taken hurriedly [home]357-home by [Anthea]133-anthea , who consequently missed half the performance . Then there was the time when , [Nurse]142-old nurse having gone to tea with [a friend]2067-a friend out [Ivalunk]117-ivalunk way , [they]2068-they were playing “ devil in the dark”—and[2068-they] in the midst of that most creepy pastime [the postman]2069-the postman ’s knock frightened [Jane]134-jane nearly out of [her]134-jane life . [She]134-jane took in the letters , however , and put them in the back of the hat‐stand drawer , so that they should be safe . And safe [they]278-the children were , for [she]134-jane never thought of [them]278-the children again for weeks and weeks . One really good thing happened when [they]2068-they took [the Psammead]136-the psammead to a magic‐lantern show and lecture at [[the boys]313-the boys ’ school at [Camden Town]11-camden town]2071-the boys ’ school at camden town . The lecture was all about [[our]2072-our soldiers in [South Africa]118-south africa]2073-our soldiers in south africa . And [the lecturer]2074-the lecturer ended up by saying , “ And [I]2074-the lecturer hope [every boy in [this room]347-this room]4025-every boy in this room has in [his]4025-every boy in this room heart the seeds of courage and heroism and self‐sacrifice , and [I]2074-the lecturer wish that [every one of [you]4028-you]4027-every one of you may grow up to be noble and brave and unselfish , [worthy citizens of [this great Empire]4030-this great empire for whom [[our]2072-our soldiers]4031-our soldiers have freely given [their]4031-our soldiers lives]4029-worthy citizens of this great empire for whom our soldiers have freely given their lives . ”[2074-the lecturer] And , of course , this came true — which was a distinct score for [Camden Town]11-camden town . As [Anthea]133-anthea said , it was unlucky that [the lecturer]2074-the lecturer said [boys]1305-boys , because now [she]133-anthea and [Jane]134-jane would have to be noble and unselfish , if at all , without any outside help . But [Jane]134-jane said , “ [I]134-jane daresay [we]2072-our are already because of [our]2072-our beautiful natures . It ’s only [boys that have to be made brave by magic”—which]4032-boys that have to be made brave by magic”—which[134-jane] nearly led to a first‐class row . And [I]0-i daresay [you]2077-you would like to know all about the affair of the fishing rod , and the fish‐hooks , and [the cook next door]2078-the cook next door — which was amusing from some points of view , though not perhaps the cook’s — but there really is no time even for that . The only thing that there ’s time to tell about is the Adventure of [Maskelyne]260-maskelyne and [Cooke]261-cooke ’s , and the Unexpected Apparition — which is also the beginning of the end . It was [Nurse]142-old nurse who broke into the gloomy music of the autumn rain on the window panes by suggesting a visit to [the Egyptian Hall]2079-the egyptian hall , [[England]8-england ’s Home of Mystery]2080-england ’s home of mystery . Though [they]2081-they had good , but private reasons to know that [their]2081-they own particular personal mystery was of a very different brand , [the four]3758-the four all brightened at the idea . [All children]2444-all children , as well as [a good many grown‐ups]2084-a good many grown‐ups , love conjuring . “ [It]4033-it ’s in [Piccadilly]119-piccadilly , ”[142-old nurse] said [old Nurse]142-old nurse , carefully counting out the proper number of shillings into [Cyril]131-cyril ’s hand , “ not so very far down on the left from [the Circus]4034-the circus . [There ’s big pillars outside]4035-there ’s big pillars outside , something like [[Carter]262-carter ’s seed place in [Holborn]120-holborn]4036-carter ’s seed place in holborn , as used to be Day and [Martin]263-martin ’s blacking when [I]142-old nurse was a gell . And something like [Euston Station]121-euston station , only not so big . ”[142-old nurse] “ Yes , [I]2317-everybody know , ”[2317-everybody] said [everybody]2317-everybody . So [they]3758-the four started . But though [they]3758-the four walked along the left‐hand side of [Piccadilly]119-piccadilly [they]3758-the four saw [no pillared building that was at all like [Carter ’s seed warehouse]2087-carter ’s seed warehouse or [Euston Station]121-euston station]2086-no pillared building that was at all like carter ’s seed warehouse or euston station or [[England]8-england ’s Home of Mystery]123-england ’s home of mystery as [they]3758-the four remembered it . At last [they]3758-the four stopped [a hurried lady]2088-a hurried lady , and asked [her]2088-a hurried lady the way to [Maskelyne]260-maskelyne and [Cooke ’s]261-cooke . “ [I]2088-a hurried lady do n’t know , [I]2088-a hurried lady ’m sure , ”[2088-a hurried lady] [she]2088-a hurried lady said , pushing past [them]3758-the four . “ [I]2088-a hurried lady always shop at [the Stores]4037-the stores . ”[2088-a hurried lady] Which just shows , as [Jane]134-jane said , how [ignorant grown‐up people]2089-ignorant grown‐up people are . It was [a policeman]353-a policeman who at last explained to [them]3758-the four that [England]8-england ’s Mysteries are now appropriately enough enacted at [St George ’s Hall]125-st george ’s hall . So [they]3758-the four tramped to [Langham Place]126-langham place , and missed the first two items in the programme . But [they]3758-the four were in time for the most wonderful magic appearances and disappearances , which [they]3758-the four could hardly believe — even with all [their]3758-the four knowledge of a larger magic — was not really magic after all . “ If only [the Babylonians]264-the babylonians could have seen this conjuring , ”[131-cyril] whispered [Cyril]131-cyril . “ It takes the shine out of [[their]264-the babylonians old conjurer]4038-their old conjurer , does n’t it ? ”[131-cyril] “ Hush ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea and [several other members of [the audience]903-the audience]2091-several other members of the audience . Now there was a vacant seat next to [Robert]132-robert . And it was when all eyes were fixed on the stage where [Mr Devant]265-mr devant was pouring out glasses of all sorts of different things to drink , out of one kettle with one spout , and [the audience]903-the audience were delightedly tasting them , that [Robert]132-robert felt some one in that vacant seat . [He]132-robert did not feel [some one]376-some one sit down in it . It was just that one moment there was [no one sitting there]2095-no one sitting there , and the next moment , suddenly , there was [some one]376-some one . [Robert]132-robert turned . The some one who had suddenly filled [that empty place]2097-that empty place was [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , [the Priest of Amen]3986-the priest of amen ! Though the eyes of [the audience]903-the audience were fixed on [Mr David Devant]265-mr devant , [Mr David Devant]265-mr devant ’s eyes were fixed on [the audience]903-the audience . And it happened that [his]265-mr devant eyes were more particularly fixed on that empty chair . So that [he]265-mr devant saw quite plainly the sudden appearance , from nowhere , of [the Egyptian Priest]2101-the egyptian priest . “ A jolly good trick , ”[265-mr devant] [he]265-mr devant said to [himself]265-mr devant , “ and worked under [my]265-mr devant own eyes , in [[my]265-mr devant own hall]4039-my own hall . [I]265-mr devant ’ll find out how that ’s done . ”[265-mr devant] [He]265-mr devant had never seen a trick that [he]265-mr devant could not do [himself]265-mr devant if [he]265-mr devant tried . By this time a good many eyes in [the audience]903-the audience had turned on the clean‐shaven , curiously‐dressed figure of [the Egyptian Priest]2101-the egyptian priest . “ [Ladies]2919-ladies and [gentlemen]2654-gentlemen , ”[265-mr devant] said [Mr Devant]265-mr devant , rising to the occasion , “ this is a trick [I]265-mr devant have never before performed . The empty seat , third from the end , second row , gallery — [you]4042-you will now find occupied by [an Ancient Egyptian]4043-an ancient egyptian , warranted genuine . ”[265-mr devant] [He]265-mr devant little knew how true [his]265-mr devant words were . And now all eyes were turned on [the Priest]3339-the priest and [the children]278-the children , and [the whole audience]2106-the whole audience , after a moment ’s breathless surprise , shouted applause . Only [the lady on the other side of [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā]2107-the lady on the other side of rekh‐marā drew back a little . [She]2107-the lady on the other side of rekh‐marā knew [no one]344-no one had passed [her]2107-the lady on the other side of rekh‐marā , and , as [she]2107-the lady on the other side of rekh‐marā said later , over tea and cold tongue , “ it was that sudden it made [her]2107-the lady on the other side of rekh‐marā flesh creep . ”[243-rekh‐marā] [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā seemed very much annoyed at the notice [he]243-rekh‐marā was exciting . “ Come out of [this crowd]4044-this crowd , ”[243-rekh‐marā] [he]243-rekh‐marā whispered to [Robert]132-robert . “ [I]243-rekh‐marā must talk with [you]132-robert apart . ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ Oh , no , ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane whispered . “ [I]134-jane did so want to see [the Mascot Moth]4045-the mascot moth , and [the Ventriloquist]4046-the ventriloquist . ”[134-jane] “ How did [you]132-robert get [here]2247-here ? ”[132-robert] was [Robert]132-robert ’s return whisper . “ How did [you]132-robert get to [Egypt]21-egypt and to [Tyre]103-tyre ? ”[243-rekh‐marā] retorted [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā . “ Come , let [us]2109-they leave [this crowd]4044-this crowd . ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ There ’s no help for it , [I]132-robert suppose , ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert shrugged angrily . But [they]2109-they all got up . “ [Confederates]4049-confederates ! ”[2110-a man in the row behind] said [a man in the row behind]2110-a man in the row behind . “ Now [they]4049-confederates go round to the back and take part in the next scene . ”[2110-a man in the row behind] “ [I]132-robert wish [we]2109-they did , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ [Confederate]4050-confederate [yourself]131-cyril ! ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril . And so [they]2109-they got away , [the audience]903-the audience applauding to the last . In [the vestibule of [St George]127-st george ’s Hall]2112-the vestibule of st george ’s hall [they]2109-they disguised [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā as well as [they]2109-they could , but even with [Robert]132-robert ’s hat and [Cyril]131-cyril ’s Inverness cape [he]243-rekh‐marā was too striking a figure for foot‐exercise in [the London streets]2113-the london streets . It had to be [a cab]3123-a cab , and it took the last , least money of [all of [them]2115-all of them]2115-all of them . [They]2109-they stopped [the cab]310-the cab a few doors from [home]357-home , and then [the girls]311-the girls went in and engaged [old Nurse]142-old nurse ’s attention by an account of the conjuring and a fervent entreaty for dripping‐toast with [their]2109-they tea , leaving the front door open so that while [Nurse]142-old nurse was talking to [them]311-the girls [the boys]313-the boys could creep quietly in with [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā and smuggle [him]243-rekh‐marā , unseen , up the stairs into [[their]2109-they bedroom]2120-their bedroom . When [the girls]311-the girls came up [they]311-the girls found [the Egyptian Priest]2101-the egyptian priest sitting on the side of [Cyril]131-cyril ’s bed , [his]2101-the egyptian priest hands on [his]2101-the egyptian priest knees , looking like a statue of [a king]940-a king . “ Come on , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril impatiently . “ [He]2101-the egyptian priest wo n’t begin till [we]311-the girls ’re all here . And shut the door , ca n’t [you]2101-the egyptian priest ? ”[131-cyril] When the door was shut [the Egyptian]1304-the egyptian said — “ [My]1304-the egyptian interests and [yours]2101-the egyptian priest are one . ”[1304-the egyptian] “ Very interesting , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril , “ and it ’ll be a jolly sight more interesting if [you]2101-the egyptian priest keep following [us]311-the girls about in [a decent country]4051-a decent country with no more clothes on than that ! ”[131-cyril] “ [Peace]266-peace , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest . “ What is [this country]1336-this country ? and what is this time ? ”[3339-the priest] “ [[The country]290-the country ’s [England]8-england]4054-the country ’s england , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , “ and the time ’s about six thousand years later than [your]2101-the egyptian priest time . ”[133-anthea] “ The Amulet , then , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest , deeply thoughtful , “ gives the power to move to and fro in time as well as in space ? ”[3339-the priest] “ That ’s about it , ”[131-cyril] said [Cyril]131-cyril gruffly . “ Look here , it ’ll be tea‐time directly . What are [we]311-the girls to do with [you]2101-the egyptian priest ? ”[131-cyril] “ [You]2101-the egyptian priest have [one‐half of the Amulet]4055-one‐half of the amulet , [I]243-rekh‐marā the other , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā . “ All that is now needed is the pin to join [them]4056-them . ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ Do n’t [you]2101-the egyptian priest think it , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ The half [you]2101-the egyptian priest ’ve got is the same half as the one [we]311-the girls ’ve got . ”[132-robert] “ But the same thing can not be in [the same place]541-the same place and the same time , and yet be not one , but twain , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest . “ See , here is [my]3339-the priest half . ”[3339-the priest] [He]3339-the priest laid it on [the Marcella counterpane]2128-the marcella counterpane . “ Where is [yours]2101-the egyptian priest ? ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane watching the eyes of [the others]325-the others , unfastened the string of the Amulet and laid it on the bed , but too far off for [the Priest]3339-the priest to seize it , even if [he]3339-the priest had been so dishonourable . [Cyril]131-cyril and [Robert]132-robert stood beside [him]3339-the priest , ready to spring on [him]3339-the priest if one of [his]3339-the priest hands had moved but ever so little towards the magic treasure that was [theirs]2131-theirs . But [his]3339-the priest hands did not move , only [his]3339-the priest eyes opened very wide , and so did [every one else]2932-every one else ’s for the Amulet [the Priest]3339-the priest had now quivered and shook ; and then , as steel is drawn to the magnet , it was drawn across the white counterpane , nearer and nearer to the Amulet , warm from the neck of [Jane]134-jane . And then , as one drop of water mingles with another on a rain‐wrinkled window‐pane , as one bead of quick‐silver is drawn into another bead , [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā ’s Amulet slipped into the other one , and , behold ! there was no more but the one Amulet ! “ Black magic ! ”[243-rekh‐marā] cried [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , and sprang forward to snatch the Amulet that had swallowed [his]243-rekh‐marā . But [Anthea]133-anthea caught it up , and at the same moment [the Priest]3339-the priest was jerked back by a rope thrown over [his]3339-the priest head . It drew , tightened with the pull of [his]3339-the priest forward leap , and bound [his]3339-the priest elbows to [his]3339-the priest sides . Before [he]3339-the priest had time to use [his]3339-the priest strength to free [himself]3339-the priest , [Robert]132-robert had knotted the cord behind [him]3339-the priest and tied it to the bedpost . Then [the four children]309-the four children , overcoming [the priest]3339-the priest ’s wrigglings and kickings , tied [his]3339-the priest legs with more rope . “ [I]132-robert thought , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , breathing hard , and drawing the last knot tight , “ [he]3339-the priest ’d have a try for [Ours]4058-we , so [I]132-robert got the ropes out of [the box‐room]4059-the box‐room , so as to be ready . ”[132-robert] [The girls]311-the girls , with rather white faces , applauded [his]132-robert foresight . “ Loosen these bonds ! ”[243-rekh‐marā] cried [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā in fury , “ before [I]243-rekh‐marā blast [you]309-the four children with the seven secret curses of [Amen‐Rā]267-amen‐rā ! ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ [We]4058-we should n’t be likely to loose [them]4060-them after , ”[132-robert] [Robert]132-robert retorted . “ Oh , do n’t quarrel ! ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea desperately . “ Look here , [he]3339-the priest has just as much right to the thing as [we]4058-we have . This , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea took up the Amulet that had swallowed the other one , “ this has got [his]3339-the priest in it as well as being [ours]4058-we . Let ’s go shares . ”[133-anthea] “ Let [me]3339-the priest go ! ”[3339-the priest] cried [the Priest]3339-the priest , writhing . “ Now , look here , ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert , “ if [you]3339-the priest make a row [we]4058-we can just open that window and call [the police]680-the police — [the guards]3174-the guards , [you]3339-the priest know — and tell [them]680-the police [you]3339-the priest ’ve been trying to rob [us]4058-we . Now will [you]3339-the priest shut up and listen to reason ? ”[132-robert] “ [I]243-rekh‐marā suppose so , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā sulkily . But reason could not be spoken to [him]3339-the priest till a whispered counsel had been held in the far corner by [the wash‐hand‐stand]2139-the wash‐hand‐stand and the towel‐horse , a counsel rather long and very earnest . At last [Anthea]133-anthea detached [herself]133-anthea from [the group]2140-the group , and went back to [the Priest]3339-the priest . “ Look here , ”[133-anthea] [she]133-anthea said in [her]133-anthea kind little voice , “ [we]4058-we want to be [friends]3669-friends . [We]4058-we want to help [you]3339-the priest . Let ’s make a treaty . Let ’s join together to get the Amulet — the whole one , [I]133-anthea mean . And then it shall belong to [you]3339-the priest as much as to [us]4058-we , and [we]4058-we shall all get [our]4058-we hearts ’ desire . ”[133-anthea] “ Fair words , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest , “ grow no onions . ”[133-anthea] “ [We]4058-we say , ‘ Butter no parsnips , ’ ”[134-jane] [Jane]134-jane put in . “ But do n’t [you]3339-the priest see [we]4058-we want to be fair ? Only [we]4058-we want to bind [you]3339-the priest in the chains of honour and upright dealing . ”[134-jane] “ Will [you]3339-the priest deal fairly by [us]4058-we ? ”[132-robert] said [Robert]132-robert . “ [I]3339-the priest will , ”[3339-the priest] said [the Priest]3339-the priest . “ By the sacred , secret name that is written under [the Altar of Amen‐Rā]4064-the altar of amen‐rā , [I]3339-the priest will deal fairly by [you]3339-the priest . Will [you]3339-the priest , too , take the oath of honourable partnership ? ”[3339-the priest] “ No , ”[133-anthea] said [Anthea]133-anthea , on the instant , and added rather rashly . “ [We]4058-we do n’t swear in [England]8-england , except in [police‐courts]4065-police‐courts , where [the guards]3174-the guards are , [you]3339-the priest know , and [you]3339-the priest do n’t want to go [there]321-there . But when [we]4058-we say [we]4058-we ’ll do a thing — it ’s the same as an oath to [us]4058-we — [we]4058-we do it . [You]3339-the priest trust [us]4058-we , and [we]4058-we ’ll trust [you]3339-the priest . ”[133-anthea] [She]133-anthea began to unbind [his]2144-his legs , and [the boys]313-the boys hastened to untie [his]2144-his arms . When [he]2144-his was free [he]2144-his stood up , stretched [his]2144-his arms , and laughed . “ Now , ”[2144-his] [he]2144-his said , “ [I]2144-his am stronger than [you]3339-the priest and [my]2144-his oath is void . For there is no secret , sacred name under [the altar of Amen‐Rā]4064-the altar of amen‐rā . ”[2144-his] “ Oh , yes there is ! ”[2347-every one] said a voice from under the bed . [Every one]2347-every one started — Rekh‐marā most of all . [Cyril]131-cyril stooped and pulled out the bath of sand where [the Psammead]136-the psammead slept . “ [You]131-cyril do n’t know everything , though [you]131-cyril are [a Divine Father of [the Temple of Amen]3726-the temple of amen]4069-a divine father of the temple of amen , ”[131-cyril] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead shaking itself till the sand fell tinkling on the bath edge . “ There is a secret , sacred name beneath the altar of [Amen‐Rā]267-amen‐rā . Shall [I]131-cyril call on that name ? ”[131-cyril] “ No , no ! ”[3339-the priest] cried [the Priest]3339-the priest in terror . “ No , ”[134-jane] said [Jane]134-jane , too . “ Do n’t let ’s have any calling names . ”[134-jane] “ Besides , ”[243-rekh‐marā] said [Rekh‐marā]243-rekh‐marā , who had turned very white indeed under [his]243-rekh‐marā natural brownness , “ [I]243-rekh‐marā was only going to say that though there is n’t any name under — ”[243-rekh‐marā] “ There is , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead threateningly . “ Well , even if there was n’t , [I]136-the psammead will be bound by the wordless oath of [[your]131-cyril strangely upright land]4071-your strangely upright land , and having said that [I]136-the psammead will be [[your]131-cyril friend]1278-your friend — [I]136-the psammead will be it . ”[136-the psammead] “ Then that ’s all right , ”[136-the psammead] said [the Psammead]136-the psammead ; “ and there ’s the tea‐bell .
